original: @1b # // tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las le'u gsum pa /
analyzed: @1b # // tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las le'u gsum pa /
translated: Chapter Three

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: da ltar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid thun mong ba bshad nas /
analyzed: da ltar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid thun mong ba bshad nas /
translated: Now, having explained the common definition of valid cognition,

original: da ni de'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩmngon sum dang ni rjes dpag gis //üîΩtshad ma gnyis te 'dra bdag nyid //
analyzed: da ni de'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir / mngon sum dang ni rjes dpag gis // tshad ma gnyis te 'dra bdag nyid //
translated: in order to teach its divisions,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /üîΩslu ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te / slu ba med pa'i phyir tshad ma'o //
translated: [the root text] says:üîΩThere are two valid cognitions:üîΩperception and inference.üîΩThe definition of valid cognition is that which is undeceptive.

original: slu ba med pa nyid kyang don las skyes pas don la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slu ba med pa nyid kyang don las skyes pas don la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is undeceptive because it arises from an object, and thus it is non-erroneous with respect to that object.

original: ji ste don la mi slu ba nyid kyang ji ltar shes par bya zhing /
analyzed: ji ste don la mi slu ba nyid kyang ji ltar shes par bya zhing /
translated: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow is it known that it is undeceptive with respect to the object?‚Äù

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis tshad mar 'gyur gyi sgra las byung ba la sogs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis tshad mar 'gyur gyi sgra las byung ba la sogs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: [The answer is:] valid cognition is only perception and inference, not verbal cognition and so on.

original: tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa kho na ste /
analyzed: tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa kho na ste /
translated: Valid cognition is only perception and inference.

original: 'dis ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i 'dod pa bkag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i 'dod pa bkag par 'gyur ro //
translated: This refutes the assertion of the LokƒÅyata.

original: de bas na rjes su dpag pas 'jig rten pha rol dang thams cad mkhyen pa grub par nges pas de'i don du dang po tshad ma'i dbye ba brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na rjes su dpag pas 'jig rten pha rol dang thams cad mkhyen pa grub par nges pas de'i don du dang po tshad ma'i dbye ba brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since it is certain that the existence of other worlds and omniscience are established by inference, the first division of valid cognition is stated for that purpose.

original: tshad ma gzhan med par nges par gyur na tshad ma gnyis kho na zhes nges par gzung bar rigs kyi /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan med par nges par gyur na tshad ma gnyis kho na zhes nges par gzung bar rigs kyi /
translated: If it is certain that there is no other valid cognition, it is correct to maintain that there are only two valid cognitions.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /üîΩtshad ma gzhan 'gegs pa yang mngon sum dang @2a * //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te / tshad ma gzhan 'gegs pa yang mngon sum dang @2a * //
translated: But it is not so in other cases.

original: rjes su dpag pa dag gis yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dag gis yin nam /
translated: If another valid cognition is refuted, is it by direct perception or inference?

original: yang na tshad ma gzhan las yin grang na /üîΩde la phyogs dang po 'dzin pa de lta na ni tshad ma gzhan khegs par nges na tshad ma gnyis su grub la /
analyzed: yang na tshad ma gzhan las yin grang na / de la phyogs dang po 'dzin pa de lta na ni tshad ma gzhan khegs par nges na tshad ma gnyis su grub la /
translated: Or is it by another valid cognition?üîΩIf the first position is accepted, then if another valid cognition is refuted, it is established that there are two valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma gnyis su grub na ni tshad ma gzhan med par nges pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis su grub na ni tshad ma gzhan med par nges pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if there are two valid cognitions, it is certain that there is no other valid cognition. Thus there is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin pa de'i tshe tshad ma gnyis su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa yin pa de'i tshe tshad ma gnyis su mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if the second position is accepted, then there are not two valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma gzhan med pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan po nyid yod pa'i phyir ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan med pa sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma gzhan po nyid yod pa'i phyir ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that there is another valid cognition that establishes the nonexistence of another valid cognition?

original: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas /
analyzed: de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir rnam 'grel mdzad pas /
translated: In order to dispel that, the author of the PramaÃÑnÔ¨Å avaÃÑrtika says:

original: gzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis phyir tshad ma gnyis //
translated: Because there are two kinds of objects of comprehension, there are two kinds of valid cognitions.

original: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
analyzed: don byed nus dang mi nus phyir //
translated: Because they are able and unable to perform a function,

original: skra shad la sogs don min te //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs don min te //
translated: The hairs and so forth are not objects,

original: don du mos pa med phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don du mos pa med phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because one does not have conviction in them as objects.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i bye brag gis tshad ma ni rnam pa gnyis kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i bye brag gis tshad ma ni rnam pa gnyis kho nar rtogs par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that valid cognition is of two kinds, direct perception and inference, because there are two kinds of objects of comprehension.

original: rtogs pa spyi dang khyad par gyi tshul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtogs pa spyi dang khyad par gyi tshul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the mode of apprehension is in terms of universals and particulars.

original: de las gzhan du rtogs pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan du rtogs pa'i rnam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no other mode of apprehension apart from these.

original: des na spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa khong du chud pa nyid rig pas shes pa ni /
analyzed: des na spyi dang khyad par gyi rnam pa khong du chud pa nyid rig pas shes pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the understanding of the mode of apprehension in terms of universals and particulars is knowledge by means of valid cognition.

original: tshad ma gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because another valid cognition is not observed.

original: de 'gegs pa'i sgrub byed yin pa de bas na tshad ma gzhan dang @2b ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de 'gegs pa'i sgrub byed yin pa de bas na tshad ma gzhan dang @2b ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is the proof that refutes that, it is not associated with another valid cognition.

original: 'on te gzhal bya'i rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir ji ltar yul rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gzhal bya'i rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir ji ltar yul rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: But if the object is a single nature, how can it be twofold?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig gzhal bya zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is explained that a single particular is the object of comprehension.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: yul gcig nyid yin yang shes pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir de ni rnam pa gnyis yin zhing /
analyzed: yul gcig nyid yin yang shes pa'i rnam pa gnyis kyi phyir de ni rnam pa gnyis yin zhing /
translated: Although the object is a single entity, it is twofold because of the two aspects of consciousness.

original: nyams su myong ba tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir tshad ma tha dad par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on te nyams su myong ba tha dad pa'i bye brag gis ji ltar yul tha dad de /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba tha dad pas tha dad pa'i phyir tshad ma tha dad par 'gyur ro // 'on te nyams su myong ba tha dad pa'i bye brag gis ji ltar yul tha dad de /
translated: Because of the difference of the two experiences, the valid cognitions are different.üîΩBut if the object is different because of the difference of the two experiences,

original: gzhan tha dad pas gzhan tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan tha dad pas gzhan tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin nam /
translated: how can it be that the difference of one thing is not the difference of another?

original: rta tha dad pas ba dkar po tha dad pa ni ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rta tha dad pas ba dkar po tha dad pa ni ma yin te 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference of a white cow is not the difference of a horse, because there is no relation.

original: nyams su myong ba'i yul yin yang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i yul yin yang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Even though it is the object of experience, it is not related to it.

original: de ltar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical,

original: 'di ltar dngos po thams cad kyi yod pa'i tha snyad ni nyams su myong ba la rag las pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po thams cad kyi yod pa'i tha snyad ni nyams su myong ba la rag las pa ste /
translated: because the convention of existence of all things depends on experience.

original: rtogs pa tha dad pas kyang yul tha dad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa tha dad pas kyang yul tha dad par shes par bya'o //
translated: And because of different realizations, the object is understood to be different.

original: gang gi tshe don bya ba byed pa ni mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid can dngos po nus pa nyid kyis rtogs pa de'i tshe rang gi rang bzhin gyis shes par bya ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe don bya ba byed pa ni mngon du byed pa'i mtshan nyid can dngos po nus pa nyid kyis rtogs pa de'i tshe rang gi rang bzhin gyis shes par bya ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: When the performance of an object‚Äôs function is understood by the thing‚Äôs capacity, which is characterized by manifestation, then it is a specific characteristic because it is understood by its own nature.

original: gang gi tshe dngos po brgyud nas nus pa med pas rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe thun mong gi rang bzhin gyis mtshon pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe dngos po brgyud nas nus pa med pas rtogs par byed pa de'i tshe thun mong gi rang bzhin gyis mtshon pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: When a thing is understood by its capacity indirectly, then it is a general characteristic because it is indicated by a common nature.

original: 'on te zla ba gnyis la sogs pa nus pa med pa nyid kyis rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te zla ba gnyis la sogs pa nus pa med pa nyid kyis rtogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that because a double moon and so on are understood by their incapacity,

original: spyi ru 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: spyi ru 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: they are general characteristics,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: skra shad la sogs pa rab rib can gyis mthong ba dang / skra las dmigs pa'i don mngon du'am be rgyud nas nus pa nyid kyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa rab rib can gyis mthong ba dang / skra las dmigs pa'i don mngon du'am be rgyud nas nus pa nyid kyis mi rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the hair seen by one with cataracts, etc. is not perceived as an object of the hair, and because the object is not perceived by the power of the continuum.

original: don du mos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don du mos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no belief in the object.

original: don du med par yang gnod pa can gyi tshad mas bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: don du med par yang gnod pa can gyi tshad mas bzhag pa'o //
translated: And because the non-existence of the object is established by a valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: 'dis kyang gzhal bya gnyis yin te //
analyzed: 'dis kyang gzhal bya gnyis yin te //
translated: This also has two objects.

original: 'dra dang mi 'dra nyid phyir dang // sgra yi yul dang yul min phyir //
analyzed: 'dra dang mi 'dra nyid phyir dang // sgra yi yul dang yul min phyir //
translated: Because of similarity and dissimilarity, and because of the object and non-object of sound.

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa na //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa na //
translated: When there is another reason,

original: blo ni yod dang med phyir ro ;
analyzed: blo ni yod dang med phyir ro ;
translated: the cognition is both existent and non-existent.

original: / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gang yang ji zhig ltar 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang yang ji zhig ltar 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis rtogs pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: that which is understood by a similar nature in some way is the universal characteristic.

original: gang mi 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis khong du chud pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: gang mi 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis khong du chud pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That which is comprehended by a dissimilar nature is the particular characteristic.

original: 'o na ba lang la sogs pa mdun na gnas pa thun mong du rtogs pa de ci spyi'i mtshan nyid ma @3a * //
analyzed: 'o na ba lang la sogs pa mdun na gnas pa thun mong du rtogs pa de ci spyi'i mtshan nyid ma @3a * //
translated: Then, what is the common understanding of the cow, etc. that are present in front? Is that the universal characteristic?

original: yin nam / de bzhin du dpes shes par gyur pa 'di ni ba min yin no snyam pa de yang spyi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yin nam / de bzhin du dpes shes par gyur pa 'di ni ba min yin no snyam pa de yang spyi yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And in the same way, the cognition that this is a cow because it is like a cow that was previously seen is also a universal.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis gang kho na rtogs pa de ni spyi yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis gang kho na rtogs pa de ni spyi yin gyi /
translated: That which is understood by the nature of similarity is a universal.

original: ba men la sogs pa la ni khyad par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ba men la sogs pa la ni khyad par shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of a cow that is different from a cow is a particular.üîΩBut it is not a particular because it is a universal.

original: 'on te 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis snang ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te 'dra ba'i rang bzhin gyis snang ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: If you say that the appearance is by the nature of similarity,

original: ba men gyi gzugs tha dad pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ba men gyi gzugs tha dad pas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not by the difference of the form of a cow,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: 'dra bar mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra bar mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not known as similar.

original: 'o na ji ltar ba men 'di ni ba lang lta bu'o snyam du shes she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar ba men 'di ni ba lang lta bu'o snyam du shes she na /
translated: Well then, how is it known that this cow is like a cow?

original: lhag par zhen kyang 'dra ba log par 'dzin pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: lhag par zhen kyang 'dra ba log par 'dzin pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Even if one is attached to the excess, is it not the case that one apprehends the similarity incorrectly?

original: mdun na gnas pa'i ba min mthong ba ma gtogs par 'dra ba shes pa gzhan med de /
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i ba min mthong ba ma gtogs par 'dra ba shes pa gzhan med de /
translated: Apart from seeing a cow standing in front, there is no other cognition of similarity.

original: de bas na ba men las tha dad pa'i 'dra ba nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir dmigs pa med pa can nyid 'dra bar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na ba men las tha dad pa'i 'dra ba nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir dmigs pa med pa can nyid 'dra bar rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, since one does not experience a similarity that is different from the cow, the cognition of similarity is not based on an object.

original: rjes su dpag pa la ni dpe dang thun mong ba mi gsal ba'i yul snang ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la ni dpe dang thun mong ba mi gsal ba'i yul snang ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the case of inference, the example is not clear because it is a shared object.

original: de'i phyir de'i yul 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i yul 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, its object is similarity.

original: de lta na brda'i dus su mthong ba dran pa yang sgra'i yul yin pas spyi tshad ma'i yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na brda'i dus su mthong ba dran pa yang sgra'i yul yin pas spyi tshad ma'i yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: In that case, since memory of what was seen at the time of learning a word is the object of a word, would not a universal be the object of valid knowledge?

original: 'di la ni don min te /
analyzed: 'di la ni don min te /
translated: This is not so.

original: don du mos pa med phyir ro //
analyzed: don du mos pa med phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no interest in the object.

original: zhes pas lan btab zin to //üîΩsgra'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la ;
analyzed: zhes pas lan btab zin to // sgra'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin la ;
translated: This has already been explained.üîΩThe object of a word is a universal.

original: yul ma yin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul ma yin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the object of a word is not a specific instance?

original: 'o na gal te sgra'i yul spyi yin na ni sgra kun tshad mar 'gyur te spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sgra'i yul spyi yin na ni sgra kun tshad mar 'gyur te spyi'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If the object of a word is a universal, then all words would be valid knowledge because they have a universal as their object.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sgra gang yin pa de'i yul ni spyi yin la /üîΩsgra'i yul ni spyi nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i sgra gang yin pa de'i yul ni spyi yin la / sgra'i yul ni spyi nyid do zhes nges par gzung bar mi rung ste /
translated: The object of the sound of inference for the sake of another is a universal.üîΩBut it is not proper to hold that the object of sound is a universal.

original: 'on kyang sgra'i yul nyid spyi yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra'i yul nyid spyi yin zhing /
translated: However, it should be ascertained that the object of sound is a universal,

original: sgra'i yul ma yin pa ni spyi ma yin no //üîΩzhes nges par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra'i yul ma yin pa ni spyi ma yin no // zhes nges par bya'o //
translated: and that which is not the object of sound is not a universal.

original: de bzhin du sgra'i yul ma yin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra'i yul ma yin pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, it is not only the case that that which is not the object of sound is a particular,

original: 'on kyang sgra'i yul ma yin pa nyid rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgra'i yul ma yin pa nyid rang gi mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba'i don 'dod par bya'o //
translated: but rather the meaning of ‚Äúthat which is not the object of sound is a particular‚Äù should be accepted.

original: de bas na sgra'i yul kha cig ni spyi yin la /
analyzed: de bas na sgra'i yul kha cig ni spyi yin la /
translated: Therefore, some objects of sound are universals,

original: la la ni don med pa'o //
analyzed: la la ni don med pa'o //
translated: and some are unreal.

original: de bzhin du sgra'i yul ma yin pa yang kha cig ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra'i yul ma yin pa yang kha cig ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Similarly, some objects that are not the object of sound are particulars,

original: la la ni don med pa'o //
analyzed: la la ni don med pa'o //
translated: and some are unreal.

original: gzhan yang yul las gzhan pa'i rgyu brda dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams yod @3b na ;
analyzed: gzhan yang yul las gzhan pa'i rgyu brda dang yid la byed pa la sogs pa rnams yod @3b na ;
translated: Moreover, there are causes other than the object, such as the sign, mental attention, and so on.

original: gang la blo yod pa de ni spyi yin te /
analyzed: gang la blo yod pa de ni spyi yin te /
translated: That which has a cognition is a universal.

original: yang gang na mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod kyang blo med pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: yang gang na mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod kyang blo med pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: That which does not have a cognition even though there are other causes such as the eye is a particular.

original: nges pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa ni snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The definition is as stated previously.

original: yang na mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan rnams yod na shes bya gang la blo yod pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: yang na mig la sogs pa'i rgyu gzhan rnams yod na shes bya gang la blo yod pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Or, that which has a cognition with regard to an object of knowledge when there are other causes such as the eye is a particular.

original: gang la rgyu gzhan rnams yod kyang blo med pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang la rgyu gzhan rnams yod kyang blo med pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: That which does not have a cognition even though there are other causes is a universal.

original: don mngon du byed pas shes par mi nus pa'i phyir snang du rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: don mngon du byed pas shes par mi nus pa'i phyir snang du rung ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not suitable to appear because it cannot be known by manifesting the object.

original: de la rang gi rang bzhin gyis shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la rang gi rang bzhin gyis shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: It is a particular because it is known by its own nature.

original: gzhan ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de lkog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de lkog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The other is a universal because it is hidden.

original: de ltar yin du chug na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yul dbye ba tshad ma gang gis shes te /
analyzed: de ltar yin du chug na mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi yul dbye ba tshad ma gang gis shes te /
translated: If that is so, by what valid knowledge is the division of the objects that have the characteristics of the manifest and the hidden known?

original: mngon sum gyis shes sam /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis shes sam /
translated: Is it by direct perception?üîΩOr is it by inference?

original: yang na rjes su dpag pas na //üîΩtshad ma gzhan gyis yin grang na //
analyzed: yang na rjes su dpag pas na // tshad ma gzhan gyis yin grang na //
translated: Or is it by another valid cognition?

original: de la gal te tshad ma gzhan gyis yul gnyis shes na ni rgyu dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: de la gal te tshad ma gzhan gyis yul gnyis shes na ni rgyu dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: If it is by another valid cognition, then it is contradictory to the cause,

original: yul sgrub pa'i tshad ma gsum pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul sgrub pa'i tshad ma gsum pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a third valid cognition that establishes the object.

original: 'on te tshad ma gnyis kyis yul gnyis sgrub pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te tshad ma gnyis kyis yul gnyis sgrub pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: But if the two valid cognitions establish the two objects,

original: gzhal bya gnyis kyis tshad ma gnyis dang / tshad ma gnyis kyis kyang gzhal bya gnyis sgrub pa'i phyir gsal bar phan tshun rten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis kyis tshad ma gnyis dang / tshad ma gnyis kyis kyang gzhal bya gnyis sgrub pa'i phyir gsal bar phan tshun rten pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the two objects would establish the two valid cognitions, and the two valid cognitions would also establish the two objects, so there would be the fault of mutual dependence.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas yul tha dad par sgrub na lkog tu gyur pa ji ltar dpog ste /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas yul tha dad par sgrub na lkog tu gyur pa ji ltar dpog ste /
translated: But if the difference of objects is established by inference, how can the hidden be inferred?

original: rjes su dpag pa de ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de ni mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that inference is preceded by direct perception.

original: lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin la /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin la /
translated: Direct perception does not engage the hidden.

original: 'jug na ni rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug na ni rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it did engage, inference would be pointless.

original: gal te yang mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug na ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa la 'jug na ji ltar lkog tu gyur pa yin te /
translated: But if it engages a hidden object, then how could it be hidden?

original: mngon sum log pa nyid kyi dngos po ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum log pa nyid kyi dngos po ni lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a thing that is the opposite of direct perception is hidden.

original: lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum mi 'jug pas des de shes na ni 'gal bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum mi 'jug pas des de shes na ni 'gal bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since direct perception does not engage a hidden object, if it were to know it, then this would be contradictory.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi yul ni mngon sum gyis nyams su myong bas lkog tu gyur pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyi yul ni mngon sum gyis nyams su myong bas lkog tu gyur pa la tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the object of direct perception is experienced by direct perception, there is no valid knowledge in regard to hidden objects.

original: gzhal bya gnyis rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis rtogs pa med do //
translated: Thus, since the two objects are not established, there is no realization of the two objects.

original: de bas na yul gnyis ma grub na ji ltar sgrub byed yin /
analyzed: de bas na yul gnyis ma grub na ji ltar sgrub byed yin /
translated: Therefore, if the two objects are not established, how could they be established by a proof?

original: gzhan yang gal te yul gnyis yin pa de lta na yang tshad ma gnyis su ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te yul gnyis yin pa de lta na yang tshad ma gnyis su ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the two objects are objects, then how could there be two valid cognitions?

original: 'di ltar / 'brel pa ma grub par rtags nges par @4a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'brel pa ma grub par rtags nges par @4a * //
translated: In that case, a reason that does not establish a relationship

original: byed pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: byed pa ni ma yin la /
translated: does not ascertain the object.

original: 'brel pa nyams su myong ba yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma las skyes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa nyams su myong ba yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma las skyes pa ma yin te /
translated: And the experience of a relationship is not produced by the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: gnyis nyid ni spyi yin pas ji ltar mngon sum gyis shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: gnyis nyid ni spyi yin pas ji ltar mngon sum gyis shes par 'gyur /
translated: Since duality is a universal, how could it be known by direct perception?

original: tshad ma gnyis su ma grub par yang des ji ltar tshad ma gnyis su 'thad pa yin /
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis su ma grub par yang des ji ltar tshad ma gnyis su 'thad pa yin /
translated: And if it is not established by the two valid cognitions, how could it be tenable that the two valid cognitions exist?

original: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nges pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore it is indeterminate.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: mngon sum kho na yul gnyis grub pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum kho na yul gnyis grub pa yin te /
translated: Only direct perception establishes the two objects.

original: shes pa'i chos ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa'i chos ni thun mong dang thun mong ma yin par rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the object of consciousness is understood to be common and uncommon.

original: shes pa'i chos kyang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i chos kyang rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The object of consciousness is also to be understood by the direct perception of reflexive awareness.

original: shes pa ni rang bzhin la 'khrul par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni rang bzhin la 'khrul par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical for consciousness to be mistaken with respect to its nature.

original: rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid yod du chug na yang tshad ma tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid yod du chug na yang tshad ma tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if the existence of distinct realizations is accepted, how could there be distinct valid cognitions?

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tha snyad las tshad mar grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi tha snyad las tshad mar grub pa ste /
translated: It is established that valid knowledge is that which has the character of engagement and exclusion.

original: de ltar na spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan par brjod pa la /
analyzed: de ltar na spyi'i mtshan nyid bstan par brjod pa la /
translated: Thus, in the explanation of the teaching on the universal characteristics,

original: 'dir ni tha dad pa'i tha snyad tsam bsgrub byar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni tha dad pa'i tha snyad tsam bsgrub byar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the mere difference of the conventions is the probandum.

original: de la gang dag mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la gang dag mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid de /
translated: In this regard, some say that perception is conceptual.

original: dper na me 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed par nges pa'o zhes smra ba de'i ngor tshad ma gnyis po 'di dag bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na me 'di ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed par nges pa'o zhes smra ba de'i ngor tshad ma gnyis po 'di dag bstan par bya'o //
translated: For example, this fire is certain to perform the desired function. For that person, these two valid cognitions should be taught.

original: shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir dang snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir yang phyi rol gyi dngos po ni tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir dang snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir yang phyi rol gyi dngos po ni tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If external things are different because of the difference in aspects of consciousness and the difference in appearances,

original: ci'i phyir tshad ma tha dad pa ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshad ma tha dad pa ma yin /
translated: why are the valid cognitions not different?

original: snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi dngos po las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba'i rang bzhin nyid kyi dngos po las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the nature of appearance from things.

original: de la me'i rang bzhin sreg pa'i rnam pa can mngon sum gyis grub pa ste /
analyzed: de la me'i rang bzhin sreg pa'i rnam pa can mngon sum gyis grub pa ste /
translated: In that case, the nature of fire, which has the aspect of burning, is established by perception.

original: mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is manifested.

original: me'i rang bzhin ni mngon sum ste /
analyzed: me'i rang bzhin ni mngon sum ste /
translated: The nature of fire is perception.

original: gsal bar myong ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gsal bar myong ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is experienced clearly.

original: / sngar mthong ba'i don byed pa nyid dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa can nyid yin par khong du chud pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: / sngar mthong ba'i don byed pa nyid dang 'dra ba'i rnam pa can nyid yin par khong du chud pa ni lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin no //
translated: The understanding that the form of the object is the same as the object seen previously is the domain of inference, because it is hidden.

original: mngon sum nyid me la 'jug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid me la 'jug par byed pa ste /
translated: Direct perception is the engagement with fire.

original: de las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i rjes su dpag pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Inference is not born from that.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it not a valid cognition?

original: de la ji srid mngon sum dang lhan cig pa tsam gyis tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: de la ji srid mngon sum dang lhan cig pa tsam gyis tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: It is not a valid cognition merely by being simultaneous with direct perception,

original: lus dang sa la sogs pa yang tshad mar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: lus dang sa la sogs pa yang tshad mar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the body, earth, and so on would also become valid cognitions.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'brang bas te /
analyzed: thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gnas pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'brang bas te /
translated: Everything that exists as a causal entity follows existence and nonexistence.

original: rjes su dpag pa med par mngon @4b sum gcig pus 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med par mngon @4b sum gcig pus 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Without inference, there is no engagement with direct perception alone.

original: des na gnyi ga tshad ma ste 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na gnyi ga tshad ma ste 'jug par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, both are valid cognitions because they engage.

original: rjes su dpag pa med par yang mngon sum gcig pu goms pa phul du byung ba las 'jug par mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med par yang mngon sum gcig pu goms pa phul du byung ba las 'jug par mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it seen that, without inference, one engages in the object through the mere cultivation of direct perception?

original: rtags las nges par 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rtags las nges par 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because there is no ascertainment through a reason.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dang po mngon sum gcig pu 'jug par byed par mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po mngon sum gcig pu 'jug par byed par mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not seen that direct perception alone initially engages in the object.

original: shin tu goms pas 'jug pa yod du chug na yang /
analyzed: shin tu goms pas 'jug pa yod du chug na yang /
translated: Even if it is allowed that it engages through great cultivation,

original: sngar rjes su dpag pa med par nam yang mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin par 'thad do //
analyzed: sngar rjes su dpag pa med par nam yang mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa tshad ma yin par 'thad do //
translated: since direct perception never engages in the object without inference previously, it is tenable that inference is a valid means of knowledge.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar goms pa phul du byung ba'i tshe rjes su dpag pa med par yang mngon sum 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du mngon sum med par yang du ba las me la 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir mngon sum yang
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar goms pa phul du byung ba'i tshe rjes su dpag pa med par yang mngon sum 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin pa de bzhin du mngon sum med par yang du ba las me la 'jug par mthong ba'i phyir mngon sum yang
translated: Moreover, just as it is not a valid means of knowledge because it engages in the object without inference when there is the cultivation of great familiarity, in the same way, since it is seen that one engages in fire from smoke without direct perception, direct perception

original: 'jug par byed pa min par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa min par 'gyur ro //
translated: would not be a valid means of knowledge.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa tshad ma nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that inference is not a valid cognition,

original: 'jug par byed pa mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa mtshungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: then is it not the same for engagement?

original: mngon sum tshad ma ma yin la rjes su dpag pa ma yin zhes ji ltar dpyod par byed /
analyzed: mngon sum tshad ma ma yin la rjes su dpag pa ma yin zhes ji ltar dpyod par byed /
translated: How can you analyze whether or not direct perception is a valid cognition and whether or not inference is not a valid cognition?

original: 'jug par byed pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa las gzhan pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition other than engagement.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyi ga tshad ma nyid do //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyi ga tshad ma nyid do //
translated: Therefore both direct perception and inference are valid cognitions.

original: gzhan yang gal te mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa'i sreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa nyid kyang grub na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa'i sreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa nyid kyang grub na /
translated: Moreover, if direct perception establishes the existence of the object‚Äôs activity, such as burning, which is hidden,

original: 'o na ni lkog tu gyur pa thams cad myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni lkog tu gyur pa thams cad myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then all hidden phenomena would be experienced.

original: des na thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore everyone would know everything.

original: 'on te me'i rang bzhin sreg pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te me'i rang bzhin sreg pa la sogs pa'i bya ba byed pa dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: But if the nature of fire is related to the activity of burning,

original: lkog tu gyur pa gzhan thams cad la ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir de dag 'dzin ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa gzhan thams cad la ni mngon sum gyi rang bzhin dang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir de dag 'dzin ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But all other hidden things are not apprehended, because they are not related to the nature of perception.

original: de lta yin bas na 'brel pa las rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta yin bas na 'brel pa las rtogs pa ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin nam /
translated: If that is so, then is the understanding from a relation not inference?

original: 'brel pa las rig pa ma gtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan ni kho bo yang mi 'dod la /
analyzed: 'brel pa las rig pa ma gtogs pa'i rjes su dpag pa gzhan ni kho bo yang mi 'dod la /
translated: I also do not accept any inference other than the understanding from a relation.

original: des na 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gang khong du chud pa'i don byed pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na ste myong bas grub po //
analyzed: des na 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis gang khong du chud pa'i don byed pa de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na ste myong bas grub po //
translated: Therefore, that which is understood by means of a similar nature is only a universal, which is established by experience.

original: de dag gis ni 'bras bu'i rtags kyi yul bstan nas //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'bras bu'i rtags kyi yul bstan nas //
translated: Having thus taught the object of the effect reason,

original: sgra'i yul yang sgra las byung ba'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba nyid de /üîΩsgra las byung ba'i shes pa de nyid ni rang gi snang ba'i @5a * //
analyzed: sgra'i yul yang sgra las byung ba'i shes pas rtogs par bya ba nyid de / sgra las byung ba'i shes pa de nyid ni rang gi snang ba'i @5a * //
translated: the object of sound is also to be understood by the cognition arising from sound.

original: yul yin par bstan to //
analyzed: yul yin par bstan to //
translated: That cognition arising from sound itself is taught to be the object of its own appearance.

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi spyod yul bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi spyod yul bstan to //
translated: This teaches the domain of the essential reason.

original: dpes ba lang gi dngos po dang 'dra bar nges pa ste /
analyzed: dpes ba lang gi dngos po dang 'dra bar nges pa ste /
translated: The ascertainment is like the entity of the cow.

original: ba lang ba men 'dra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba lang ba men 'dra zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like saying, ‚ÄúThe cow is like the gayal.‚Äù

original: de la yang ngo bo nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: de la yang ngo bo nyid mngon sum gyis rtogs par bya ba nyid yin la /
translated: In that case, the entity is to be realized by direct perception.

original: 'dra ba ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Similarity is the object of the cognition that arises from words.

original: 'di ltar 'di dang 'dra ba ni ba lang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di dang 'dra ba ni ba lang yin la /
translated: Thus, that which is similar to this is a cow.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni 'di'o zhes don gcig la 'dra ba'i shes pa gnyis la dmigs pa ste mngon sum gyis ni gnyi ga rtogs par mi nus so //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni 'di'o zhes don gcig la 'dra ba'i shes pa gnyis la dmigs pa ste mngon sum gyis ni gnyi ga rtogs par mi nus so //
translated: That which is similar to that is this. The two cognitions of similarity refer to the same object. Direct perception is not able to realize both.

original: des na 'dra ba ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i yul nyid de /
analyzed: des na 'dra ba ni sgra las byung ba'i shes pa'i yul nyid de /
translated: Therefore, similarity is the object of the cognition that arises from words.

original: rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs ni tha snyad skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gtan tshigs ni tha snyad skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: The natural reason generates a convention.

original: 'di ni 'dra ba'i tha snyad du rung ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dra ba'i tha snyad du rung ba ste /
translated: This is suitable as the convention of similarity.

original: de'i rnam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aspect of that is seen.

original: ba lang dang ba men gyi rnam pa yang snga phyi'i mngon sum nyid kyis dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ba lang dang ba men gyi rnam pa yang snga phyi'i mngon sum nyid kyis dmigs pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the cow and the aspect of the gayal are also observed by the direct perception of the prior and the later.

original: de bas na sgra'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: de bas na sgra'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object of sound is not its own characteristic.

original: sgra bzhin du rtog pa yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sgra bzhin du rtog pa yang shes par bya ste /
translated: And like sound, the object of thought should be understood.

original: rtog pa'i yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa'i yul zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase ‚Äúthe object of thought.‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa na /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa na /
translated: When there is another reason,

original: blo med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni mi dmigs pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: blo med pa'i phyir zhes bya bas ni mi dmigs pa ston pa ste /
translated: the phrase ‚Äúbecause there is no cognition‚Äù teaches nonapprehension.

original: gang na don yod pa dang med pa na shes pa 'jug pa la lar nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi phyir don gzhan myong ba med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gang na don yod pa dang med pa na shes pa 'jug pa la lar nges pa'i rnam pa can gyi phyir don gzhan myong ba med par shes par bya ste /
translated: When an object exists or does not exist, cognition sometimes engages it with a determinate aspect. Therefore, one should understand that cognition does not experience another object.

original: thams cad 'dzin pa'i shes pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde bas na tshad ma gnyis su smra bas so sor nges pa'i rnam pa myong ba nyid las /
analyzed: thams cad 'dzin pa'i shes pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro // de bas na tshad ma gnyis su smra bas so sor nges pa'i rnam pa myong ba nyid las /
translated: Because a cognition that apprehends everything is not seen.

original: de las gzhan pa med par rtogs so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa med par rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, the proponents of two types of valid knowledge understand that the determinate aspect is experienced and that there is no other object apart from that.

original: 'dis kyang 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba la sogs pa mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul don byed par nus pa dang mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba nges par byed de /
analyzed: 'dis kyang 'dra ba dang mi 'dra ba la sogs pa mngon sum dang lkog tu gyur pa'i yul don byed par nus pa dang mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba nges par byed de /
translated: This also ascertains that a similar or dissimilar object is either a perceptible object that is able to perform a function or an imperceptible object that is unable to perform a function.

original: de ni phyi nas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phyi nas bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be taught later.

original: de la gang lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum gyi tshad ma mi 'jug ces bya ba smras pa de la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gang lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum gyi tshad ma mi 'jug ces bya ba smras pa de la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here, it is said that direct perception does not engage with what is hidden.

original: mngon sum ni so sor nges pa'i rnam pa can te /
analyzed: mngon sum ni so sor nges pa'i rnam pa can te /
translated: Direct perception has the aspect of individual determination.

original: de las gzhan pa lkog tu gyur par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa lkog tu gyur par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that it is different from that, being hidden.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i don mngon sum gyis shes pa ma yin yang lkog tu gyur pa'i don yod pa ste /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i don mngon sum gyis shes pa ma yin yang lkog tu gyur pa'i don yod pa ste /
translated: Although the meaning of what is hidden is not known through direct perception, the meaning of what is hidden exists.

original: de la mngon sum 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mngon sum 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Direct perception does not engage with that.

original: gal te mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ni mi 'jug pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum lkog tu gyur pa'i don la ni mi 'jug pa ma yin nam /
translated: If direct perception does not engage with the meaning of what is hidden,

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi chos de ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi chos de ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: how is that hidden phenomenon known?

original: lkog tu gyur pa rig pa de'i rang bzhin lkog @5b tu ma gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa rig pa de'i rang bzhin lkog @5b tu ma gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of that knowledge of what is hidden is known to be non-hidden.

original: gal te na lkog tu gyur pa mngon sum gyis myong bar gyur na ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te na lkog tu gyur pa mngon sum gyis myong bar gyur na ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the hidden were experienced by direct perception, then the hidden would not be the nature of the hidden.

original: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis chos nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis chos nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not suitable for a phenomenon to be the nature of something different.

original: dngos po de nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po de nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is just like that thing itself.

original: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa dang 'brel pas de'i chos lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te lkog tu gyur pa dang 'brel pas de'i chos lkog tu gyur pa nyid yin na /
translated: But if the hidden is the nature of that thing because it is related to the hidden,

original: de lta na ni lkog tu gyur pa mngon sum gyis 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni lkog tu gyur pa mngon sum gyis 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case the hidden would be apprehended by direct perception.

original: de bas na lkog tu gyur pa nyid dang 'brel pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis gdon mi za bar lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po yang gzung bar 'gyur ba de bas na lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po yang mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: de bas na lkog tu gyur pa nyid dang 'brel pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i mngon sum gyis gdon mi za bar lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po yang gzung bar 'gyur ba de bas na lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po yang mngon sum nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro
translated: Therefore, there is no doubt that direct perception apprehending a thing related to the hidden also apprehends a hidden thing. Therefore it follows that a hidden thing would also be direct perception.

original: // de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa med par gyur te /
analyzed: // de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa med par gyur te /
translated: Therefore, inference would not operate.

original: mngon sum gyis rig pa nyid rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rig pa nyid rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the cognition of that is direct perception, not inference.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa nyid shes la /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa nyid shes la /
translated: Direct perception of reflexive awareness knows the hidden.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i chos can gyi dngos po la dbang po'i shes pa mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i chos can gyi dngos po la dbang po'i shes pa mi 'jug ste /
translated: The sensory consciousnesses do not engage with the entity of a hidden subject.

original: chos dang chos can gnyis shes pa gcig gis mi shes so //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gnyis shes pa gcig gis mi shes so //
translated: One cognition does not know both the property and the subject.

original: gnyis shes pa ni 'brel pa can nyid rtogs pa de bas na mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa nyid shes kyang nges par rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis shes pa ni 'brel pa can nyid rtogs pa de bas na mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa nyid shes kyang nges par rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Since the cognition of the two knows the relation, even though direct perception knows the hidden, inference engages because it definitely realizes it.

original: gzhan yang sgrub pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po las tha mi dad pa'i chos ni dngos po 'dzin pa med par rtogs par rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang sgrub pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po las tha mi dad pa'i chos ni dngos po 'dzin pa med par rtogs par rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, a property that is not different from the entity of the probandum is not known without apprehending the entity.

original: de'i phyir chos can dang lhan cig tshad ma gcig gi yul du gyur pa ni dngos po'i chos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can dang lhan cig tshad ma gcig gi yul du gyur pa ni dngos po'i chos so //
translated: Therefore, the property of an entity is the object of a single valid cognition together with the subject.

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni nges pa med pa ste /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid ni nges pa med pa ste /
translated: The hidden is not definite.

original: mngon sum ni chos can 'dzin pa la mi ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni chos can 'dzin pa la mi ltos pa yin no //
translated: Direct perception does not depend on the apprehension of a subject.

original: lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum mi 'jug pa yin nam /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum mi 'jug pa yin nam /
translated: But if the hidden is not engaged by direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag pa ji ltar 'jug ce na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ji ltar 'jug ce na /
translated: how is it engaged by inference?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here they say:

original: rjes su dpag pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi dngos po sgrub pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas lkog tu gyur pa nyid kyi dngos po sgrub pa ni ma yin na /
translated: Inference does not establish the hidden thing itself.

original: gang gis lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum 'jug par 'dod //
analyzed: gang gis lkog tu gyur pa la mngon sum 'jug par 'dod //
translated: But by what is the hidden engaged by direct perception?

original: 'on kyang lkog tu gyur pa ni mi gsal ba myong ba'i rang bzhin rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang lkog tu gyur pa ni mi gsal ba myong ba'i rang bzhin rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa nyid do zhes brjod do //
translated: However, the hidden is established by the direct perception of reflexive awareness, which has the nature of the experience of the unclear.

original: mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa nyid grub kyang don byed pa nus pa'i sreg par nges pa nyid bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis lkog tu gyur pa nyid grub kyang don byed pa nus pa'i sreg par nges pa nyid bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Even though the hidden is established by direct perception, the certainty of the hidden thing‚Äôs ability to perform a function must be established.

original: de la yang don byed pa la sngar mngon sum 'jug pa nyid yin pa de bas na phyis @6a * //
analyzed: de la yang don byed pa la sngar mngon sum 'jug pa nyid yin pa de bas na phyis @6a * //
translated: And in that case, since direct perception is engaged first with regard to the performance of a function,

original: rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no //
translated: after that, inference is engaged.

original: gzhan yang rjes su dpag pas rang gi mtshan nyid mngon du byed mi nus pa ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan yang rjes su dpag pas rang gi mtshan nyid mngon du byed mi nus pa ni lkog tu gyur pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, the fact that it is not possible to perceive a thing by means of inference is precisely its being hidden.

original: de ni rjes su dpog pa'i tshe yin no //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpog pa'i tshe yin no //
translated: And that is when it is inferred.

original: des na sngar mngon sum 'jug par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sngar mngon sum 'jug par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that perception is held to be engaged previously.

original: lkog tu gyur pa nyid la ni su yang don du gnyer ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa nyid la ni su yang don du gnyer ba ma yin te /
translated: But no one is interested in what is hidden,

original: gang gis de la mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis de la mngon sum 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: by whom perception would be engaged in it.

original: de mi 'dod kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin te myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi 'dod kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin te myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is not accepted, it is a thing‚Äôs own characteristic, because it is experienced.

original: de dag gis ni tshad ma'i nges pa yang brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gis ni tshad ma'i nges pa yang brjod pa ste /
translated: They also state the definition of valid cognition:

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po nges par gyur pas tshad ma de grub pa yin no //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po nges par gyur pas tshad ma de grub pa yin no //
translated: When there is certainty about a hidden thing, that valid cognition is established.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba nyid tsam la tshad ma zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po dang 'brel ba nyid tsam la tshad ma zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that valid cognition is merely the connection with a hidden thing.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po yod par ni rtags las shes pa'o //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po yod par ni rtags las shes pa'o //
translated: The existence of a hidden thing is known from a reason.

original: 'o na yul gnyis yin pas chad ma gnyis su ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na yul gnyis yin pas chad ma gnyis su ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Well, if the object is twofold, how can there be two valid cognitions?

original: yul ni rgyu yin la tshad ma gnyis ni 'bras bu yin pas rgyu las 'bras bu nges pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul ni rgyu yin la tshad ma gnyis ni 'bras bu yin pas rgyu las 'bras bu nges pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The object is the cause, and the two valid cognitions are the effects. Therefore, it is not the case that the effect is ascertained from the cause.

original: 'di ltar rgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu dang ldan pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: In this way, the cause does not necessarily possess the effect.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gzhal bya gnyis kyis tshad ma gnyis sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhal bya gnyis kyis tshad ma gnyis sgrub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The two valid cognitions are not established by the two objects.

original: 'on kyang tshogs pa srid pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa srid pa'i phyir tshad ma gnyis zhes brjod do //
translated: However, because the collection is possible, we say ‚Äútwo valid cognitions.‚Äù

original: tshogs pa srid pa yang 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa srid pa yang 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The possibility of the collection will be explained later.

original: yul gnyis nges par grub na tshad ma gnyis su bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yul gnyis nges par grub na tshad ma gnyis su bstan par bya ste /
translated: When ascertainment of the two objects is established, the two valid cognitions are taught.

original: 'di ltar shes pa gang yang yul gnyis grub pa de kho na tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa gang yang yul gnyis grub pa de kho na tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: In this way, any consciousness that establishes the two objects is a valid cognition.

original: tshad ma gcig las yul gnyis grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshad ma gcig las yul gnyis grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the two objects are not established by one valid cognition.

original: gang gi tshe yang tshad ma gzhan dgag pa'i don du yul gnyis bstan pa de'i tshe yul gzhan med pas tshad ma gzhan ldog par khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang tshad ma gzhan dgag pa'i don du yul gnyis bstan pa de'i tshe yul gzhan med pas tshad ma gzhan ldog par khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: When two objects are taught in order to refute another valid cognition, at that time, since there is no other object, the nonobservation of a pervader proves the absence of another valid cognition.

original: yul med pa'i tshad ma rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yul med pa'i tshad ma rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because a valid cognition without an object is not logical.

original: gzhal bya rang gi ngo bo nyid dam gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pas nyams su myong ba nyid med pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhal bya rang gi ngo bo nyid dam gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid med pas nyams su myong ba nyid med pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
translated: Because the object of comprehension does not exist as its own nature or as the nature of another, it is not experienced. Therefore how could it be a valid cognition?

original: yang na yul gnyis ni shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: yang na yul gnyis ni shes pa las tha dad pa ma yin te ;
translated: Or the two objects are not different from consciousness,

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa myong ba las ma gtogs pa gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa myong ba las ma gtogs pa gzhan tha dad pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because apart from the experience of the aspects of clarity and unclarity, there is no other object of comprehension that is different.

original: gang yang phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni gcig pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gang yang phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni gcig pa kho na ste /
translated: Moreover, external particularities are only singular.

original: des na yul gnyis zhes bya ba'i don ni rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na yul gnyis zhes bya ba'i don ni rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore the meaning of two objects is synonymous with two aspects.

original: ci ste mngon sum gyi @6b yul ni don dam par na spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: ci ste mngon sum gyi @6b yul ni don dam par na spyi'i mtshan nyid kho na ste /
translated: But if the object of direct perception is only the universal,

original: 'di ltar rdzas la sogs pa rnams yod pa dang 'brel pas yod par khas len pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzas la sogs pa rnams yod pa dang 'brel pas yod par khas len pa ma yin nam /
translated: then how can it be the object of direct perception, since it is related to existence, since it is accepted as existent?

original: dngos po gsum yod par byed pas yod pa zhes rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gsum yod par byed pas yod pa zhes rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that existence is that which causes the existence of the three entities.

original: rig byed kyi mthar smra ba na re yod pa nyid don dam pa ste /
analyzed: rig byed kyi mthar smra ba na re yod pa nyid don dam pa ste /
translated: The VedƒÅntins say that existence is ultimate,

original: mngon sum gyi yul yin la khyad par ni 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul yin la khyad par ni 'khrul pa'o //
translated: since it is the object of direct perception, and the particulars are mistaken.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar khyad par gyi yul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar khyad par gyi yul can yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be the object of a particular?

original: don gyi bya ba byed nus gang //
analyzed: don gyi bya ba byed nus gang //
translated: Whatever is able to perform a function is

original: de 'dir don dam yod pa ste //
analyzed: de 'dir don dam yod pa ste //
translated: here said to be ultimately existent.

original: gzhan ni kun rdzob yod pa yin //üîΩde dag rang spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad //
analyzed: gzhan ni kun rdzob yod pa yin // de dag rang spyi'i mtshan nyid bshad //
translated: The other is conventionally existent.

original: ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smos te /
translated: They are explained as the characteristics of the particular and the universal.

original: don bya ba byed nus pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid ni don dam pa ste ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos por yod pa'o //
analyzed: don bya ba byed nus pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de nyid ni don dam pa ste ma bcos pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos por yod pa'o //
translated: That which is able to perform a function is a thing‚Äôs own characteristic, and that is the ultimate, the nature of the unfabricated, the existent.

original: gang zhig don byed mi nus pa de ni gzhan te kun rdzob brtags nas yod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang zhig don byed mi nus pa de ni gzhan te kun rdzob brtags nas yod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which is not able to perform a function is other, the superficial, and is said to exist as a nominal imputation.

original: don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu yod pa de dag kho na la slob dpon gyis rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du bshad de /
analyzed: don dam pa dang kun rdzob tu yod pa de dag kho na la slob dpon gyis rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du bshad de /
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explained just those two, ultimate and superficial existences, as the own characteristic and the general characteristic.

original: don dam par yod pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Ultimate existence is the own characteristic.

original: kun rdzob tu yod pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes so //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod pa ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin no zhes so //
translated: Superficial existence is the general characteristic.

original: yod pa don dam pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa don dam pa ste /
translated: Existence is the ultimate.

original: de dang 'du bas 'brel bas dngos po rnams yod pa zhes gang brjod pa de dpyad par bya ste /üîΩyod pa dang 'brel pas yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'du bas 'brel bas dngos po rnams yod pa zhes gang brjod pa de dpyad par bya ste / yod pa dang 'brel pas yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since it is related to that, the connection is that things are said to exist. That should be analyzed.üîΩThey do not exist because of being related to existence.

original: yod pa nyid med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa nyid med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Existence itself does not exist because it is not observed.

original: gzhan yang yod pa yod pa dang 'brel pa yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan yang yod pa yod pa dang 'brel pa yin nam /
translated: Moreover, does existence exist in relation to existence?

original: yod pa dang 'brel pas yod pa yin grang na /
analyzed: yod pa dang 'brel pas yod pa yin grang na /
translated: Or does it exist because it is related to existence?

original: de la phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe yod pa dang 'brel pa las sngon rol nyid du yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po yin na de'i tshe yod pa dang 'brel pa las sngon rol nyid du yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If the first case is true, then prior to being related to existence, it would exist.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would exist inherently.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa la brten pa de'i tshe yod pa dang 'bral ba las ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa la brten pa de'i tshe yod pa dang 'bral ba las ri bong gi rva la sogs pa yang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the second case is true, then even the horns of a rabbit and so on would exist because they are related to existence.

original: 'on te don byed pa dang bral bas ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te don byed pa dang bral bas ngo bo nyid kyis med pa'i ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa yin na /
translated: But if the horns of a rabbit and so on do not exist because they are devoid of the capacity for functional performance,

original: 'o na ni gang don byed pa yod pa de ni yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni gang don byed pa yod pa de ni yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then since that which has the capacity for functional performance exists,

original: yod pa'i mtshan nyid don byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yod pa'i mtshan nyid don byed pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: the definition of existence would be the capacity for functional performance.

original: gzhan yang gal te yod pa dang 'brel pas yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te yod pa dang 'brel pas yod pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if existence exists in virtue of being related to existence,

original: spyi la sogs pa ni yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi la sogs pa ni yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then universals and so on would not exist.

original: 'on te yod pa yang yod pa gzhan dang 'brel pas yod na de lta na ni yod pa gzhan po yang yod pa gzhan dang @7a * //
analyzed: 'on te yod pa yang yod pa gzhan dang 'brel pas yod na de lta na ni yod pa gzhan po yang yod pa gzhan dang @7a * //
translated: But if that which exists exists in dependence on another existent, then that other existent would also exist in dependence on another existent.

original: 'brel pas yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pas yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'on te yod pa ngo bo nyid kyis yod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa ngo bo nyid kyis yod na ni /
translated: But if that which exists exists inherently,

original: de lta na rang gi mtshan nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis yod par ci ste khas mi len /
analyzed: de lta na rang gi mtshan nyid kyang ngo bo nyid kyis yod par ci ste khas mi len /
translated: why not accept that its own characteristic also exists inherently?

original: 'on te yod pa rtag cing ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa rtag cing ngo bo nyid kyis yod pa yin la /
translated: But if that which exists is permanent and exists inherently,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa dang 'brel pas yod par khas len na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni rtag pa ma yin pa'i phyir yod pa dang 'brel pas yod par khas len na /
translated: and if its own characteristic is not permanent, then why accept that it exists in dependence on that which exists?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'bras bu yin pas rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir yod pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'bras bu yin pas rgyu las skyes pa'i phyir yod pa yin la /
translated: Since its own characteristic is an effect, it exists in dependence on a cause.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'bras bu ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But since a universal is not an effect,

original: rgyu med pa ji ltar yod pa yin /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ji ltar yod pa yin /
translated: how could it exist without a cause?

original: rgyu med par gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes le'u dang por bstan zin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu med par gang yang yod pa ma yin no zhes le'u dang por bstan zin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Haven‚Äôt we already explained in the first chapter that nothing exists without a cause?

original: de'i phyir don gyi bya ba byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi bya ba byed pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yod pa ste /
translated: Therefore, only the intrinsic identity that performs the function of the object exists,

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the universal.

original: yod pa nyid mngon sum la snang gi / khyad par ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no zhes gang rjod par byed pa de la smras pa /
analyzed: yod pa nyid mngon sum la snang gi / khyad par ni mngon sum gyi yul ma yin no zhes gang rjod par byed pa de la smras pa /
translated: You may say that existence appears to perception, but the particular is not the object of perception.

original: mngon sum la snang ba gang yin pa de ni de'i yul te ;
analyzed: mngon sum la snang ba gang yin pa de ni de'i yul te ;
translated: We reply: Whatever appears to perception is its object.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na so sor nges par nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na so sor nges par nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: Only the intrinsic identity is individually experienced.

original: de las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa'i yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa'i yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Existence, whether different or not different from that, does not exist,

original: de nyams su ma myong bar ji ltar mngon sum gyi yul yin /
analyzed: de nyams su ma myong bar ji ltar mngon sum gyi yul yin /
translated: because if it is not experienced, how can it be the object of perception?

original: de bas na mngon sum la thun mong ma yin pa dang don byed pa'i dngos po gang snang ba de nyid don dam par yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum la thun mong ma yin pa dang don byed pa'i dngos po gang snang ba de nyid don dam par yod pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, whatever appears to perception, the uncommon thing that performs a function, is ultimately existent.

original: spyi ni rtogs pas sgro btags kho nar yod pa'o //
analyzed: spyi ni rtogs pas sgro btags kho nar yod pa'o //
translated: But the universal exists only as a superimposition by thought.

original: de lta mod kyi dngos po don bya ba byed nus pa cung zad kyang snang ba med na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi dngos po don bya ba byed nus pa cung zad kyang snang ba med na /
translated: But if nothing at all appears that is a real thing that can perform a function,

original: de ji ltar don byed nus pa dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar don byed nus pa dngos po'i mtshan nyid yin /
translated: how can the ability to perform a function be the characteristic of a real thing?

original: 'di ltar rtag pa'i ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa'i ma yin la /
translated: In this way, it is not permanent.

original: mi rtag pa'i yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i yang ma yin /
translated: Nor is it impermanent.

original: yul gyi yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yul gyi yang ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not an object.

original: shes pa'i yang ma yin pas /
analyzed: shes pa'i yang ma yin pas /
translated: Nor is it consciousness.

original: don byed nus pa dang / don bya ba byed pa ni med do //
analyzed: don byed nus pa dang / don bya ba byed pa ni med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no ability to perform a function and no performance of a function.

original: don yang mngon sum gyis sam /
analyzed: don yang mngon sum gyis sam /
translated: Moreover, an object is not known by direct perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas shes pa ma yin no //üîΩde la re zhig rtag pa la ni don byed nus pa med de /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas shes pa ma yin no // de la re zhig rtag pa la ni don byed nus pa med de /
translated: Nor is it known by inference.

original: tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: First, a permanent thing cannot perform a function because it is not different.

original: rtag pa ni khyab pa ste 'bras bu gang la yang nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir nus pa med pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa ni khyab pa ste 'bras bu gang la yang nus pa dang bral ba'i phyir nus pa med pa ste /
translated: A permanent thing is pervasive, but it is devoid of the ability to produce any effect. Therefore, it is unable.

original: ha cang thal ches so zhes le'u gnyis kar bstan to //üîΩ'on te khyab pa nus par ma gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: ha cang thal ches so zhes le'u gnyis kar bstan to // 'on te khyab pa nus par ma gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is demonstrated in both chapters.üîΩBut if it is not able to pervade,

original: ma khyab pa'i yin no zhe na de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma khyab pa'i yin no zhe na de ni ma yin te /
translated: then it is not able to be pervasive.

original: yul thams cad la ma khyab na rtag pa yod par ji ltar shes /
analyzed: yul thams cad la ma khyab na rtag pa yod par ji ltar shes /
translated: If it does not pervade all objects, how could it be known to exist?

original: ma rtogs pas so zhe na /
analyzed: ma rtogs pas so zhe na /
translated: If it is not known,

original: 'o na rtag pa @7b nyid kyi dngos po mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na rtag pa @7b nyid kyi dngos po mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not a permanent thing.

original: ji ltar dngos po yul thams cad du khyab pa nyid ma shes pa'i phyir de ltar dus thams cad dang 'brel pa can nyid du yang mi shes pas ji ltar rtag pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po yul thams cad du khyab pa nyid ma shes pa'i phyir de ltar dus thams cad dang 'brel pa can nyid du yang mi shes pas ji ltar rtag pa yin /
translated: Just as it is not known that a thing pervades all objects, so it is not known that it is related to all times. How could it be permanent?

original: dngos po mi rtag pa'i yang skad cig ma nyid kyis ji ltar don byed de /
analyzed: dngos po mi rtag pa'i yang skad cig ma nyid kyis ji ltar don byed de /
translated: Also, how could an impermanent thing perform a function by means of its momentariness?

original: 'di ltar skad cig tsam yod par gnas kyi byed pa med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig tsam yod par gnas kyi byed pa med do //
translated: In that case, it would endure for just a moment, but it would not perform a function.

original: 'o na de skad cig ma'i de ma thag pa'i dngos po gzhan nus par brjod na ni de'i rjes thogs su dngos pa gzhan yod pa yin yang de'i 'bras bu ma yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
