analyzed: 'o na de skad cig ma'i de ma thag pa'i dngos po gzhan nus par brjod na ni de'i rjes thogs su dngos pa gzhan yod pa yin yang de'i 'bras bu ma yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If you say that the thing that is the immediate antecedent of a moment is capable of producing it, then is it not the case that although another thing exists immediately after it, it is not its effect?

original: ji ltar dngos po thams cad kyi skad cig rnams ni phyi ma'i dngos po kun la ltos nas snga ma nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po thams cad kyi skad cig rnams ni phyi ma'i dngos po kun la ltos nas snga ma nyid de /
translated: How is it that all the moments of a thing are prior in dependence on a subsequent thing?

original: de nas snga mar gyur pa tsam gyis nus pa yin na thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas snga mar gyur pa tsam gyis nus pa yin na thams cad du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the mere prior existence of the cause that is the power, then everything would be the cause of everything.

original: 'on te so sor nges pa'i dngos po yod na dngos po gzhan skye bas thal ches pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te so sor nges pa'i dngos po yod na dngos po gzhan skye bas thal ches pa med do zhe na /
translated: But if the existence of the specific thing is the power, then there is no overextension of the cause, since another thing does not arise.

original: skad cig ma'i 'bras bu ni dngos po snga ma med na phyis 'byung ba'i dogs pa ci ltar yod de /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i 'bras bu ni dngos po snga ma med na phyis 'byung ba'i dogs pa ci ltar yod de /
translated: But how can the effect of the moment be doubted if the prior thing does not exist?

original: de'i tshe nyid de yod pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyid de yod pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because at that time it exists.

original: gzhan gyi tshe ni nam yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe ni nam yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But at another time it never exists.

original: 'on te rgyun la rgyu dang 'bras bu 'jog pa de bas thal ches pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyun la rgyu dang 'bras bu 'jog pa de bas thal ches pa med do zhe na /
translated: But if you posit cause and effect in a continuum, then there is no overextension.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: skad cig ma ma gtogs pa'i rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma ma gtogs pa'i rgyun med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no continuum apart from the moments.

original: 'on te rgyun ni med pa yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de nyid la yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on te rgyun ni med pa yin na ni de'i tshe rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de nyid la yin par 'gyur la /
translated: But if the continuum does not exist, then at that time the thing would be the cause and effect of itself.

original: skad cig ma rnams ni nus pa med pa'i phyir med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma rnams ni nus pa med pa'i phyir med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it follows that the moments are nonexistent because they are powerless.

original: 'on te skad cig ma dang 'brel pa'i rgyun la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pas de dag la yang rgyun dang 'bras bu yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma dang 'brel pa'i rgyun la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yod pas de dag la yang rgyun dang 'bras bu yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the continuum related to the momentary is the entity of cause and effect, and that therefore it has a continuum and an effect,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: rgyun tha dad pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pas gzhan la ni med de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun tha dad pa la rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pas gzhan la ni med de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the entity of cause and effect exists in a different continuum, it does not exist in another, because there is no relation.

original: rgyun yang skad cig ma rnams kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyun yang skad cig ma rnams kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir /
translated: And since the continuum is included in the momentary,

original: thams cad kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi 'bras bur 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be the effect of all.

original: rgyun yang rtag pa yin na 'bras bu ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyun yang rtag pa yin na 'bras bu ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: And if the continuum is permanent, it would not be an effect,

original: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be different.

original: skad cig ma yin na yang byed pa med pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir sngar brjod pa'i skyon yod pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin na yang byed pa med pas skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir sngar brjod pa'i skyon yod pa yin no //
translated: And if it is momentary, it would not be a producer, because it would not function, and the previously mentioned error would occur.

original: gzhan yang rgyun la 'bras bu nyid du 'jog na skad cig ma nyid rgyun gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyun la 'bras bu nyid du 'jog na skad cig ma nyid rgyun gzhan du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the continuum is posited as the effect, the momentary would be a different continuum.

original: de yang skad cig ma yin pas rgyu gzhan yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: de yang skad cig ma yin pas rgyu gzhan yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro//
translated: Since it is momentary, it would have another cause, and so there would be an infinite regress.

original: @8a * // gzhan yang gal te shes pa las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu yin pas rgyu yod pa yin na /
analyzed: @8a * // gzhan yang gal te shes pa las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu yin pas rgyu yod pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if it is a result that is different from consciousness, then it has a cause.

original: de'i tshe don byed pa yang rgyu gzhan las yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe don byed pa yang rgyu gzhan las yod pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, since the performance of a function would also exist due to another cause,

original: thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir dang po'i rgyu ji ltar yod pa yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po'i rgyu ji ltar yod pa yin /
translated: Therefore, how could the first cause exist?

original: shes pas ni thams cad yod par rigs te /
analyzed: shes pas ni thams cad yod par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable that consciousness exists,

original: 'on kyang shes pa la ni shes bya dang 'brel pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa la ni shes bya dang 'brel pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: but since the connection between consciousness and objects of knowledge is not ascertained,

original: ji ltar shes pa las shes bya rnam par gzhag par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa las shes bya rnam par gzhag par bya /
translated: how can objects of knowledge be posited from consciousness?

original: gzhan yang shes pas dngos po dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pas dngos po dag rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, consciousness would not ascertain things as the entity of cause and effect

original: mdun na gnas pa nyid kyi gnyi ga mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa nyid kyi gnyi ga mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not apprehend both as present before it.

original: shes pa'i skyed pa de /
analyzed: shes pa'i skyed pa de /
translated: The production of consciousness

original: 'on kyang shes pa 'di nyid kyis shes sam /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa 'di nyid kyis shes sam /
translated: is either produced by itself or by another.

original: 'on te shes pa gzhan gyis yin grang na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa gzhan gyis yin grang na /
translated: But if it is by another consciousness,

original: de la re zhig shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa 'bras bu nyid du shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig shes pa gzhan gyis shes pa 'bras bu nyid du shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: then first of all, consciousness is not known as an effect by another consciousness,

original: shes pa rang gi rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rang gi rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because consciousness has the nature of self-awareness.

original: shes pa de nyid kyis mngon sum du gyur pas 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa de nyid kyis mngon sum du gyur pas 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not known as an effect by that very consciousness, because it is not manifest.

original: mngon sum sngon du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum sngon du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not manifest, it is not an effect.

original: 'jug na yang shes pa de nyid kyi 'bras bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jug na yang shes pa de nyid kyi 'bras bur 'gyur te /
translated: If it were manifest, it would be the effect of that very consciousness,

original: de yang sngar 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang sngar 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not manifest earlier.

original: yang sngar 'jug pa na yang thug pa med par 'gyur pas ji ltar 'bras bu nyid yin /
analyzed: yang sngar 'jug pa na yang thug pa med par 'gyur pas ji ltar 'bras bu nyid yin /
translated: And if it were manifest earlier, it would be endless, so how could it be an effect?

original: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dus mtshungs pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dus mtshungs pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But if cause and effect are simultaneous,

original: de lta na 'o na ni bum pa dang snam bu yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni bum pa dang snam bu yang rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro /
translated: then a pot and a cloth would be cause and effect.

original: 'on te bum pa med par snam bu mthong ba'i phyir de la 'bras bu nyid med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa med par snam bu mthong ba'i phyir de la 'bras bu nyid med do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cloth is not the effect of the pot because the cloth is seen without the pot,

original: 'o na ni shes pa yang rmi lam la sogs par shes bya dang bral ba mthong ba'i phyir shes bya'i 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni shes pa yang rmi lam la sogs par shes bya dang bral ba mthong ba'i phyir shes bya'i 'bras bu nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: then consciousness is not the effect of the object of consciousness because consciousness is seen in dreams, etc., without an object of consciousness.

original: 'on te 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni gzhan nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te 'khrul pa'i shes pa ni gzhan nyid de /
translated: But if you say that the consciousness that is mistaken is one thing,

original: des 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des 'khrul pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and that it is not mistaken by that,

original: de lta na snam bu yang bum pa dang bral bar dmigs pas de yang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na snam bu yang bum pa dang bral bar dmigs pas de yang gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the cloth is also observed without the pot, so the cloth would be another thing.

original: 'on te snam bu de nyid yin par ngo shes pa yin na ni shes pa yang shes pa 'di nyid do zhes ngo shes par mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te snam bu de nyid yin par ngo shes pa yin na ni shes pa yang shes pa 'di nyid do zhes ngo shes par mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: But if the cloth is recognized as the same thing, then consciousness is the same because it is recognized as ‚Äúthis is the same consciousness.‚Äù

original: shes pa thams cad gcig par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad gcig par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore all consciousnesses would be one.

original: gal te ngo shes pa tshad ma yin na snam bu rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ngo shes pa tshad ma yin na snam bu rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if recognition is valid cognition, the cloth would be permanent.

original: gcig gis dngos po snga phyi'i rang bzhin du shes pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig gis dngos po snga phyi'i rang bzhin du shes pa ma yin te /
translated: One thing is not recognized as having the nature of an earlier and later thing.

original: sngar gyi shes pas snga ma tsam zhig 'dzin la /
analyzed: sngar gyi shes pas snga ma tsam zhig 'dzin la /
translated: The former consciousness apprehends only the former object,üîΩand the latter consciousness experiences only the latter object.

original: da lta'i shes @8b pas kyang da ltar ba myong ba'i phyir de dag nyid du shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: da lta'i shes @8b pas kyang da ltar ba myong ba'i phyir de dag nyid du shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not consciousnesses of those objects.

original: dran pa ni snga phyi dag la 'jug ste /
analyzed: dran pa ni snga phyi dag la 'jug ste /
translated: Memory engages the former and latter objects,

original: de tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not a valid cognition.

original: gzhan yang snga phyi'i shes pa dag phan tshun 'dre ba med na /
analyzed: gzhan yang snga phyi'i shes pa dag phan tshun 'dre ba med na /
translated: Moreover, if the former and latter consciousnesses do not mutually contact each other,

original: dran pa nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pas gcig pa nyid ji ltar sgrub pa yin /
analyzed: dran pa nyams su myong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pas gcig pa nyid ji ltar sgrub pa yin /
translated: how do you establish their identity by following the experience of memory?

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid du rig pa ni bdag yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa gcig pa nyid du rig pa ni bdag yin zhe na /
translated: If you say that the self is the one who knows the identity of a single vase,

original: de la gal te bdag gcig pu yin du chug na yang ji ltar gcig nyid rig par byed /
analyzed: de la gal te bdag gcig pu yin du chug na yang ji ltar gcig nyid rig par byed /
translated: then even if the self is a single entity, how does it know itself?

original: de yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po shes par byed do //
analyzed: de yang mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas dngos po shes par byed do //
translated: Moreover, valid cognitions such as perception cause the cognition of things.

original: 'on te bdag yod pa'i shes pa thams cad chad ma'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag yod pa'i shes pa thams cad chad ma'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that all cognitions of the existence of the self are valid cognitions,üîΩthen

original: gal te bdag yod du chug na yang gang su yang rung ba'i shes pa tshad ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te bdag yod du chug na yang gang su yang rung ba'i shes pa tshad ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But even if the self does exist, is not any cognition a valid cognition?

original: de lta na ni zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang yod pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then even the seeing of two moons would be an existent.

original: de bas na bdag yod kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag yod kyang mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, even if the self exists, direct perception and inference are the valid cognitions.

original: de dag gis kyang rtag pa shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang rtag pa shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: And they do not cognize the permanent self.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid dam /
translated: This is because the self itself

original: gzhan gyi snga phyi'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid dam shes pa gzhan gyis rtag par shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi snga phyi'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid dam shes pa gzhan gyis rtag par shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: is not cognized by a previous or later nature of itself or by another cognition.

original: de bas na shes pa'am shes bya'i 'bras bu nyid mi shes so //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa'am shes bya'i 'bras bu nyid mi shes so //
translated: Therefore, it is not known as the effect of cognition or the cognized.

original: shes pas ngo bo nyid rig cing de nyid gzung ba'o //
analyzed: shes pas ngo bo nyid rig cing de nyid gzung ba'o //
translated: Cognition is aware of its own nature and that itself is apprehended.

original: des na snga phyir mngon sum 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na snga phyir mngon sum 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that direct perception operates sequentially.

original: de med par yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de med par yang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: And how could the relation of cause and effect be understood without that?

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rgyu 'bras bu las snga ma nyid du dpog pa'am /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rgyu 'bras bu las snga ma nyid du dpog pa'am /
translated: But if you infer a cause from an effect, you infer that the cause precedes the effect.

original: rgyu dpag pas de las 'bras bu skye ba nyid du shes so zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu dpag pas de las 'bras bu skye ba nyid du shes so zhe na /
translated: Or if you infer the effect from the cause, you know that the effect arises from that cause.

original: mngon sum gyis rig pa ma gtogs par rjes su dpag pa skye ba ma yin no zhes snga ma nyid du brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis rig pa ma gtogs par rjes su dpag pa skye ba ma yin no zhes snga ma nyid du brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: We have already said that inference does not arise except through direct perception.

original: sngar gyi mngon sum tshad ma ma yin na rjes su dpag pa ji ltar tshad ma yin /
analyzed: sngar gyi mngon sum tshad ma ma yin na rjes su dpag pa ji ltar tshad ma yin /
translated: If the former direct perception is not valid knowledge, how can inference be valid knowledge?

original: 'on te rgyu snga ma rjes su dpag pas shes nas yang dpog na ni de lta na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te rgyu snga ma rjes su dpag pas shes nas yang dpog na ni de lta na thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you know the former cause through inference and then infer again, there would be an infinite regress.

original: gzhan yang phyi rol pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyi rol pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, because non-Buddhists do not exist,

original: de la don byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la don byed pa'i nus pa dang ldan pas ni ma yin te /
translated: it is not that they possess the ability to perform functions.

original: phyi rol pa ji ltar med pa de bzhin du bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol pa ji ltar med pa de bzhin du bstan par bya'o //
translated: We will show how non-Buddhists do not exist.

original: 'on te phyi rol med kyang shes pa nyid la phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te phyi rol med kyang shes pa nyid la phan tshun rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if external objects do not exist, consciousness itself has mutual causes and effects.

original: nus pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par yod pa brjod par bya'o zhe na //
analyzed: nus pa'i mtshan nyid don dam par yod pa brjod par bya'o zhe na //
translated: But if you say that the characteristic of potentiality is ultimate,

original: @9a * // de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: @9a * // de ni ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: mngon sum ni rang rig pa tsam gyi phyir des ji ltar 'bras bu nyid du go bar 'gyur /
analyzed: mngon sum ni rang rig pa tsam gyi phyir des ji ltar 'bras bu nyid du go bar 'gyur /
translated: Direct perception is merely reflexive awareness, so how could it be understood as the result?

original: gang gi tshe 'bras bu'i shes pa yod pa de'i tshe rgyu'i shes pa med pas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras bu'i shes pa yod pa de'i tshe rgyu'i shes pa med pas /
translated: When the result, the consciousness, exists, the cause, the consciousness, does not exist.

original: des ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rig pa yin /
analyzed: des ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rig pa yin /
translated: So how could it cognize the relationship of cause and effect?

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rgyu'i shes pa rtogs na ni 'o na ni de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas rgyu'i shes pa rtogs na ni 'o na ni de med pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that the cause, the consciousness, is understood through inference, then since it does not exist,

original: de ji ltar rjes su dpog par byed /
analyzed: de ji ltar rjes su dpog par byed /
translated: how could it be inferred?

original: 'on te snga ma nyid du rjes su dpag pas shes shing rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rang rig pas shes so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te snga ma nyid du rjes su dpag pas shes shing rang gi ngo bo nyid ni rang rig pas shes so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is understood through inference in the first place and its nature is understood through reflexive awareness,

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: then that is not correct.

original: snga ma nyid ni shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma nyid ni shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: The first is not the nature of consciousness.

original: de la mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis gnod pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is because it is undermined by direct perception.

original: 'di ltar ji srid shes pa nyams su myong ba de srid du da ltar byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid shes pa nyams su myong ba de srid du da ltar byung ba nyid de /
translated: As long as consciousness is experienced, it is present.

original: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid du nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma dang phyi ma nyid du nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not experienced as prior or subsequent.

original: de la dran pa tsam gyis kyang 'jug par byed de de tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dran pa tsam gyis kyang 'jug par byed de de tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: And it is engaged by memory alone, but that is not a valid cognition.

original: dran pa yang don dam par rang rig pa tsam nyid yin pa de bas rang rig pa la ngo bo nyid myong ba kho na ste /
analyzed: dran pa yang don dam par rang rig pa tsam nyid yin pa de bas rang rig pa la ngo bo nyid myong ba kho na ste /
translated: And memory is only the reflexive awareness of an object in the ultimate, therefore reflexive awareness is the experience of its own entity alone.

original: de ji ltar pha rol mi rig par de'i 'bras bu grub pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa'am shes bya la don bya ba byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ji ltar pha rol mi rig par de'i 'bras bu grub pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa'am shes bya la don bya ba byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: How can it be that consciousness or the object of consciousness does not perform its function, because it is established as the effect of that which does not cognize another?

original: gzhan yang 'bras bu yod pa la rgyu rigs pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'bras bu yod pa la rgyu rigs pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, it is illogical for a cause to exist when the effect exists.

original: med pa la yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: med pa la yang mi rigs te /
translated: And it is illogical for it not to exist.

original: 'di ltar gal te 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te 'bras bu med pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: Thus, if it is a cause when the effect does not exist,

original: ri bong gi rva la yang rgyu yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la yang rgyu yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then a cause would exist even for the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'on te gtan med pas de la rgyu med la /
analyzed: 'on te gtan med pas de la rgyu med la /
translated: But if it is utterly nonexistent, then it has no cause.

original: 'bras bu ni snga na med pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni snga na med pa ste /
translated: The effect is not existent prior to its existence.

original: phyis med pa ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩ'bras bu ni snga na med la /
analyzed: phyis med pa ni ma yin no zhe na / 'bras bu ni snga na med la /
translated: But it is not nonexistent later.

original: phyi nas yod par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi nas yod par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How can an effect be nonexistent prior to its existence and existent later?

original: ri bong gi rva med la snga na med pa med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva med la snga na med pa med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because the horn of a rabbit does not exist and is not nonexistent prior to its existence.

original: 'on te phyis mthong bas snga na med par shes na ni de ni gcig la gcig brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te phyis mthong bas snga na med par shes na ni de ni gcig la gcig brten pa'o //
translated: But if you think that it is known to be nonexistent prior to its existence because it is seen later, then this is a mutual dependence.

original: ji srid snga na med pa de srid phyis kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
analyzed: ji srid snga na med pa de srid phyis kyi 'bras bu ma yin te /
translated: As long as it is nonexistent prior to its existence, it is not the later effect.

original: ji srid ma skyes pa de srid du snga na med par ji ltar gnas /
analyzed: ji srid ma skyes pa de srid du snga na med par ji ltar gnas /
translated: As long as it is not arisen, how can it be nonexistent prior to its existence?

original: rgyu la 'bras bu stong pa nyid snga na med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu stong pa nyid snga na med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the effect‚Äôs emptiness of the cause prior to its existence is the nonexistence prior to its existence,

original: 'bras bu stong pa de ni rgyu med pa la yang yod pa ma yin nam ;
analyzed: 'bras bu stong pa de ni rgyu med pa la yang yod pa ma yin nam ;
translated: isn‚Äôt that empty effect also nonexistent in the absence of a cause?

original: de bas na de la yang rgyu yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na de la yang rgyu yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, a cause would also exist for that.

original: 'di ltar snga na med pa dang 'brel pas 'bras bu nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar snga na med pa dang 'brel pas 'bras bu nyid yin la /
translated: In this way, it is an effect because it is related to the nonexistence prior to its existence.

original: snga na med pa ni 'bras bus stong pa'i dngos po gzhan yin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa ni 'bras bus stong pa'i dngos po gzhan yin no //
translated: The nonexistence prior to its existence is a different thing that is empty of the effect.

original: 'bras bus stong pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bus stong pa ste /
translated: and empty of effect.

original: 'bras bu las tha dad pa thams cad snga na med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu las tha dad pa thams cad snga na med pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: All that is different from the effect would be a prior non-existence.

original: de dang @9b 'brel pa las dngos po'i 'bras bur gyur pa ni ma lus pa'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang @9b 'brel pa las dngos po'i 'bras bur gyur pa ni ma lus pa'i 'bras bu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And from its connection with that, the effect of a thing would be a non-effect in its entirety.

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pas thams cad rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pas thams cad rgyu ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is argued that nothing is a cause because there is no concomitance and no counter-concomitance,

original: 'di la lan btab zin to //
analyzed: 'di la lan btab zin to //
translated: the answer to that has already been given.

original: snga na med pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pas myong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga na med pa zhes bya ba ni mngon sum la sogs pas myong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: As for the so-called prior non-existence, it is not experienced by perception, etc.

original: dngos po nyid myong bar byed do //
analyzed: dngos po nyid myong bar byed do //
translated: It is the thing itself that is experienced.

original: 'on te dngos po yod pa nyid kyi 'bras bu nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po yod pa nyid kyi 'bras bu nyid de /
translated: But if the effect is just the existent itself,

original: yod pa'i 'bras bu la rgyu'i bya ba yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yod pa'i 'bras bu la rgyu'i bya ba yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: then the activity of the cause would be in regard to an existent effect.

original: med pa yul med pa can la ni ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: med pa yul med pa can la ni ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: But how can it be active in regard to a non-existent, which is not an object?

original: 'o na gal te yod par gyur pa nyid 'bras bu ma yin te byas pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na gal te yod par gyur pa nyid 'bras bu ma yin te byas pa la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if that which is existent is not an effect, because there is no activity in regard to what has been done,

original: 'on te mi gsal ba gsal bar byed na ni de yang med pa ma yin nam ji ltar bya bar nus pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te mi gsal ba gsal bar byed na ni de yang med pa ma yin nam ji ltar bya bar nus pa yin /
translated: But if it is unclear and is made clear, then how can it be made clear if it does not exist?

original: 'on te yod pa yin na yang de la ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa yin na yang de la ci zhig bya /
translated: But if it does exist, then what is the use of making it clear?

original: 'on te de yang gzhan gyis gsal bar byed na /
analyzed: 'on te de yang gzhan gyis gsal bar byed na /
translated: But if it is made clear by another,

original: 'o na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then there is an infinite regress.

original: gzhan yang rgyu med pa la 'bras bu skye 'am yod pa las yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu med pa la 'bras bu skye 'am yod pa las yin /
translated: Moreover, does an effect arise from a cause that does not exist or from one that exists?

original: de la gal te rgyu med pa las 'bras bu 'byung na /
analyzed: de la gal te rgyu med pa las 'bras bu 'byung na /
translated: If an effect arises from a cause that does not exist,

original: de'i tshe nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa las kyang skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe nam mkha'i me tog la sogs pa las kyang skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it would arise from a sky flower and so on.

original: snga na med pa dang gtan med pa la bye brag ci zhig yod //
analyzed: snga na med pa dang gtan med pa la bye brag ci zhig yod //
translated: What is the difference between something that does not exist previously and something that is utterly nonexistent?

original: 'on te yod pa'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa'i phyir rgyu'i dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is a cause because it exists,

original: gang gi tshe yod pa de'i tshe rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yod pa de'i tshe rgyu ma yin la /
translated: then when it exists, it is not a cause.üîΩBut when it is different, it is a cause.

original: gzhan gyi tshe rgyu yin no zhes legs par smras so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe rgyu yin no zhes legs par smras so //
translated: You have spoken well!

original: med pa'i dus su rgyu nyid yin na med pa thams cad rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: med pa'i dus su rgyu nyid yin na med pa thams cad rgyur 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if it is a cause when it does not exist, then would not everything that does not exist be a cause?

original: yod pa dang med pa la byed pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la byed pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: But we do not see activity in the existent or the non-existent.

original: ci ste yod pa la byed pa yod pas rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yod pa la byed pa yod pas rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if you say that because activity exists in the existent, it is the cause,

original: 'o na byed pa de nyid byed pa gzhan las yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na byed pa de nyid byed pa gzhan las yin nam /
translated: then is that activity from another activity?

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid las yin grang /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid las yin grang /
translated: Or is it from its own nature?

original: de la byed pa byed pa gzhan las yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: de la byed pa byed pa gzhan las yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If activity is from another activity, then

original: de yang byed pa gzhan sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir byed pa'i rgyun ring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang byed pa gzhan sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir byed pa'i rgyun ring por 'gyur ro //
translated: because that also is preceded by another activity, there would be an infinite regress of activity.

original: 'on te rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis byed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis byed pa yin na /
translated: But if it is from its own nature,

original: de'i tshe 'bras bu yang rang gi ngo bos rgyur 'gyur bas byed pa gzhan brtags te ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bras bu yang rang gi ngo bos rgyur 'gyur bas byed pa gzhan brtags te ci zhig bya /
translated: then because the effect would be the cause by its own nature, what is the point of postulating another activity?

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid rgyu yin na thams cad thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid rgyu yin na thams cad thams cad kyi rgyur 'gyur ro zhes bshad do //
translated: If its own nature is the cause, everything would be the cause of everything.

original: 'on te rgyu yod pa nyid las 'bras bu skye na /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu yod pa nyid las 'bras bu skye na /
translated: But if the effect arises from the mere existence of the cause,

original: 'o na ni dus mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ni dus mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: then because they would exist at the same time,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med de /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med de /
translated: the relation of cause and effect would not exist.

original: ka ba dang bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad do //üîΩshes pa'i rgyu don yin pas rjes su dpag pas @10a * //
analyzed: ka ba dang bum pa bzhin no zhes bshad do // shes pa'i rgyu don yin pas rjes su dpag pas @10a * //
translated: It is like a pillar and a pot.

original: rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since the cause of consciousness is an object, is it not understood by inference?

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not so, because

original: 'di ltar gal te rjes su dpag pas khong du chud pa'i sngar yod pa grub tu chug kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te rjes su dpag pas khong du chud pa'i sngar yod pa grub tu chug kyang /
translated: if it is possible that the existence of the object is understood by inference,

original: nyams su myong bas de'i dngos po rgyur ji ltar shes te /
analyzed: nyams su myong bas de'i dngos po rgyur ji ltar shes te /
translated: how is the thing that is experienced known to be its cause?

original: rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i dngos po ni mngon sum gyi rgyur mi 'gyur la ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas grub pa'i dngos po ni mngon sum gyi rgyur mi 'gyur la ;
translated: An object established by inference is not the cause of perception,

original: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i dngos po rjes su dpag pa'i rgyur rtogs pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i dngos po rjes su dpag pa'i rgyur rtogs pa ni rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it is illogical to understand an object seen by perception to be the cause of inference.

original: mngon du byas pa la rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: mngon du byas pa la rjes su dpag pa mi 'jug ste /
translated: Inference does not engage an object that is manifest,

original: de'i yul lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yul lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its object is hidden.

original: mngon sum yang lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: mngon sum yang lkog tu gyur pa la mi 'jug ste /
translated: Perception does not engage a hidden object,

original: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has a nonhidden object.

original: 'on te mngon du byas pa nyid lkog tu gyur pas shes pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon du byas pa nyid lkog tu gyur pas shes pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is the very thing that is manifest that is hidden because it is not known, then how can it be hidden?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid rtogs na ni lkog tu gyur pa gzhan ci zhig yod //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid rtogs na ni lkog tu gyur pa gzhan ci zhig yod //
translated: If you understand its nature, then what else is there that is hidden?

original: 'on te mi gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin na /üîΩ'o na mngon sum nyid la mi gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa ci'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te mi gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa ni lkog tu gyur pa yin na / 'o na mngon sum nyid la mi gsal bar snang ba'i rnam pa ci'i phyir /
translated: But if the aspect that appears unclearly is hidden,

original: khas len par mi byed de /
analyzed: khas len par mi byed de /
translated: then why do you not accept that the aspect that appears unclearly is itself perception?

original: 'di ltar gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba'i rang bzhin gnyis mngon sum la yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba dang mi gsal bar snang ba'i rang bzhin gnyis mngon sum la yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Because the nature of the two, the aspect that appears clearly and the aspect that appears unclearly, do not exist in perception.

original: dper na ka ba la tshu rol gyi cha dang pha rol gyi cha myong ba'i rim gyis mngon sum nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ka ba la tshu rol gyi cha dang pha rol gyi cha myong ba'i rim gyis mngon sum nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the near side and the far side of a pillar are perceived in sequence.

original: gal te yang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po mngon sum gyis cig car ma myong na /
analyzed: gal te yang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyi dngos po mngon sum gyis cig car ma myong na /
translated: But if the nature of the two, the clear and the unclear, is not simultaneously experienced by perception,

original: de'i tshe 'jig rten gsum na rang bzhin gnyis pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jig rten gsum na rang bzhin gnyis pa nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, there would be no second nature in the three worlds.

original: 'on te khyad par can gyi dbang gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par can gyi dbang gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba nyid yin la /
translated: But if it is the case that the clarity and unclarity are due to the qualified thing,

original: sngon po nyid ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po nyid ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
translated: and that blue itself is the nature of the thing,

original: 'o na gal te khyad par can nyid tha dad kyi dngos po la min pa de lta na ni dngos po mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te khyad par can nyid tha dad kyi dngos po la min pa de lta na ni dngos po mngon sum nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then if the qualified thing is different from the thing, the thing would not be directly perceived.

original: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba ni khyad par can las gzhan pa kho nar myong bar skye la /
analyzed: gsal ba dang mi gsal ba ni khyad par can las gzhan pa kho nar myong bar skye la /
translated: Because the clarity and unclarity are experienced as being different from the qualified thing,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin der mi snang ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin der mi snang ba'i phyir ro /
translated: and the nature of blue and so on would not appear there.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa myong ba mngon sum du brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa myong ba mngon sum du brjod na /
translated: But if the experience of blue and so on is said to be direct perception,

original: 'o na ni rjes su dpag pa yang sngon po'i rang bzhin myong bas mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni rjes su dpag pa yang sngon po'i rang bzhin myong bas mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: then inference would also be direct perception, since it experiences the nature of blue.

original: 'on te dbang po dang sbyor ba med pas rjes su dpag pa mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te dbang po dang sbyor ba med pas rjes su dpag pa mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: But if inference is not direct perception because it is not connected to the sense faculties,üîΩthen the experience of blue would not be direct perception because it is not connected to the sense faculties.

original: 'o na dbang po dang 'brel pa yang rjes su dpag pa la ji ste med /
analyzed: 'o na dbang po dang 'brel pa yang rjes su dpag pa la ji ste med /
translated: Well then, how is it that inference is not related to the sense faculties?

original: @10b 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rig pa po yin pas dbang po dang 'brel bar ston par 'dod do //
analyzed: @10b 'di ltar rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid rig pa po yin pas dbang po dang 'brel bar ston par 'dod do //
translated: In this way, inference is the knower of the nature of things, and so it is claimed that it is related to the sense faculties.

original: 'on te dngos po med pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa ni dbang po dang sbyor ba med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po med pa nyid kyis rjes su dpag pa ni dbang po dang sbyor ba med do zhe na /
translated: But if it is non-existent, then inference is not related to the sense faculties.

original: rjes su dpag pa dngos po mi 'dzin pa yin na snang bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dngos po mi 'dzin pa yin na snang bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If inference does not apprehend things, how can it appear?

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa la snang ba'i dngos po med pa nyid yin na ni rjes su dpag pa yul med pa can du 'gyur ba de bas na rjes su dpag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa la snang ba'i dngos po med pa nyid yin na ni rjes su dpag pa yul med pa can du 'gyur ba de bas na rjes su dpag pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa med do //
translated: If inference does not have the non-existence of things as its object, then inference would be without an object. Therefore, inference does not comprehend the nature of cause and effect.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩthams cad nus pa med ce na //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / thams cad nus pa med ce na //
translated: For that very reason,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúIf everything is powerless,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di la lan smras pa /üîΩsa bon sogs la myug sogs pa'i //
analyzed: 'di la lan smras pa / sa bon sogs la myug sogs pa'i //
translated: In response to this, he says,

original: nus mthong zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nus mthong zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe power of seeds and so on to produce sprouts and so on is seen.‚Äù

original: sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu skye bar 'jig rten thams cad la grags te dpyad pa med par snang ba yin no //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa las myu gu skye bar 'jig rten thams cad la grags te dpyad pa med par snang ba yin no //
translated: The sprout arises from the seed and so on is renowned to the whole world, and it appears without analysis.

original: 'di ltar sngon po mthong ngo zhes rtogs pa'i stobs kyis sngon por rnam par 'jog pa de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong ba la lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sngon po mthong ngo zhes rtogs pa'i stobs kyis sngon por rnam par 'jog pa de lta bas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po mthong ba la lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: Thus, by the power of the cognition ‚ÄúI see blue,‚Äù blue is posited. Therefore, the existence of cause and effect is seen, and one is attached to it.

original: des na myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyi nus pa rgyu sa bon la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir ji ltar de med pa yin /
analyzed: des na myu gu la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams kyi nus pa rgyu sa bon la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir ji ltar de med pa yin /
translated: Thus, since the potency of effects such as the sprout is seen in the cause, the seed, how can it be nonexistent?

original: 'dir brjod pa gal te de kun rdzob 'dod na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa gal te de kun rdzob 'dod na zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, it is said: If you assert that to be conventional,

original: 'dir 'di'i don ni tshad mas dngos po'i de kho na nyid rnam par gzhag pa las ma gtogs par brdar btags pa goms pa la lhag par mos pa'i phyir kun rdzob tsam ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'di'i don ni tshad mas dngos po'i de kho na nyid rnam par gzhag pa las ma gtogs par brdar btags pa goms pa la lhag par mos pa'i phyir kun rdzob tsam ste /
translated: Here, the meaning of this is as follows: Since one is attached to the mere conventional, which is not distinguished from the establishment of the reality of things by valid knowledge, through the force of habituation to the conventional,

original: ma brtags par shes pa'i don ni kun rdzob kyi don to //
analyzed: ma brtags par shes pa'i don ni kun rdzob kyi don to //
translated: the meaning of the conventional is the object of consciousness that does not analyze.

original: ji ltar 'ga' zhig tu sngon po la sogs pa ma mthong bar yang mthong bar mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa de ni brtags na ldog par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: ji ltar 'ga' zhig tu sngon po la sogs pa ma mthong bar yang mthong bar mngon pa'i nga rgyal byed pa de ni brtags na ldog par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Just as someone might claim to have seen something like blue even though he has not seen it, and this claim would be refuted upon examination,

original: / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyang don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs 'di kun rdzob tsam ste /
analyzed: / de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyang don dam pa ma yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs 'di kun rdzob tsam ste /
translated: so too, since worldly conventions are not ultimate, all of this variety is mere superficial reality.

original: tshad ma med par shes pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal tsam ni kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: tshad ma med par shes pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal tsam ni kun rdzob bo //
translated: The mere claim to know something without valid cognition is superficial reality.

original: 'di ltar rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po rjes su 'gro ldog dag gis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po rjes su 'gro ldog dag gis rtogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, one understands the relation between cause and effect through positive and negative concomitance.

original: yod pa dang med pa yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas grub par khas len na /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa yang mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas grub par khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that existence and nonexistence are established by perception and nonperception,

original: mngon sum gyis ni 'di las 'di 'byung ngo zhes rjes su 'gro ba myong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ni 'di las 'di 'byung ngo zhes rjes su 'gro ba myong ba ma yin te /
translated: then perception does not experience positive concomitance, thinking, ‚ÄúThis arises from that.‚Äù

original: mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po gnyis mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir 'di'i rjes la 'di dag skye bo zhes mngon sum gyis khong du chud pa ma yin no /
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i dngos po gnyis mngon du mi byed pa'i phyir 'di'i rjes la 'di dag skye bo zhes mngon sum gyis khong du chud pa ma yin no /
translated: Because it does not manifest two things existing in the present, perception does not understand, ‚ÄúAfter this, that arises,‚Äù

original: // / @11a * //  chad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / @11a * //  chad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on the Differentiation of the Middle and the Extremes

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Second section

original: 'di ltar 'di las 'byung zhes bya ba'i don ci yin te /üîΩci de nyid las yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di las 'byung zhes bya ba'i don ci yin te / ci de nyid las yin nam /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúarising from this‚Äù?üîΩIs it that it arises from itself?üîΩOr is it that because this exists, it exists?

original: yang na 'di yod pas yod pa nyid yin nam /üîΩ'on te 'di las 'byung bar brtag grang na //
analyzed: yang na 'di yod pas yod pa nyid yin nam / 'on te 'di las 'byung bar brtag grang na //
translated: Or is it that it arises from this?

original: de la gal te de nyid las 'byung ngo zhes nges par byed na /
analyzed: de la gal te de nyid las 'byung ngo zhes nges par byed na /
translated: If one ascertains that it arises from itself,

original: de'i tshe ci da lta nyid du 'am /
analyzed: de'i tshe ci da lta nyid du 'am /
translated: then does it arise from itself at the present time?

original: 'on te gzhan gyi tshe de nyid las 'byung ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan gyi tshe de nyid las 'byung ba yin /
translated: Or does it arise from itself at another time?

original: de la gal te da lta de nyid las 'byung ba yin na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te da lta de nyid las 'byung ba yin na ni /
translated: If it arises from itself at the present time,

original: 'o na dus gzhan du gzhan las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na dus gzhan du gzhan las kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would arise from another at another time.

original: de ltar yang yul gzhan du du ba gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes ji ltar nges par shes /
analyzed: de ltar yang yul gzhan du du ba gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin no zhes ji ltar nges par shes /
translated: In that case, how could one ascertain that smoke does not arise from another fire in another place?

original: 'on te dus gzhan du de nyid las 'byung gi gzhan las ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan du de nyid las 'byung gi gzhan las ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if it arises from itself at another time and not from another,

original: 'o na dus gzhan du ni de kho na las 'byung zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma med de /
analyzed: 'o na dus gzhan du ni de kho na las 'byung zhes bya ba 'di la tshad ma med de /
translated: But there is no valid cognition that ascertains that fire exists at another time due to fuel.

original: mngon sum ni da ltar ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i dngos po 'dzin par nus kyi /
analyzed: mngon sum ni da ltar ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i dngos po 'dzin par nus kyi /
translated: Direct perception is the valid cognition that ascertains that fire exists at the present time due to fuel, because direct perception is a consciousness that has a present object field.

original: dus dang yul thams cad kyi me dang du ba dang mngon sum gyis nges par 'dzin na ni de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus dang yul thams cad kyi me dang du ba dang mngon sum gyis nges par 'dzin na ni de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If direct perception ascertained fire and smoke in all times and places, then inference would be pointless.

original: 'di yod pas yod pa nyid ces nges par gzung bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di yod pas yod pa nyid ces nges par gzung bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable to ascertain that fire exists due to the existence of fuel,

original: res 'ga' yul gzhan la sogs par rgyu yod kyang 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba rtogs ;
analyzed: res 'ga' yul gzhan la sogs par rgyu yod kyang 'bras bu mi 'byung ba'i phyir ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba rtogs ;
translated: because sometimes the effect does not arise from the cause, even though the cause exists in another place and so on.

original: 'on te 'di las 'byung zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te 'di las 'byung zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that fire arises from fuel,

original: de lta na ni rang nyid dang gzhan las kyang 'bras bu 'byung bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ji ltar rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po nges pa yin /
analyzed: de lta na ni rang nyid dang gzhan las kyang 'bras bu 'byung bar khas blangs pa'i phyir ji ltar rgyu 'bras kyi dngos po nges pa yin /
translated: then since you accept that the effect arises from itself and from another, how can you ascertain the relationship between cause and effect?

original: de'i phyir mngon sum gyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum gyis rjes su 'gro ba rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the pervasion is not understood by direct perception.

original: ldog pa yang mi dmigs pas grub pa ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: ldog pa yang mi dmigs pas grub pa ni ma yin te ;
translated: Nor is the existence of the counter-pervasion established by non-apprehension,

original: ci ste mi dmigs pa mngon sum yin nam /
analyzed: ci ste mi dmigs pa mngon sum yin nam /
translated: because if non-apprehension is direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag par brtag grang na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par brtag grang na /
translated: then it is inference.

original: de la gal te mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa yin pa de lta na ni mi dmigs pa de yang ldog pa la ltos shing ldog pa yang mi dmigs pa la ltos pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te mi dmigs pa rjes su dpag pa yin pa de lta na ni mi dmigs pa de yang ldog pa la ltos shing ldog pa yang mi dmigs pa la ltos pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: If non-apprehension is inference, then that non-apprehension depends on the counter-pervasion, and the counter-pervasion depends on non-apprehension, so they would be mutually dependent.

original: 'on te me dmigs pa'i ldog pa rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis sgrub na /
analyzed: 'on te me dmigs pa'i ldog pa rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis sgrub na /
translated: But if the counter-pervasion of non-apprehension is established by another inference,

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa de'i ldog pa yang rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa de nyid mtha' med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa de'i ldog pa yang rjes su dpag pa gzhan gyis sgrub pa nyid kyi phyir rjes su dpag pa de nyid mtha' med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the counter-pervasion of that inference would also be established by another inference, and so on ad infinitum.

original: 'on te mngon sum nyid rjes su dpag pa yin na ni de lta na ming tsam tha @11b dad par byas par 'gyur bas mngon sum ni yul dang dus thams cad du ldog pa sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum nyid rjes su dpag pa yin na ni de lta na ming tsam tha @11b dad par byas par 'gyur bas mngon sum ni yul dang dus thams cad du ldog pa sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: But if direct perception is inference, then it is merely a different name, and direct perception does not prove the exclusion of all objects and times,

original: de dag la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not engage them.

original: 'on te grags pa'i tshad mas go ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na /
analyzed: 'on te grags pa'i tshad mas go ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po yin na /
translated: But if the understanding of the relation of cause and effect is by a well-known means of valid knowledge,

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa med par ma mthong ba'i don shes pa ni grags par brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa med par ma mthong ba'i don shes pa ni grags par brjod kyi /
translated: then the cognition of an object not seen without apprehending the relation is said to be well known.

original: mngon sum gyis dngos po gnyis rtogs par mi 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de dag 'brel bar mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis dngos po gnyis rtogs par mi 'gyur bas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de dag 'brel bar mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But since direct perception does not cognize the two things, it does not cognize the relation of cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag ni 'bras bu 'di dag ni rgyu'o zhes shes pa 'di ni brtags pa tsam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag ni 'bras bu 'di dag ni rgyu'o zhes shes pa 'di ni brtags pa tsam mo //
translated: Therefore, the cognition ‚ÄúThese are effects, these are causes‚Äù is mere imputation.

original: yang na don gyis go bas so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu shes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na don gyis go bas so sor nges pa'i 'bras bu shes pa ste /
translated: Or, the cognition of the specific effect is by implication.

original: gal te myu gu sa bon gyis bskyed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te myu gu sa bon gyis bskyed pa ma yin na /
translated: If the sprout is not produced by the seed,

original: de'i rjes thogs su yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'i don rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rjes thogs su yod par mi rigs pa'i phyir ma mthong ba'i don rtogs pa ni don gyis go ba'o zhe na /
translated: But it is illogical that it exists after that, therefore the realization of an object not seen is the understanding of an object through implication.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩgal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po shes pa myong ba yin pa na don gyis go bas sam /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / gal te rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po shes pa myong ba yin pa na don gyis go bas sam /
translated: That is not so, because

original: grags pas brjod par rigs par 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: grags pas brjod par rigs par 'gyur ba las /
translated: if the object of the cause and effect is the experience of consciousness, then it is logical to say it is understood through implication or through renown.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa med ces brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rtogs pa med ces brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But why say that the object of the cause and effect is not realized?

original: nges par 'di las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar shes pa ni med de /
analyzed: nges par 'di las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar shes pa ni med de /
translated: It is not that one does not know that it definitely arises from this,

original: so sor nges pa'i dus nyid du 'di'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pas dus gzhan du de nyid las 'byung bar ji ltar shes pa yin /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i dus nyid du 'di'i 'bras bu nyid du rtogs pas dus gzhan du de nyid las 'byung bar ji ltar shes pa yin /
translated: but since its effect is realized at the very time of its ascertainment, how could one know that it arises from that at another time?

original: 'on te don gyis go ba las sam grags pa las dus gzhan du yang de nyid las 'byung bar rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te don gyis go ba las sam grags pa las dus gzhan du yang de nyid las 'byung bar rtogs par byed de /
translated: But if one realizes that it arises from that at another time through understanding an object through implication or through renown,

original: 'di ltar da ltar na ni de'i de ma thag par dmigs la /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar na ni de'i de ma thag par dmigs la /
translated: then one observes that at present it arises from that immediately after it.

original: gzhan gyi tshe na yang de las mi 'byung na ni lan cig kyang de'i rjes thogs su dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe na yang de las mi 'byung na ni lan cig kyang de'i rjes thogs su dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it does not arise at another time, then it would not be observed immediately after it even once.

original: de lta na ni ka ba yang rtsig pa'i de ma thag tu mthong bar 'gyur bas de yang des bskyed par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na ni ka ba yang rtsig pa'i de ma thag tu mthong bar 'gyur bas de yang des bskyed par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If that is so, then a pillar would be seen immediately after a wall, and would that not also be produced by that?

original: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa la 'khrul par mthong zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa la 'khrul par mthong zhe na /
translated: But if you say that a pillar and so on is seen as mistaken,

original: 'o na ni rigs pa 'dis myu gu la sogs pa yang sa bon la sogs pa las 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni rigs pa 'dis myu gu la sogs pa yang sa bon la sogs pa las 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: then by this reasoning a sprout and so on would also be mistaken in relation to a seed and so on.

original: 'on te de la 'khrul par shes pa ma yin par 'jig rten pa yid rton par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de la 'khrul par shes pa ma yin par 'jig rten pa yid rton par byed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the world does not know that to be mistaken,

original: 'o na ni 'jig rten pa'i grags pa nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa yod de /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'jig rten pa'i grags pa nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa yod de /
translated: then cause and effect are established in the world‚Äôs own renown.

original: 'jig rten la grags pa yang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i kun rdzob tsam yin gyi don dam pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten la grags pa yang ma brtags na nyams dga' ba'i kun rdzob tsam yin gyi don dam pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: And what is renowned in the world is merely conventional truth, which is delightful when not analyzed. It is not ultimate truth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de kun @12a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de kun @12a * //
translated: For that very reason, that is

original: rdzob tu 'dod na zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rdzob tu 'dod na zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If you maintain that it is conventional, then you must explain how that is so.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent says:

original: ji ltar de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ste /
translated: How can that be?

original: kun rdzob bam don dam par sa bon la sogs pa la myu gu la sogs pa'i nus pa yod par 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob bam don dam par sa bon la sogs pa la myu gu la sogs pa'i nus pa yod par 'jig rten thams cad la grags pa'o //
translated: The capacity of seeds, etc. to produce sprouts, etc. is well known in the world, whether conventionally or ultimately.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyang don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyang don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni ma yin no //
translated: Nor is worldly convention dependent on ultimate reality,

original: don dam pa la tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa la tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because ultimate reality is not a conventional object.

original: mos pa tsam gyis tha snyad grub ste /
analyzed: mos pa tsam gyis tha snyad grub ste /
translated: Convention is established by mere belief.

original: rmi lam na nges pa'i tha snyad bzhin rgyu la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyang nges pa kho na yin la /
analyzed: rmi lam na nges pa'i tha snyad bzhin rgyu la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyang nges pa kho na yin la /
translated: The conventions of dreams are just as certain as those of the waking state.

original: tha snyad de yang thog ma med pa'i nges pa'i bag chags rgyu yin gyi phyi rol gyi don ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad de yang thog ma med pa'i nges pa'i bag chags rgyu yin gyi phyi rol gyi don ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of such conventions is the beginningless imprints of such certainties, not external objects.

original: bag chags med par yang shes pa dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa'i cha nyid med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bag chags med par yang shes pa dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa'i shes pa'i cha nyid med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Without imprints, consciousness would not have the aspect of either an object or the absence of an object.

original: ci ste kun rdzob ni ci yin te /
analyzed: ci ste kun rdzob ni ci yin te /
translated: What is this so-called conventional?

original: gal te bden pa yin na ji ltar kun rdzob yin /
analyzed: gal te bden pa yin na ji ltar kun rdzob yin /
translated: If it is true, how can it be conventional?

original: 'on te mi bden zhing log pa kun rdzob yin na /
analyzed: 'on te mi bden zhing log pa kun rdzob yin na /
translated: If it is not true and is a false convention,

original: de lta na kun rdzob tu bden pa zhes bya ba ci yin te /
analyzed: de lta na kun rdzob tu bden pa zhes bya ba ci yin te /
translated: then what is called ‚Äútrue in a conventional sense‚Äù?

original: bden pa dang kun rdzob ni 'gal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa dang kun rdzob ni 'gal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Aren‚Äôt truth and convention mutually exclusive?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩkun rdzob ces bya ba ni log pa'i shes pa la snang ba tsam lhag par mos pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / kun rdzob ces bya ba ni log pa'i shes pa la snang ba tsam lhag par mos pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Here we say:

original: de yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags las byung ba ste /
translated: What is called ‚Äúconventional‚Äù is the nature of the mere appearance in a mistaken consciousness, which is the result of beginningless latent propensities.

original: des na thog ma med pa'i bag chags las skyes pa snang ba nyid 'ba' zhig tsam mo//
analyzed: des na thog ma med pa'i bag chags las skyes pa snang ba nyid 'ba' zhig tsam mo//
translated: Therefore, it is merely the appearance that arises from beginningless latent propensities.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rtogs par gyur pa ji ltar mi bden zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rtogs par gyur pa ji ltar mi bden zhe na /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúHow can the realization of blue and so on be false?‚Äù

original: goms pa'i stobs las rig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs las rig pa'i phyir te /
translated: We reply, it is because it is known through the power of habituation.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa na yang sngon po la sogs pa myong ba de ni bden pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam la sogs pa na yang sngon po la sogs pa myong ba de ni bden pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, even in dreams, the experience of blue and so on is not true.

original: sad pa'i tshe na yang sngon po la sogs pa myong bar gyur pa ni bden pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: sad pa'i tshe na yang sngon po la sogs pa myong bar gyur pa ni bden pa ma yin te ;
translated: When one awakens from sleep, the experience of blue, etc. is not true,

original: sngon po la sogs pa ma rtogs par de myong bar ma mthong ba de'i phyir don dam par shes pa yang ma yin la shes bya yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa ma rtogs par de myong bar ma mthong ba de'i phyir don dam par shes pa yang ma yin la shes bya yang ma yin no //
translated: because without the perception of blue, etc. one does not see the experience of it. Therefore, ultimately there is no consciousness and no object of consciousness.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyang chad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyang chad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does the conventional of the world come to an end,

original: phan 'dogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the benefit is present.

original: de ltar na kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba la 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar na kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes bya ba la 'gal ba med de /
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction in the so-called conventional truth,

original: don dam par ni don thams cad kyi dben pa kho na'o zhes bya ba skabs ji lta bar dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par ni don thams cad kyi dben pa kho na'o zhes bya ba skabs ji lta bar dpyad par bya'o //
translated: but ultimately all objects are only void. This should be analyzed according to the context.

original: 'on te skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kun rdzob ste /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kun rdzob ste /
translated: But if the nature of origination, etc. is itself the conventional,

original: tshad mas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not apprehended by a valid cognition,

original: shes pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa yin gyi skye ba la sogs pa ni ma yin pa de bas na kun rdzob @12b tu skye ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa nyid mngon sum du byed pa yin gyi skye ba la sogs pa ni ma yin pa de bas na kun rdzob @12b tu skye ba ste /
translated: consciousness itself is the direct perception, but origination, etc. are not. Therefore, origination is conventional,

original: de nyid skye ba la sogs par tshad mas khong du mi chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid skye ba la sogs par tshad mas khong du mi chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because valid cognition does not comprehend that as arising, etc.

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba nus pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba nus pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the so-called superficial that which is not efficacious?

original: skye ba ni nus pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba ni nus pa'o zhe na /
translated: Arising is efficacious.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: kun rdzob ni don dam par nus pa med pas don dam par skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni don dam par nus pa med pas don dam par skye ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The superficial is not ultimately efficacious, and therefore arising does not exist ultimately.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba'i nus pa ni rtog pa tsam gyis yin te /
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba'i nus pa ni rtog pa tsam gyis yin te /
translated: The so-called efficacy of arising is merely conceptual.

original: rtog pas kyang skye ba yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pas kyang skye ba yod pa nyid do //
translated: Arising exists because of conceptualization.

original: des na rtog pas ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: des na rtog pas ni skye ba ste /
translated: Therefore, arising is due to conceptualization.

original: de'i phyir nang gi nus pa yod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir nang gi nus pa yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, internal efficacy exists,

original: don dam par ni nus pa med pa de bas na /
analyzed: don dam par ni nus pa med pa de bas na /
translated: but ultimately there is no efficacy, and therefore

original: skye ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba med pa yin no //
translated: there is no arising.

original: ji ltar 'das pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: How can the past be a cause?

original: ring du zhig pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de thams cad skabs bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: ring du zhig pa yang skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de thams cad skabs bzhin du dgag par bya'o //
translated: It follows that what is long past would arise, etc. All that has been said should be refuted in accordance with the context.

original: rtog pa'i yul ni dpyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa'i don ni der yang dpyad pa ni tshad mar brjod pa ste /üîΩdes na rtog pa'i yul ni tshad ma'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtog pa'i yul ni dpyad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa'i don ni der yang dpyad pa ni tshad mar brjod pa ste / des na rtog pa'i yul ni tshad ma'i don ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe object of conceptual thought should not be analyzed‚Äù is that analysis is said to be valid cognition with respect to that.üîΩTherefore, the meaning of the statement is that the object of conceptual thought is not the object of valid cognition.

original: sgyu ma'i don ni tshad mas rtogs pa'i don ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i don ni tshad mas rtogs pa'i don ma yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúillusion‚Äù is that it is not the object of valid cognition.

original: 'gro ba thams cad sgyu ma kho na'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad sgyu ma kho na'o //
translated: All of the world is just an illusion.

original: de ltar yang de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: Thus, it says, ‚ÄúWhat is conventional truth?

original: ji srid 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji srid 'jig rten gyi tha snyad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is just worldly convention.‚Äù

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i cha ni tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i cha ni tha snyad du yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: The distinction between valid cognition and invalid cognition is made conventionally, not ultimately.

original: 'dir rang las rang gi ngo bo rtogs zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir rang las rang gi ngo bo rtogs zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: Here, it is taught that one‚Äôs own nature is realized from itself.

original: kun la de yod ce na min //üîΩspyi yi mtshan nyid dang blo la //
analyzed: kun la de yod ce na min // spyi yi mtshan nyid dang blo la //
translated: If you say that it exists in all, that is not so.üîΩBecause the universal characteristic

original: rjes su 'gro ldog ma mthong phyir //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ldog ma mthong phyir //
translated: is not seen to be concomitant with the mind.

original: mig dang gzugs sogs blo bzhin no //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs sogs blo bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of eye and form.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: gal te kun rdzob kyis don byed par nus na spyi la sogs pa la yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob kyis don byed par nus na spyi la sogs pa la yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the object is able to perform a function through the conventional, then is it not also the case that universals and so on exist?

original: de dag kyang don dam par yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang don dam par yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: In that case, they too would exist ultimately.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: spyi dang blo la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi dang blo la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: because the universal and the mind are not seen to be concomitant or to be mutually exclusive.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa'i blo ni gzugs la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa la rag las pa bzhin no //üîΩmig la sogs pa'i shes pa nyid la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa snang ba yin nam /
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa'i blo ni gzugs la sogs pa yod pa dang med pa la rag las pa bzhin no // mig la sogs pa'i shes pa nyid la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa snang ba yin nam /
translated: For example, the mind that perceives eyes and so on is dependent on the existence or nonexistence of form and so on.

original: don la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don la ni ma yin te /
translated: Is the aspect of blue and so on that appears in the eye consciousness and so on the object or not?

original: de ji ltar don gyi rjes su 'gro bar 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar don gyi rjes su 'gro bar 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is the object, then how is it that it is apprehended as concomitant with the object?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩgal te shes pa las sngar don yod par mi rtogs pa de lta na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa med par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / gal te shes pa las sngar don yod par mi rtogs pa de lta na yang mig gi rnam par shes pa med par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: phyi rol yod par shes so//
analyzed: phyi rol yod par shes so//
translated: Even though you do not understand that the object exists prior to consciousness, still you understand that external objects exist because seeing exists.

original: @13a * // gal te phyi rol med par rnam par shes pa skye na ni de'i tshe gang dang gang na mig phye ba de dang der sngon po snang ba tsam gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @13a * // gal te phyi rol med par rnam par shes pa skye na ni de'i tshe gang dang gang na mig phye ba de dang der sngon po snang ba tsam gyi shes pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: If consciousness were to arise without an external object, then in whatever place the eye is opened, consciousness would arise in the mere appearance of blue,

original: dper na mig rab rib kyis nyams pa la skra shad 'dzings par mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mig rab rib kyis nyams pa la skra shad 'dzings par mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, one with impaired vision sees a hair net.

original: mig gi shes pa ni de ltar thams cad du skye ba ma yin pa de bas na don yod par rtogs par rigs so //
analyzed: mig gi shes pa ni de ltar thams cad du skye ba ma yin pa de bas na don yod par rtogs par rigs so //
translated: But the eye consciousness does not arise in that way in all cases, therefore it is reasonable to understand that the object exists.

original: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la ltos nas mig la sogs pa'i blo dag la gzugs la sogs pa'i nus pa nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la ltos nas mig la sogs pa'i blo dag la gzugs la sogs pa'i nus pa nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in dependence on positive and negative concomitance, the capacity of form and so on for eye consciousness and so on is seen.

original: spyi dang blo ni phyi rol gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi dang blo ni phyi rol gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa la brten pa ma yin te /
translated: A universal and a cognition are not based on positive and negative concomitance with an external object,

original: nang gi rgyu tsam las yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi rgyu tsam las yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they exist merely as internal causes.

original: 'on te ba lang nyid kyi blo rta las ma yin na de ji ltar ldog pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ba lang nyid kyi blo rta las ma yin na de ji ltar ldog pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: But if the cognition of cowness is not in a horse, how is it not a negative concomitance?

original: de ni ba lang nyid med par rta las ba lang gi blo med do zhes bya ba ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni ba lang nyid med par rta las ba lang gi blo med do zhes bya ba ni mi rung ste /
translated: It is not correct to say that the idea of cow is absent in the horse because of the absence of cowness.

original: 'on te ba lang gi rtogs pa'i rgyu bag chags sad pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te ba lang gi rtogs pa'i rgyu bag chags sad pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir /
