translated: Or, because of the absence of the potency of the arousing of the latent potentialities that are the cause of the idea of cow,

original: rta la ba lang gi blo yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rta la ba lang gi blo yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the idea of cow is absent in the horse.

original: gzhan yang shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i spyi snang ba ni ma yin te //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa las ma gtogs pa'i spyi snang ba ni ma yin te //
translated: Moreover, the appearance of the universal is not separate from consciousness.

original: gang gis spyi yod pa dang med par 'jal ba des mtshungs pa nyid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu spyi yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gis spyi yod pa dang med par 'jal ba des mtshungs pa nyid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig pu spyi yin gyi /
translated: That by which the existence or nonexistence of the universal is apprehended, that is, the single consciousness that is the same, is the universal.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not an external thing.

original: de lta na 'o na ni spyi med par rta dang ba lang nyid phan tshun tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni spyi med par rta dang ba lang nyid phan tshun tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the horse and cowness are mutually different without the universal.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩüîΩ

original: brtags pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba rnams tha dad pa'i phyir gyi der spyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: brtags pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba rnams tha dad pa'i phyir gyi der spyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa mi dmigs so //
translated: because they are different by virtue of their own characteristics and because the particulars are different, the universal is not perceived as having a different characteristic.

original: gal te yang brda la rtsol ba tsam gyis bum pas dben pa'i yul du yang bum pa'i shes pa med na ni spyi'i nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang brda la rtsol ba tsam gyis bum pas dben pa'i yul du yang bum pa'i shes pa med na ni spyi'i nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, however, the cognition of a pot does not occur in a place devoid of a pot, even when one exerts oneself in the use of the term, then the universal would be the potency.

original: 'on te spyis khyab pa yin pas gsal bas stong par yang ba lang gi blo 'byung bar rigs she na /
analyzed: 'on te spyis khyab pa yin pas gsal bas stong par yang ba lang gi blo 'byung bar rigs she na /
translated: But if the universal is all-pervading, then it is reasonable that the cognition of a cow should occur even in a place devoid of a cow.

original: mig rab rib kyis nyams pa la dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa la yang ci'i phyir ma khyab pa yin /
analyzed: mig rab rib kyis nyams pa la dmigs pa'i skra shad la sogs pa la yang ci'i phyir ma khyab pa yin /
translated: But why is it not all-pervading in the case of the hairs and so on that are perceived by one whose eyes are impaired by ophthalmia?

original: 'on te mi gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te mi gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: But it is not seen by other people.

original: de rnams med pa nyid yin na ni spyi yang brda rtsol ba med pas mi shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de rnams med pa nyid yin na ni spyi yang brda rtsol ba med pas mi shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: If they do not exist, then the universal is not known without the use of the term, is it not?

original: de bas na de yang med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de yang med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that also does not exist.

original: brda rtsol ba las spyi shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: brda rtsol ba las spyi shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the universal is known through the use of the term,

original: skra shad la sogs pa yang nam mkha'i ngos la rab rib yod pas mthong ba ma yin nam //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa yang nam mkha'i ngos la rab rib yod pas mthong ba ma yin nam //
translated: are not hairs and so on seen in the sky due to ophthalmia?

original: des na ji ltar med pa yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar med pa yin /
translated: So how can they be nonexistent?

original: 'on te rab rib kyis nyams pa las skra shad med kyang mig @13b gis mthong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rab rib kyis nyams pa las skra shad med kyang mig @13b gis mthong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the hairs and so on are seen by the eye, even though they do not exist, because of the impairment of the eye by cataracts,

original: skra shad la sogs pa 'di rtogs par gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa 'di rtogs par gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: then why is it that one does not perceive hairs and so on?

original: ci'i phyir med pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med pa yin /
translated: Why are they not existent?

original: mig nyams pa'i gzung bya yin pas so zhe na /
analyzed: mig nyams pa'i gzung bya yin pas so zhe na /
translated: Because they are the objects of the impaired eye.

original: 'di ci ste nyams pa yin /
analyzed: 'di ci ste nyams pa yin /
translated: Why is the eye impaired?

original: med pa dmigs pas so zhe na /
analyzed: med pa dmigs pas so zhe na /
translated: Because of the perception of the nonexistent.

original: de lta na gcig la gcig brten pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na gcig la gcig brten pa ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, is it not the case that there is mutual dependence?

original: gal te yang rab rib kyis bsgyur ba'i mig gzung bar bya bas skra shad la sogs pa brdzun pa yin na /üîΩ'o na ni spyi yang phyin ci log gi 'du byed pa la sad pa la snang ba'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang rab rib kyis bsgyur ba'i mig gzung bar bya bas skra shad la sogs pa brdzun pa yin na / 'o na ni spyi yang phyin ci log gi 'du byed pa la sad pa la snang ba'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, if the false hairs and so on are the objects of the eye that is altered by cataracts,üîΩthen since the universal appears to one who is awake, it too would be nonexistent.

original: des brda rtsol ba la sogs pa //
analyzed: des brda rtsol ba la sogs pa //
translated: The universal is not the object of the eye that is altered by cataracts,

original: nang gi yan lag ngor 'jug phyir //
analyzed: nang gi yan lag ngor 'jug phyir //
translated: because it is engaged in the aspect of the internal condition.

original: bum pa dang ni 'degs dang spyi //üîΩgrangs sogs blo yang bshad pa yin //
analyzed: bum pa dang ni 'degs dang spyi // grangs sogs blo yang bshad pa yin //
translated: The pot, lifting, the universal,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the cognition of number and so on are also explained.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rten bum pa ni yan lag can gyi rdzas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rten bum pa ni yan lag can gyi rdzas so //
translated: The substance of a whole, such as a pot, is the substratum of the qualities of form, etc.

original: las ni 'degs pa'o //
analyzed: las ni 'degs pa'o //
translated: Its action is to support.

original: grangs ni yon tan no //
analyzed: grangs ni yon tan no //
translated: Its number is one.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'du ba ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni 'du ba ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes its conjunction.

original: 'di ni blo'i gzung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni blo'i gzung ba'o //
translated: This is the object of the cognition.

original: de dag gi blo gang yin pa ni blo ste /
analyzed: de dag gi blo gang yin pa ni blo ste /
translated: The cognition of these is the cognition.

original: de dag gis phyi rol la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis phyi rol la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this is the explanation of the fact that the cognition of these does not occur in dependence on external objects.

original: de dag kyang phyi rol gyi rdzas la brten nas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag kyang phyi rol gyi rdzas la brten nas ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cognition of these does not occur in dependence on external substances.

original: de ltar gang las shes she na /
analyzed: de ltar gang las shes she na /
translated: How is this known?

original: brda la rtsol ba nyid nang gi rgyu ste /
analyzed: brda la rtsol ba nyid nang gi rgyu ste /
translated: The internal cause is the effort to communicate.

original: de las 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of these occurs because of that.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dran pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dran pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes memory.

original: 'di ltar bum pa'i blo ni bum pa dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa'i blo ni bum pa dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the cognition of a pot is not related to a pot,

original: gzugs la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa nyid mig la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyis dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad pa nyid mig la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyis dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the eye, etc., cognize form, etc., as distinct from each other.

original: gzugs dang reg bya dmigs na yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis dus phyis gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen nas bum pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang reg bya dmigs na yang thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis dus phyis gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen nas bum pa'o snyam pa'i shes pa skye'o //
translated: But when form and tactility are perceived, then later on, by the power of beginningless latent propensities, there is the conception of their singularity, and the cognition ‚Äúvase‚Äù arises.

original: ci ste mig gis rtogs pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas gang yin pa de nyid reg pas kyang rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: ci ste mig gis rtogs pa'i yan lag can gyi rdzas gang yin pa de nyid reg pas kyang rtogs pa ste /
translated: If the substance that is the bearer of the parts perceived by the eye is also perceived by tactility,

original: mthong ba dang reg pa'i sgo nas rdzas gnyis so zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa'i sgo nas rdzas gnyis so zhe na /
translated: then the substance is perceived by both seeing and touching.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ma rtogs par kha dog la sogs pa med de ;
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ma rtogs par kha dog la sogs pa med de ;
translated: Without perceiving form and so on, color and so forth do not exist,

original: / yan lag can gyi rdzas mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / yan lag can gyi rdzas mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the substance that is the bearer of the parts is not seen.

original: de myong ba yang gzugs kyi rnam pa ma yin pa 'dzin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de myong ba yang gzugs kyi rnam pa ma yin pa 'dzin par 'gyur na /
translated: If the experience of that is the apprehension of something other than the aspect of form,

original: mig gi shes pas gnyis su rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi shes pas gnyis su rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then the eye consciousness does not perceive duality.

original: 'on te bum pa'o snyam du shes pa yin gyi gzugs so zhes ni ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa'o snyam du shes pa yin gyi gzugs so zhes ni ma yin na /
translated: But if it is the cognition ‚Äúvase,‚Äù not ‚Äúform,‚Äù

original: de ji ltar bum pa dang gzugs @14a * //
analyzed: de ji ltar bum pa dang gzugs @14a * //
translated: how is the vase and form

original: dag tha dad par myong /
analyzed: dag tha dad par myong /
translated: experienced as different?

original: 'di ltar bum pa dmar po dang / bum pa rig pas rtogs pa 'khrul pa med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bum pa dmar po dang / bum pa rig pas rtogs pa 'khrul pa med pa'o zhe na /
translated: Thus, it is not contradictory to say that a red pot and a pot are realized by a cognition.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir bum pa dang snam bu'i dngos po'i dmar po nyid rtogs pa dang / dmar po dang dmar po ma yin pa'i dngos po bum pa'o snyam du rtogs pa de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las bum pa dang dmar po dag rtogs pa tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bum pa dang snam bu'i dngos po'i dmar po nyid rtogs pa dang / dmar po dang dmar po ma yin pa'i dngos po bum pa'o snyam du rtogs pa de'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las bum pa dang dmar po dag rtogs pa tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: Because a pot and a cloth are realized as red things and a pot is realized as red or not red, therefore the realization of a pot and the realization of red are distinct on the basis of positive and negative concomitance.

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: But ultimately they are not distinct.

original: 'o na gal te yan lag can med kyi gzugs la sogs pa nyid tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te yan lag can med kyi gzugs la sogs pa nyid tha dad pa yin na /
translated: But if the possessor of parts does not exist and form and so on are distinct,

original: ji ltar gang na gzugs yod pa de nyid na reg pa yod par rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar gang na gzugs yod pa de nyid na reg pa yod par rtogs she na /
translated: how is it that one realizes that where form exists contact exists?

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas bsdus nas rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas bsdus nas rtogs pa ste /
translated: It is realized by subsuming them in dependence on a single collection.

original: dper na dpung gi tshogs la gang na rgyal po bzhugs pa de nyid du skyes bu la sogs pa rnams yod par tha snyad du grags kyi /
analyzed: dper na dpung gi tshogs la gang na rgyal po bzhugs pa de nyid du skyes bu la sogs pa rnams yod par tha snyad du grags kyi /
translated: For example, in the case of an army, it is conventionally known that wherever the king is, there the soldiers and so on are.

original: skyes bu la sogs pa med na dpung rang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu la sogs pa med na dpung rang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if the soldiers and so on are not there, the army is not there.

original: de'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya dag tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas mi 'khrul pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya dag tshogs pa gcig la rag las pas mi 'khrul pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, form and tactility are not mistaken with regard to their dependence on a single collection.

original: de la yan lag can ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yan lag can ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the possessor of the parts does not exist.

original: de bzhin du 'degs pa la sogs pa'i blo yul gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig nyid 'degs pa zhes bya bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'degs pa la sogs pa'i blo yul gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i lag pa la sogs pa'i skad cig nyid 'degs pa zhes bya bas na /
translated: In the same way, the cognition of lifting and so on occurs in regard to the successive moments of the hand and so on.

original: bsdus pa la dmigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bsdus pa la dmigs pa yin gyi /
translated: It is a cognition that observes a collection,

original: dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs las 'ongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not produced by the power of a real entity.

original: de bzhin du grangs la sogs pa'i blo la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du grangs la sogs pa'i blo la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the cognition of number and so on.

original: gal te spyi don byed nus pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te spyi don byed nus pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt a universal not able to perform a function?

original: de lta na ni skra shad la sogs pa rab rib can gyis mthong ba yang don byed mi nus pa'i phyir spyi yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de lta na ni skra shad la sogs pa rab rib can gyis mthong ba yang don byed mi nus pa'i phyir spyi yin par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that in that case, even the seeing of floating hairs and so on by one with eye disease would be a universal because it is not able to perform a function,

original: skra shad sogs ni spyi min te //
analyzed: skra shad sogs ni spyi min te //
translated: we reply: Floating hairs and so on are not universals

original: don du zhen pa med phyir ro //üîΩshes byar 'dzin phyir med pa la //
analyzed: don du zhen pa med phyir ro // shes byar 'dzin phyir med pa la //
translated: because there is no adherence to an object.

original: thal ba'i nyes pa yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /üîΩrab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad dang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa ni spyi ma yin te /
analyzed: thal ba'i nyes pa yod ma yin // zhes bya ba smos te / rab rib can gyis dmigs pa'i skra shad dang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa ni spyi ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault of the absurd consequenceüîΩof the nonexistence of universals because of the apprehension of objects.

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Floating hairs, a double moon, and so on that are observed by one with eye disease are not universals because there is no adherence to the nature of an object.

original: don nyid spyi'i rang bzhin gyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid shes pa ni spyi'o //
analyzed: don nyid spyi'i rang bzhin gyis rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid shes pa ni spyi'o //
translated: A universal is a consciousness that is the nature of a generality by the nature of an object.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe don bya ba byed pa'i phyir ji ltar spyi yin te /
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid yin na de'i tshe don bya ba byed pa'i phyir ji ltar spyi yin te /
translated: If it is an instance of a particular, then because it performs the function of an object, how could it be a universal?

original: spyi ni don mi byed pa'i phyir ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi ni don mi byed pa'i phyir ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt a universal that which does not perform the function of an object?

original: 'on te don byed pa dang bral ba las spyi yin na de'i tshe ji @14b ltar don yin don ni don byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te don byed pa dang bral ba las spyi yin na de'i tshe ji @14b ltar don yin don ni don byed pa'o //
translated: But if a universal is a thing that is devoid of the ability to perform a function, then how can it be a thing? A thing is that which is able to perform a function.

original: des na don nyid spyi yin no zhes zer ba ni 'gal pa'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na don nyid spyi yin no zhes zer ba ni 'gal pa'o snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, if you think that a thing itself is a universal, then that is contradictory.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum du don byed nus pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum du don byed nus pa yin la /
translated: A specific property is that which is able to perform a function.

original: brgyud nas nus pas de nyid spyi yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'gal /
analyzed: brgyud nas nus pas de nyid spyi yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'gal /
translated: Since it is able to perform a function directly, it is a universal. How is this contradictory?

original: gal te don nyid spyi yin na med pa yang don nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te don nyid spyi yin na med pa yang don nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If a thing itself is a universal, then since a nonexistent thing is a thing,

original: spyi'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo nyid kyang yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: the nature of a universal would also exist.

original: de bas na mi dmigs pa ni rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na mi dmigs pa ni rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, nonobservation is not an inference,

original: yul phyi ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: yul phyi ma yin pa'i phyir ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: because it is an object of the future?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: shes bya nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes bya nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is apprehended as an object of knowledge.

original: med pa ste zhig na med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin la ;
analyzed: med pa ste zhig na med pa la sogs pa rnams kyi rang bzhin la ;
translated: When something is nonexistent, that is, when it has been destroyed, etc.,

original: spyi med pa'i skyon du thal ba med de /
analyzed: spyi med pa'i skyon du thal ba med de /
translated: the error of a universal not existing in its nature does not follow.

original: med pa ni ma yin par 'gag pa'i sgo nas dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin par mngon du byed pa'i phyir don kho na yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni ma yin par 'gag pa'i sgo nas dngos po gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid yin par mngon du byed pa'i phyir don kho na yin no //
translated: It is not nonexistent, because it is manifested as the nature of another thing by way of cessation.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yang don byed nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yang don byed nus pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of another is also the ability to perform a function.

original: yang na gtan med pa yang gal te tshad mas gcod pa nyid kyang dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di ni don yin te /
analyzed: yang na gtan med pa yang gal te tshad mas gcod pa nyid kyang dgos pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di ni don yin te /
translated: Moreover, if even the complete nonexistence of something is the object of a valid cognition, then this is the object, because it is necessary.

original: med pa la yang 'gro ba la dogs pa med pa'i dgos pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa la yang 'gro ba la dogs pa med pa'i dgos pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: Even in the case of nonexistence, there is the need to avoid going there.

original: de bas na med par nges par shes pas de la don nyid du rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na med par nges par shes pas de la don nyid du rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only reasonable that the ascertainment of nonexistence is knowledge of its object.

original: ci ste skra shad la sogs pa yang med pa'o snyam pa'am /
analyzed: ci ste skra shad la sogs pa yang med pa'o snyam pa'am /
translated: But if you think that even the knowledge of the nonexistence of floating hair and so on,

original: skra shad dngos lta bu'o zhes shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skra shad dngos lta bu'o zhes shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: or the knowledge that it is like the entity of floating hair, is not knowledge of nonexistence,

original: de la yang med par shes pa las 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i yod pa de bas na skra shad la sogs pa rnams la yang tshad ma'i yul nyid yod pa'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la yang med par shes pa las 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa'i yod pa de bas na skra shad la sogs pa rnams la yang tshad ma'i yul nyid yod pa'o snyam du sems na /
translated: then you should think that even in the case of floating hair and so on, there is the object of valid knowledge, because there is the knowledge of nonexistence, and there is the need to avoid going there and coming back.

original: de dag kyang de ltar 'gyur na //
analyzed: de dag kyang de ltar 'gyur na //
translated: If they are like that,

original: bkag pa med phyir gsal snang nyid //
analyzed: bkag pa med phyir gsal snang nyid //
translated: because there is no negation, they are clearly manifest.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid don phyir//
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid don phyir//
translated: Because they are the nature of consciousness.

original: skra sogs shes bya'i blo dag kyang //
analyzed: skra sogs shes bya'i blo dag kyang //
translated: The cognitions of objects such as hair

original: spyi yi yul can nyid yin la //
analyzed: spyi yi yul can nyid yin la //
translated: are also subjects that possess universals.

original: skrar snang don med can yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skrar snang don med can yin no // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The appearance of hair is meaningless.

original: gal te skra shad la sogs pa ni med pa'o zhes bya bar yongs su gcod na /
analyzed: gal te skra shad la sogs pa ni med pa'o zhes bya bar yongs su gcod na /
translated: If one determines that things such as floating hairs do not exist,

original: de'i tshe med pa zhes bya ba spyi cis ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe med pa zhes bya ba spyi cis ma yin te /
translated: then why are they not called ‚Äúnonexistent universals‚Äù?

original: don byed pa'i shes pas sam /
analyzed: don byed pa'i shes pas sam /
translated: Because they are not observed by a consciousness that performs a function,

original: skyes bu gzhan gyis mi dmigs pa de bas na yul dang dus dang skyes bu gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan gyis mi dmigs pa de bas na yul dang dus dang skyes bu gzhan gyis ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: or by another person. Therefore, because they are not seen by another person, place, or time,

original: med pa spyir bkag pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa spyir bkag pa med pa nyid do //
translated: the negation of the universal ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù does not exist.

original: de dag ste skra shad la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ste skra shad la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Those are things such as floating hairs.

original: gang gi tshe yang skra shad dngos bzhin no snyam shes par byed pa de'i tshe skra shad kyi shes pa'i ngo bo la 'dra ba'i tha snyad 'dogs @15a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang skra shad dngos bzhin no snyam shes par byed pa de'i tshe skra shad kyi shes pa'i ngo bo la 'dra ba'i tha snyad 'dogs @15a * //
translated: When one thinks, ‚ÄúIt is like a real hair,‚Äù at that time, one designates the nature of the consciousness of a hair as similar.

original: so ; / de ltar 'gyur ba ste skra shad dang 'dra ba skra shad du gyur pa'o zhes shes pa na skra shad la sogs pa rnams la spyi'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: so ; / de ltar 'gyur ba ste skra shad dang 'dra ba skra shad du gyur pa'o zhes shes pa na skra shad la sogs pa rnams la spyi'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, it is like a hair, that is, it is a hair. When one understands this, then the universal nature of hairs, etc., is not denied.

original: ci ste spyi'i ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su gcod na skra shad la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'gyur ba las skra shad kyi shes pa ni shin tu gsal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste spyi'i ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su gcod na skra shad la sogs pa gsal bar mi 'gyur ba las skra shad kyi shes pa ni shin tu gsal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if it is determined by a universal nature, then hairs, etc., would not be manifest. But is the consciousness of a hair not very manifest?

original: de la yang smras pa /
analyzed: de la yang smras pa /
translated: To this he says:

original: skra shad rnams gsal ba nyid ni /
analyzed: skra shad rnams gsal ba nyid ni /
translated: The manifestation of hairs, etc.,

original: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi don yin pa'i phyir /
translated: is the object of the nature of consciousness.

original: skra shad la sogs pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa de ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, hairs, etc., are only particular.

original: gsal ba nyid kyis don nyid yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba yin na ji ltar skra shad la sogs pa don med pa yin /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid kyis don nyid yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba yin na ji ltar skra shad la sogs pa don med pa yin /
translated: If the meaning of clarity is the appearance of intrinsic identity, how can such things as floating hairs be meaningless?

original: des na skra shad la sogs pa rnams spyi'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: des na skra shad la sogs pa rnams spyi'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Therefore, are such things as floating hairs not the nature of universals?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: In response to this, we say:

original: skra shad la sogs pa rang rig pa nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa'i snyam du rtogs pa gang yin pa'i blo skye ba de ni spyi'i yul can te /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa rang rig pa nyid kyis nyams su myong ba'i skra shad la sogs pa'i snyam du rtogs pa gang yin pa'i blo skye ba de ni spyi'i yul can te /
translated: The cognition that arises, thinking ‚Äúsuch things as floating hairs are experienced by reflexive awareness,‚Äù has a universal as its object.

original: 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar skra shad la sogs pa brdzun par ram /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis yul du byed pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar skra shad la sogs pa brdzun par ram /
translated: This is because it takes as its object the nature of what is similar.

original: skra shad dngos 'dra bar shes pa ni brtags pa'i rang bzhin te bden pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: skra shad dngos 'dra bar shes pa ni brtags pa'i rang bzhin te bden pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: In this way, the cognition that is similar to the actual floating hairs, whether the floating hairs are false or not, is the nature of an imputation, the opposite of truth.

original: de dang 'dra ba nyid yang sngar gyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba nyid yang sngar gyi rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs pa ste /
translated: That similarity is understood by following the previous nature.

original: snga phyi'i ngo bo nyid las mngon sum 'jug pa ni ma yin pa de bas na nges pa'i shes pa ni spyi'i yul can no //
analyzed: snga phyi'i ngo bo nyid las mngon sum 'jug pa ni ma yin pa de bas na nges pa'i shes pa ni spyi'i yul can no //
translated: But direct perception does not operate on the basis of the intrinsic reality of prior and subsequent moments. Therefore, a determinate cognition has a universal for its object.

original: gal te de ltar na rang rig pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa spyi'i yul can yin na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rang rig pa rang gi mtshan nyid kyi yul can dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa spyi'i yul can yin na /
translated: If that is so, then reflexive awareness has a particular for its object, and conceptual cognition has a universal for its object.

original: 'o na ni 'khrul pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni 'khrul pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What then is a delusion?

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: We reply:

original: skra shad du snang ba ste /
analyzed: skra shad du snang ba ste /
translated: The appearance of floating hairs.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni don med pa can yin no //üîΩrang rig pa ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni don med pa can yin no // rang rig pa ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: A sense consciousness is devoid of an object.üîΩReflexive awareness is direct perception.

original: rtog pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa'i shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Conceptual cognition is inference.

original: dbang po'i shes pa ni don med pa'o zhes chas dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa ni don med pa'o zhes chas dbye bar bya'o //
translated: A sense consciousness is devoid of an object.

original: ci ste dbang po'i shes pa nyid rang rig pa yin la /
analyzed: ci ste dbang po'i shes pa nyid rang rig pa yin la /
translated: If you say that a sense consciousness itself is reflexive awareness,

original: rang rig pa las gzhan pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa ni med de /
analyzed: rang rig pa las gzhan pa'i dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa ni med de /
translated: then there is no sense consciousness arisen from a sense faculty that is other than reflexive awareness,

original: mig la sogs pa'i stabs kyis rang rig pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i stabs kyis rang rig pa skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because reflexive awareness arises by the power of the eyes and so on.

original: dbang po'i shes pa don byed pa las byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa don byed pa las byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the sense consciousness arisen from the operation of the object?

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su gsal bar myong ba ni dbang po las 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid yongs su gsal bar myong ba ni dbang po las 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The experience of the manifestation of its own nature does not operate from the sense faculty.

original: 'on te gsal bar myong ba dbang po med par mi 'jug na ni /
analyzed: 'on te gsal bar myong ba dbang po med par mi 'jug na ni /
translated: But if the experience of manifestation does not operate without the sense faculty,

original: myong ba @15b thams cad gsal ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: myong ba @15b thams cad gsal ba nyid yin la /
translated: then all experience would be manifestation.

original: don ni cung zad gsal zhing cung zad mi gsal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: don ni cung zad gsal zhing cung zad mi gsal ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the object sometimes manifest and sometimes not?

original: 'on te mig med par ji ltar gsal ba nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mig med par ji ltar gsal ba nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But if it is without eyes, how can it be manifest?

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa dbang po med kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma yin nam /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa dbang po med kyang gsal ba'i rang bzhin ma yin nam /
translated: Is not the consciousness in a dream, even without a sense faculty, of the nature of manifestation?

original: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa ni don la 'jug cing /
analyzed: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa ni don la 'jug cing /
translated: Therefore, the sense consciousness operates on the object,

original: don med na ni don med pa can te /
analyzed: don med na ni don med pa can te /
translated: and if there is no object, it is without object,

original: de la don thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la don thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not obtain the object.

original: spyi yang shes pa'i rang bzhin phyir //
analyzed: spyi yang shes pa'i rang bzhin phyir //
translated: And because the universal is of the nature of consciousness,

original: don du thal bar 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: don du thal bar 'gyur zhe na //
translated: it follows that it is an object.

original: de ltar 'dod phyir skyon med de //
analyzed: de ltar 'dod phyir skyon med de //
translated: But there is no fault, because we accept that,

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid kyi spyi //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid kyi spyi //
translated: because the universal is the nature of the object itself.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: skra shad la sogs rnams shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don yin na /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs rnams shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis don yin na /
translated: If the hairs and so on are the nature of the object by way of consciousness,

original: spyi yang don gyi ngo bo nyid dang gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: spyi yang don gyi ngo bo nyid dang gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it follows that the universal is the nature of the object and the nature of the manifest.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de ltar te shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis don nyid dang gsal ba nyid du spyi yang 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar te shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis don nyid dang gsal ba nyid du spyi yang 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the universal is asserted to be the nature of the object and the nature of the manifest by way of consciousness.

original: de'i phyir skyon 'di med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyon 'di med de /
translated: Therefore this error does not arise.

original: 'di ltar spyi'i shes pa yongs su gsal bar myong zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi'i shes pa yongs su gsal bar myong zhing /
translated: Thus the consciousness of the universal is experienced as completely manifest,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang yin no //
translated: and it is also a specific characteristic.

original: 'o na gal te spyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na gal te spyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If the universal is the nature of the consciousness of the universal,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang gsal ba yin no //
translated: then it is a specific characteristic and manifest.

original: ji ltar spyi mi gsal bar snang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar spyi mi gsal bar snang ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the universal appears as unmanifest?

original: smras pa / don de phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi nyid do //
analyzed: smras pa / don de phyi rol gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi nyid do //
translated: We say: That object is a universal by way of its external nature.

original: 'jal bas ngo bo nyid de dpyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jal bas ngo bo nyid de dpyod pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is analyzed by way of the nature of the object‚Äù is that it is investigated.

original: don la dpyod pas spyi nyid dang mi gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don la dpyod pas spyi nyid dang mi gsal ba nyid do //
translated: Since the object is investigated, it is a universal and unmanifest.

original: 'o na gal te shes pa nyid spyi'i rnam par snang ba yin na ni shes pa bzhin de'i rnam pa yang tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar spyir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na gal te shes pa nyid spyi'i rnam par snang ba yin na ni shes pa bzhin de'i rnam pa yang tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar spyir 'gyur /
translated: But if consciousness itself appears in the aspect of a universal, then like consciousness, its aspect would be distinct, so how could it be a universal?

original: shes pa'i rnam pa rig pa la yang phyi rol gyi don dang ji ltar phrad cing /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa rig pa la yang phyi rol gyi don dang ji ltar phrad cing /
translated: And how does the aspect of consciousness that is aware of the aspect of an external object come to contact the external object?

original: phyi rol gyi spyi med par sa bon med na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi spyi med par sa bon med na /
translated: If there is no external universal without a seed,

original: ji ltar spyi yin zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar spyi yin zhe na ;
translated: how can it be a universal?

original: smras pa / kun la mtshungs pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / kun la mtshungs pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: We say: Because it has the same nature in all,

original: de ldog pa la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ldog pa la brten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: because it is based on the exclusion of that.

original: khra bo dang nag po la sogs pa thams cad la ba lang gi rnam pa mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khra bo dang nag po la sogs pa thams cad la ba lang gi rnam pa mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: The aspect of a cow appears to have the same nature in all, whether variegated or black, etc.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa'i don gcig tu byas pa las phyi rol pa rnams la nus pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa'i don gcig tu byas pa las phyi rol pa rnams la nus pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because the seen and the cognized are taken to be the same, it is called potentiality for outsiders.

original: phyi rol pa de rnams kyang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa gang yin pa de la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: phyi rol pa de rnams kyang rigs mi mthun pa las log pa gang yin pa de la brten nas skyes pa'i phyir ram /
translated: And because those non-Buddhists generate their conceptions in dependence on the negation of the heterogeneity of cause and effect,

original: brgyud nas phyi rol gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis rtogs pa skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: brgyud nas phyi rol gyi dngos po'i stobs kyis rtogs pa skye ba'i phyir /
translated: or because their conceptions are generated indirectly by the power of external things,

original: rtog pa de yang log pa'i dngos po rnams la 'jug pa ste /üîΩdes na mi bslu @16a * //
analyzed: rtog pa de yang log pa'i dngos po rnams la 'jug pa ste / des na mi bslu @16a * //
translated: those conceptions engage with unreal things.

original: ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called ‚Äúnon-deceptive.‚Äù

original: rnam pa la spyir ji ltar rtog par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa la spyir ji ltar rtog par byed de /
translated: How do they conceive of universals in general?

original: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nyid khyad par med pa ni spyi ste rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzugs la sogs pa nyid khyad par med pa ni spyi ste rjes su dpag pa'i yul ma yin nam /
translated: Because form and so on are undifferentiated, they are universals, and they are not objects of inference, are they?

original: 'di ltar gdon mi za bar rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gdon mi za bar rang gi mtshan nyid rjes su dpag pa'i yul yin te /
translated: Undoubtedly, the object of inference is a specific characteristic.

original: de ltar ma yin na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na rjes su dpag pa tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, inference would not be a valid form of cognition.

original: ji ltar gang tshe rjes su dpag pas rnam pa tsam yul du byed na de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pas 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar gang tshe rjes su dpag pas rnam pa tsam yul du byed na de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pas 'jug par mi 'gyur la /
translated: When inference takes only the aspect as its object, it does not engage with the specific characteristic because it does not know it.

original: rjes su dpag pas spyi 'dzin par byed kyang phyi rol gyi don la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas spyi 'dzin par byed kyang phyi rol gyi don la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and that it is not the case that the universal is apprehended by inference and the particular is apprehended by perception.

original: des na shes pa'i rnam pas sam /
analyzed: des na shes pa'i rnam pas sam /
translated: Therefore, the form of consciousness or

original: spyi las gsal ba rnams khong du chud par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi las gsal ba rnams khong du chud par khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: the particulars should not be accepted as understood through the universal.

original: 'on te dang po rjes su dpag pas spyi nyid rtogs shing /
analyzed: 'on te dang po rjes su dpag pas spyi nyid rtogs shing /
translated: But if the universal itself is understood first by inference,

original: spyi nyid kyis mtshon nas shes pa'i phyir gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: spyi nyid kyis mtshon nas shes pa'i phyir gsal ba rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and the particulars are understood through the universal that is indicated,

original: khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin na ni /
analyzed: khyad par gyi ngo bo nyid ni ma yin na ni /
translated: and not through the nature of the particulars themselves,

original: spyis kyang gsal ba rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: spyis kyang gsal ba rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: then the universal does not understand the particulars,

original: der yang gsal ba nyid spyir snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: der yang gsal ba nyid spyir snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: because the particulars themselves do not appear as the universal.

original: 'on te mtshon nas shes pa'i phyir spyi rtogs pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te mtshon nas shes pa'i phyir spyi rtogs pa yin na ni /
translated: But if the universal is understood through the indication of the particulars,

original: spyi 'di lta bu dag snang ba brgyud pa ni med pa nyid yin no //üîΩgzhan yang rigs las rigs gzhan rjes su dpog pa na /
analyzed: spyi 'di lta bu dag snang ba brgyud pa ni med pa nyid yin no // gzhan yang rigs las rigs gzhan rjes su dpog pa na /
translated: then there is no indirect appearance of such a universal.üîΩMoreover, if another type is inferred from a type,

original: de yang rigs gzhan rjes su dpog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rigs gzhan rjes su dpog pa'i phyir /
translated: then because another type is inferred,

original: thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be an infinite regress.

original: de'i phyir mthar gsal ba dag nges par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa nyid spyi yin par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthar gsal ba dag nges par bya ba'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa nyid spyi yin par rigs so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, in order to definitely ascertain the final clear appearance, it is logical that form and so on are universals.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: To that, we reply:

original: brjod bya nyid phyir de dngos min //üîΩdbang tshogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod bya nyid phyir de dngos min // dbang tshogs 'bras bcas nyid phyir ro //
translated: It is not real because it is the object of expression,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is the collection of sense faculties and their results.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid spyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid spyi ni ma yin te /
translated: Form and so on are not real universals.

original: gal te gzugs la sogs pa nyid spyi'i shes pas rtogs na ni de'i tshe sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa spyi'i rnam pa can gang yin pa des na /
analyzed: gal te gzugs la sogs pa nyid spyi'i shes pas rtogs na ni de'i tshe sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa spyi'i rnam pa can gang yin pa des na /
translated: If form and so on were realized by a cognition of a universal, then at that time the cognition arisen from sound that has the aspect of a universal would

original: gzugs la sogs pa ma lus pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ma lus pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis myong ba'i phyir /
translated: experience all form and so on by means of its own clear appearance.

original: dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the collection of sense faculties would be pointless.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don du mig la sogs pa'i tshogs 'dod na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don du mig la sogs pa'i tshogs 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that the collection of sense faculties such as the eyes is for the purpose of apprehending form and so on,

original: gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa de yang dbang po med par sgra la sogs pa las skye bas /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa de yang dbang po med par sgra la sogs pa las skye bas /
translated: then that realization of form and so on would arise from sound and so on without sense faculties.

original: da ni dbang pos ci zhig bya /
analyzed: da ni dbang pos ci zhig bya /
translated: What would the sense faculties do now?

original: 'on te dbang pos ni bde blag tu byed de /
analyzed: 'on te dbang pos ni bde blag tu byed de /
translated: But if you say that the sense faculty easily produces it,

original: 'di ltar dbang po yod pa'i dga' ba gang yin pa de lta bu mig @16b dang bral ba can la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po yod pa'i dga' ba gang yin pa de lta bu mig @16b dang bral ba can la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the pleasure that exists due to the sense faculty does not exist for one who lacks eyes.

original: bde ba la sogs pa la yang sgra las shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la yang sgra las shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt pleasure and so on also known from sound?

original: nges na sgra nyid las bde ba rtogs na yongs su dga' ba'i phyir dbang pos ci zhig bya /
analyzed: nges na sgra nyid las bde ba rtogs na yongs su dga' ba'i phyir dbang pos ci zhig bya /
translated: If pleasure is known from sound itself, then what is the use of the sense faculty, since it is completely unnecessary?

original: gzhan yang dbang po med pa las sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po med pa las sdug bsngal skye ba gang yin pa de ni gzugs la sogs pa /
translated: Moreover, if suffering arises from the absence of a sense faculty, then it exists

original: mthong ba med na yang yod pas so //
analyzed: mthong ba med na yang yod pas so //
translated: even when form and so on are not seen.

original: gal te yang mig la sogs pa med par sgra nyid las gsal bar mthong ba skye na ni /
analyzed: gal te yang mig la sogs pa med par sgra nyid las gsal bar mthong ba skye na ni /
translated: If a clear visual consciousness arises from sound alone without the eye and so on,

original: de'i tshe long bas kyang shin tu gsal ba kho nar sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la gzugs la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe long bas kyang shin tu gsal ba kho nar sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la gzugs la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: then the blind would have a very clear consciousness of form and so on arising from sound.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i skabs ci zhig yod /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i skabs ci zhig yod /
translated: Therefore what occasion for suffering is there?

original: 'on te las kyi stobs kyis dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyun 'bras bu med kyang skye ste /
analyzed: 'on te las kyi stobs kyis dbang po la sogs pa'i rgyun 'bras bu med kyang skye ste /
translated: But if the continuum of the faculties, etc., is produced by the power of karma, even though it is without result,

original: dngos po rnams rtog pa sngon du btang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams rtog pa sngon du btang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: then entities are not preceded by conceptualization,

original: gang gis na 'bras bu med pas skye ba med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na 'bras bu med pas skye ba med pa yin zhe na /
translated: since they are not produced when there is no result.

original: dbang po'i tshogs skye ru chug na /
analyzed: dbang po'i tshogs skye ru chug na /
translated: Even if the continuum of the faculties is produced,

original: de yang 'bras bu med par dpog par byed do //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu med par dpog par byed do //
translated: it is inferred that it is without result.

original: de lta na yang sgra las gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang sgra las gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even so, form, etc., is not understood from sound.

original: de bas na brjod par bya ba'i phyir spyi ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na brjod par bya ba'i phyir spyi ni gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal is not the intrinsic reality of form, etc., because it is the object of expression.

original: 'on te ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo nyid spyi ste sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on te ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi ngo bo nyid spyi ste sgra'i brjod par bya ba yin la /
translated: But if the universal is the intrinsic reality of the name and the causal process, and is the object of expression of sound,

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i tshogs don med pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni mig la sogs pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dbang po'i tshogs don med pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and form, etc., is the object of the eye, etc., then the collection of faculties is not meaningless.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: ming sogs brjod yin na smra po //
analyzed: ming sogs brjod yin na smra po //
translated: If the universal is the object of expression of the name, etc., then the speaker

original: nyan po brjod bya rjes 'brel can //
analyzed: nyan po brjod bya rjes 'brel can //
translated: The listener is related to the expression.

original: ming sogs 'brel pa med pa na //
analyzed: ming sogs 'brel pa med pa na //
translated: If names and so on are not related,

original: don la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: One cannot engage in objects.

original: ngag ming la 'jug la ming rgyu mtshan la'o //
analyzed: ngag ming la 'jug la ming rgyu mtshan la'o //
translated: Speech engages names, and names engage the causal process.

original: rgyu mtshan gyis don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyis don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir /
translated: The causal process clarifies the object.

original: de ltar ming la sogs pa brjod par khas len na ni ming la sogs pa ldan pa yin pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar ming la sogs pa brjod par khas len na ni ming la sogs pa ldan pa yin pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba ste /
translated: Thus, if one accepts that names and so on are expressions, then one must accept that the formations are associated with names and so on.

original: gang gi tshe na smra ba po dang 'brel pa yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na smra ba po dang 'brel pa yin nam /
translated: Are they related to the speaker?

original: nyan pa po dang 'brel tam /
analyzed: nyan pa po dang 'brel tam /
translated: Are they related to the listener?

original: yang na don dang 'brel pa can yin nam /
analyzed: yang na don dang 'brel pa can yin nam /
translated: Or are they related to the object?

original: nam yang gang dang yang 'brel pa med pa can bzhir brtag grang na /
analyzed: nam yang gang dang yang 'brel pa med pa can bzhir brtag grang na /
translated: Or are they unrelated to anything?

original: de la gal te nyan pa dang / smra ba po dang 'brel ba'i ming la sogs pa sgras brjod par 'dod na ni de lta na phyi rol gyi don la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te nyan pa dang / smra ba po dang 'brel ba'i ming la sogs pa sgras brjod par 'dod na ni de lta na phyi rol gyi don la 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If one asserts that names and so on are expressed by sound and are related to the listener and the speaker, then one cannot engage in external objects.

original: ming la sogs pa nyan pa dang smra ba po dang 'brel pa can shes pa'i phyir /üîΩtha dad pa'i yul tha dad pa can rtogs par @17a * //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa nyan pa dang smra ba po dang 'brel pa can shes pa'i phyir / tha dad pa'i yul tha dad pa can rtogs par @17a * //
translated: because the consciousness that is related to the name, etc., and the hearer and speaker is known.

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: The consciousness that has a different object does not cognize a different object.

original: mi rtogs par 'jug na ni thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / nges pa yang don med par 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te don la tshul 'dra las //
analyzed: mi rtogs par 'jug na ni thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / nges pa yang don med par 'gyur ro // gal te don la tshul 'dra las //
translated: If it engages without cognizing, then it would engage everything, and ascertainment would be pointless.üîΩIf it engages through error in the similarity of mode to the object,

original: 'khrul pas 'jug na kun du min //
analyzed: 'khrul pas 'jug na kun du min //
translated: then it is not universal.

original: yul la 'khrul min zhes bya ba ni //üîΩ'on te ming la sogs pa gang don gang la ;
analyzed: yul la 'khrul min zhes bya ba ni // 'on te ming la sogs pa gang don gang la ;
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot in error with respect to the object‚Äù means

original: de dag tshul 'dra ba las ming la sogs pa rtogs na don la 'khrul pas 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de dag tshul 'dra ba las ming la sogs pa rtogs na don la 'khrul pas 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: If the name, etc., is similar in mode to the object, then the consciousness that apprehends the name, etc., engages through error in the object.

original: don ni phyi rol lo //
analyzed: don ni phyi rol lo //
translated: The object is external.

original: dper na mtshe ma dag gcig brjod na 'dra ba'i phyir cig shos la rmongs nas 'jug par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mtshe ma dag gcig brjod na 'dra ba'i phyir cig shos la rmongs nas 'jug par byed do zhe na /
translated: For example, when one twin is mentioned, the other is engaged through error, because of similarity.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gal te ming dang rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa'i sgra las byung pa'i shes pa ji ltar 'khrul par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te ming dang rgyu mtshan 'dzin pa'i sgra las byung pa'i shes pa ji ltar 'khrul par 'gyur /
translated: How could the consciousness that arises from the sound that apprehends the name and the causal process be in error?

original: 'on te 'khrul pa yin na yang yul med pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'khrul pa yin na yang yul med pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is an error, then it would be without an object.

original: de lta na ming la sogs pa 'dzin pa por mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta na ming la sogs pa 'dzin pa por mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, it is not suitable to be the apprehender of names, etc.

original: ming la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not apprehend the entityness of names, etc.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba na shes pa dngos po 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba na shes pa dngos po 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no ;
translated: When its own entity appears, consciousness is the apprehender of an entity, not otherwise.

original: /'on te ming la sogs pa yang ming gzhan gyi rgyus gtogs pa de lta na ni ming la sogs pa'i 'phreng ba ring por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: /'on te ming la sogs pa yang ming gzhan gyi rgyus gtogs pa de lta na ni ming la sogs pa'i 'phreng ba ring por 'gyur ro //
translated: But if names, etc., are also included by the cause of another name, then there would be a long chain of names, etc.

original: des na mtshe ma dag la yang ming la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa'i dpe ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mtshe ma dag la yang ming la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa'i dpe ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example of twins is not established as an error in the consciousness that apprehends names, etc.

original: der yang sgra las ming la sogs pa nyid rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: der yang sgra las ming la sogs pa nyid rtogs pa ste /
translated: In that case, names, etc., are understood from sound.

original: ming la sogs pa rtogs pas kyang ji ltar mtshe ma la sogs pa don gyi ngo bo nyid la 'jug par 'gyur /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa rtogs pas kyang ji ltar mtshe ma la sogs pa don gyi ngo bo nyid la 'jug par 'gyur /
translated: But how do names, etc., engage the entityness of the object by understanding names, etc.?

original: de'i phyir brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mtshe ma la sogs pa dpe yin /
analyzed: de'i phyir brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar mtshe ma la sogs pa dpe yin /
translated: Therefore, since the debate is similar, how can twins and so on be examples?

original: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa tshul 'dra ba las 'khrul pas 'jug pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: khas blangs nas kyang brjod pa tshul 'dra ba las 'khrul pas 'jug pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Even if you accept that, it is still just confusion that engages in a similar way.

original: 'on kyang thams cad du ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad du ma yin te /
translated: But it is not always so.

original: mtshe ma dag gcig tu nges kyang gzhan kho na la thams cad du 'jug pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mtshe ma dag gcig tu nges kyang gzhan kho na la thams cad du 'jug pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: Even if twins are certain to be similar, they are not always similar in all respects.

original: sgul ba nyid la 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgul ba nyid la 'jug pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we see that they are not similar in terms of shaking.

original: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa dag la 'dra ba yod pa ma yin la tshul 'dra ba med na yang ji ltar 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: lus can dang lus can ma yin pa dag la 'dra ba yod pa ma yin la tshul 'dra ba med na yang ji ltar 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: Similarity does not exist in embodied and disembodied things, and if there is no similarity, how can there be confusion?

original: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni phyi rol pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni phyi rol pa yin la /
translated: Thus the nature of form and so on is external.

original: ming la sogs pa ni lus med pa ste /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa ni lus med pa ste /
translated: Name and so on are not embodied.

original: gzhan du na ji ltar ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de'i yin /
analyzed: gzhan du na ji ltar ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed de'i yin /
translated: Otherwise, how could they be nonassociated compositional factors?

original: gzhan yang yul la 'khrul par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang yul la 'khrul par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, there would be no confusion about objects.

original: smra ba po dang nyan pa po'i yul du ming la sogs pas bskul na /
analyzed: smra ba po dang nyan pa po'i yul du ming la sogs pas bskul na /
translated: If the name and so on are applied to the object of the speaker and the listener,

original: ji ltar don gyi phyogs su @17b shes par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar don gyi phyogs su @17b shes par 'gyur /
translated: how can one understand the object?

original: yul so sor nges pa'i mtshe ma la brjod pa na /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa'i mtshe ma la brjod pa na /
translated: When one speaks to a twin whose objects are distinct,

original: yul gzhan na gnas pa'i de dang 'dra ba rtogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan na gnas pa'i de dang 'dra ba rtogs pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one does not understand the other twin who is in another place.

original: 'on te smra ba po'i yul la yang ngo bo nyid brjod pa med kyi /
analyzed: 'on te smra ba po'i yul la yang ngo bo nyid brjod pa med kyi /
translated: But if the object of the speaker is not expressed by the name,

original: 'on kyang ming gi tshul las yin pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang ming gi tshul las yin pas /
translated: but rather by the mode of the name,

original: yul du yang 'khrul pas rtogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: yul du yang 'khrul pas rtogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: then the object is understood by error.

original: 'o na ni yul ma brjod pa'i phyir ji ltar don gyi phyogs la 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni yul ma brjod pa'i phyir ji ltar don gyi phyogs la 'jug ste /
translated: But if the object is not expressed, how can one engage the object?

original: yul med pa'i ming brjod pa na yul dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la su yang 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yul med pa'i ming brjod pa na yul dang 'brel pa'i gzugs la sogs pa la su yang 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: When the name is expressed without an object, no one engages form and so on that is related to the object.

original: 'on te ming dang gzugs dag gcig tu zhen nas phyi rol la 'jug na ni /
analyzed: 'on te ming dang gzugs dag gcig tu zhen nas phyi rol la 'jug na ni /
translated: But if one engages the external object by adhering to the unity of name and form,

original: de la yang ci ming la sogs pa phyi rol du 'dogs pa yin nam /
analyzed: de la yang ci ming la sogs pa phyi rol du 'dogs pa yin nam /
translated: then in that case, is the external object imputed to the name and so on?

original: yang na phyi rol pa ming la sogs par 'dogs pa gnyis su brtag na /
analyzed: yang na phyi rol pa ming la sogs par 'dogs pa gnyis su brtag na /
translated: Or else, if you imagine that external things are designated by names, etc.,

original: gal te ming la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid phyi rol du 'dogs na ni de lta na ni ming la sogs pa nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te ming la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid phyi rol du 'dogs na ni de lta na ni ming la sogs pa nyid rtogs pa ma yin nam /
translated: if the nature of names, etc., is designated as external, then is it not just names, etc., that are understood?

original: ji ltar phyi rol la 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol la 'jug pa yin /
translated: How can one engage with external things?

original: gang du shes pa snang ba gang yin pa de nyid du 'jug par rigs kyi /
analyzed: gang du shes pa snang ba gang yin pa de nyid du 'jug par rigs kyi /
translated: It is reasonable that consciousness engages with just that which appears to it,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: not with something else,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because otherwise there would be absurd consequences.

original: 'on te don gyi ngo bo nyid la ming la sogs par 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: 'on te don gyi ngo bo nyid la ming la sogs par 'dogs na ni /
translated: But if the nature of an object is designated as a name, etc.,

original: phyi rol nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi ming la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol nyid rtogs par 'gyur gyi ming la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: then external things are understood, not names, etc.

original: phyi rol du brtags pa gang yin pa de nyid shes pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol du brtags pa gang yin pa de nyid shes pa'i yul yin te /
translated: The object of consciousness is just that which is imagined as external,

original: yul du ma byas par gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul du ma byas par gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to designate something that is not taken as an object.

original: 'on te gang gi shes pa'i rnam pa nyid sgra las rtogs kyi /
analyzed: 'on te gang gi shes pa'i rnam pa nyid sgra las rtogs kyi /
translated: But if the form of consciousness itself is understood from words,

original: don la mi reg par 'dod pa de'i yang phyi rol la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / shes mtshungs min /
analyzed: don la mi reg par 'dod pa de'i yang phyi rol la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na / smras pa / shes mtshungs min /
translated: If you say that the mind does not touch the object, how does it engage with the external object?üîΩWe reply: The mind is not like knowledge.

original: rnam pa de lta'i blo nyid ni //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta'i blo nyid ni //
translated: The mind is not like knowledge,

original: skye phyir zhes bya ste /
analyzed: skye phyir zhes bya ste /
translated: because it arises with that aspect.

original: shes pa ste shes pa'i rnam pa brjod par bya ba la ni 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa ste shes pa'i rnam pa brjod par bya ba la ni 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i skyon mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind is not like knowledge, because the mind is not like knowledge.

original: blo de lta bu'i rnam pa ste yul gyi rnam pa can skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo de lta bu'i rnam pa ste yul gyi rnam pa can skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind is not like knowledge, because it arises with that aspect.üîΩThe mind arises with the aspect of the object, and it is seen that people engage in activity with respect to the object. Therefore, there is no fault.

original: 'di ltar bag chags sad pa las blo skye bar 'gyur ba ni rang gi rnam pa nyid khyad par can gyi yul du don bya ba byed par sems pas skye bo 'jug phar mthong ba'i phyir cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar bag chags sad pa las blo skye bar 'gyur ba ni rang gi rnam pa nyid khyad par can gyi yul du don bya ba byed par sems pas skye bo 'jug phar mthong ba'i phyir cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: The mind arises from the activation of the latent ten dency. It is seen that people engage in activity with respect to the object, thinking that the object has a special aspect. Therefore, there is no contradiction at all.

original: 'on te bye brag tu smra ba'i sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa can yang ming dang rgyu mtshan de nyid la phyi rol du zhen nas 'jug go snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'on te bye brag tu smra ba'i sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa can yang ming dang rgyu mtshan de nyid la phyi rol du zhen nas 'jug go snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think that the consciousness that arises from the words of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ika, which has the aspect of name and the signified, engages by adhering to name and the signified as external,

original: smras pa / gzhan la de min te /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan la de min te /
translated: we reply: It is not so for others,

original: blo la khas mi len phyir ro //üîΩphyi rol @18a * //
analyzed: blo la khas mi len phyir ro // phyi rol @18a * //
translated: because they do not accept the cognition.üîΩEven if they accept

original: don du snang ba can //üîΩkhas len na yang shes pa las //
analyzed: don du snang ba can // khas len na yang shes pa las //
translated: that it appears as an external object,

original: tha dad pa ni tshad can min //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni tshad can min //
translated: the cognition is not different from the object,

original: ldog pa grub pa med phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ldog pa grub pa med phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: because the negation is not established.

original: ming la sogs pa brjod byar 'dod pa gzhan la /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa brjod byar 'dod pa gzhan la /
translated: For others who assert that name and so on are the signified,

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa de med na /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa de med na /
translated: if the cognition that has the aspect does not exist,

original: ci ste 'khrul pas 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: ci ste 'khrul pas 'jug pa yin /
translated: why does it engage through error?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na blo de lta bu'i rnam pa can phyi rol gyi don du snang ba khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na blo de lta bu'i rnam pa can phyi rol gyi don du snang ba khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because they do not accept that cognition that has that aspect appears as an external object.

original: shes pa rnam pa med pa nyid yin la phyi rol gyi don ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa med pa nyid yin la phyi rol gyi don ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Cognition is without aspect, but the external object has an aspect.

original: ming dang rgyu mtshan dag don la sgro btags pa yang ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar ming la sogs pa'am /
analyzed: ming dang rgyu mtshan dag don la sgro btags pa yang ma yin te / 'di ltar ming la sogs pa'am /
translated: Nor is the name and the reason a superimposition on the object.üîΩIf the object is apprehended as the entity of the name,

original: ma rtogs par don gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ma rtogs par don gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or if it is apprehended as the entity of the reason,üîΩthen how is it apprehended as the entity of the object?

original: de la gal te sgra las byung ba'i shes pas ming la sogs pa ngo bo nyid du 'dzin na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te sgra las byung ba'i shes pas ming la sogs pa ngo bo nyid du 'dzin na ni /
translated: If the consciousness that arises from sound apprehends the name as the entity,

original: ji ltar don gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar don gyi ngo bo nyid du zhen pa yin /
translated: then how is it apprehended as the entity of the object?

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'o zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid du rtogs pa'o zhes brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not correct to say that apprehending it as its own entity is apprehending it as the entity of another.

original: ming la sogs pa ma rtogs na yang don gyi rnam pa nyid du ji ltar rtogs par 'thad de /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa ma rtogs na yang don gyi rnam pa nyid du ji ltar rtogs par 'thad de /
translated: If the name is not apprehended, how is it tenable that the object is apprehended as the entity of the object?

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is absurd.

original: 'di ltar thams cad thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, everything would be apprehended as the entity of everything.

original: 'on te shes pa ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa can du 'dod de /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi rnam pa can du 'dod de /
translated: Or if you assert that consciousness has the aspect of the name and the reason,

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes par smra ba tshad ma'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes par smra ba tshad ma'i stobs las 'ongs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the assertion of consciousness with aspects is based on the power of valid knowledge.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: khas len na ste rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa khas len na /
analyzed: khas len na ste rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa khas len na /
translated: If one accepts, that is, if one accepts consciousness with aspects,

original: ming la sogs pa ming dang rgyu mtshan la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa las tha dad pa'i tshad ma med pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa ming dang rgyu mtshan la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa las tha dad pa'i tshad ma med pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: there is no valid knowledge other than the consciousness that observes names and so on and their causal characteristics.

original: tshad mas 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin pas tshad ma med pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid la tshad ma med pa can no//
analyzed: tshad mas 'dzin pa yod pa ma yin pas tshad ma med pa ste de'i ngo bo nyid la tshad ma med pa can no//
translated: Since there is no apprehension by valid knowledge, there is no valid knowledge. That which has no valid knowledge by nature is one that has no valid knowledge.

original: 'dir sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can nyid snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa yul gyi rnam pa can nyid snang ba yin gyi /
translated: Here what appears is the consciousness arisen from sound that has the aspect of the object.

original: de las gzhan pa'i ming la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ming la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the apprehension of names and so on that are different from that.

original: de bas na ma rtogs pa'i ming la sogs par rtogs pa ni legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma rtogs pa'i ming la sogs par rtogs pa ni legs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not correct to realize names and so on that are not realized.

original: 'o na ji ltar mig gi shes pa la de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sngon po nyid snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mig gi shes pa la de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i sngon po nyid snang ba yin gyi /
translated: Well then, in the case of visual consciousness, blue itself, which is of the same nature as that, appears.

original: phyi rol gyi don snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don snang ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The appearance of external objects is not so.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don yod pa'o //
translated: However, external objects do exist.

original: de bzhin du sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la ming la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa snang ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la ming la sogs pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa snang ba la /
translated: In the same way, in a consciousness that arises from words, the name, etc., appears as its own nature.

original: ming gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa la phan 'dogs pa'i ming la sogs pa gzhan yod do zhe na /
analyzed: ming gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa la phan 'dogs pa'i ming la sogs pa gzhan yod do zhe na /
translated: But there are other names, etc., that assist the consciousness that has the aspect of the name.

original: de ni @18b mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni @18b mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not tenable.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa'i ldog pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa'i ldog pa grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the distinction of the eye consciousness, etc., is established.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa mig la sogs pa yod na yang so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus su 'byung bar rtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa mig la sogs pa yod na yang so sor nges pa'i yul dang dus su 'byung bar rtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Even when the eye consciousness, etc., exist, it is understood that they occur in a specific place and time.

original: res 'ga' ba'i shes pas de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la phan 'dogs pa phyi rol grub pa ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ba'i shes pas de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la phan 'dogs pa phyi rol grub pa ste /
translated: The external object that assists the consciousness that has its aspect is established by the intermittent consciousness.

original: sgra las 'byung ba'i shes pa ni brda rtsol ba tsam gyis skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra las 'byung ba'i shes pa ni brda rtsol ba tsam gyis skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because a consciousness that arises from words is produced merely by the exertion of a sign.

original: de la shes pa las tha dad pa'i ming la sogs par brtags pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la shes pa las tha dad pa'i ming la sogs par brtags pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The imputation of names, etc., which are different from consciousness, does not exist.

original: gal te shes kun don ldan na //
analyzed: gal te shes kun don ldan na //
translated: If all consciousnesses had objects,

original: rmi sogs na gzhan du mthong phyir //
analyzed: rmi sogs na gzhan du mthong phyir //
translated: because one sees otherwise in dreams, etc.,üîΩit would be illogical.

original: rigs min zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad rnam pa med pa nyid ma yin nam //
analyzed: rigs min zhes bya ba ni shes pa thams cad rnam pa med pa nyid ma yin nam //
translated: All consciousnesses are devoid of aspects, aren‚Äôt they?

original: de la rnam pa ni sngon po la sogs par snang ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa ni sngon po la sogs par snang ba'o //
translated: An aspect is the appearance as blue, etc.

original: de bas na shes bya sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad don gyi yin te /
analyzed: de bas na shes bya sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad don gyi yin te /
