translated: Therefore, all aspects of objects such as blue, etc., are objects,

original: shes pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not consciousness.

original: des na shes pa thams cad don dang ldan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na shes pa thams cad don dang ldan pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, all consciousnesses have objects,

original: cung zad kyang rang gi rnam pa can ni ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
analyzed: cung zad kyang rang gi rnam pa can ni ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khrul pa yin /
translated: but since not even the slightest one has its own aspect, how can they be mistaken?

original: shes pa'i rnam pa phyi rol gyi tshul du snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa phyi rol gyi tshul du snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of consciousness does not appear as an external object.üîΩTherefore, even a consciousness arisen from sound has an object,

original: des na sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: des na sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: because it has an object.

original: ji ltar ming la sogs pa tshad ma med pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ming la sogs pa tshad ma med pa can yin zhe na /
translated: How can names, etc. be without a valid cognition?

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i khyab pa cis shes te /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i khyab pa cis shes te /
translated: How do you know that the pervasion holds, that all consciousnesses are with an object?

original: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa myong ba nyid don du yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mdun na gnas pa'i rnam pa myong ba nyid don du yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mere experience of the aspect that is present in front is not the existent object.

original: de lta na ni 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i cha med par 'gyur te thams cad don dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'khrul pa dang ma 'khrul pa'i cha med par 'gyur te thams cad don dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, there would be no distinction between error and non-error, because all would be endowed with an object.

original: 'on te shes pa don dang ldan na yang don byed pa dang mi phrad pas 'khrul par gnas pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa don dang ldan na yang don byed pa dang mi phrad pas 'khrul par gnas pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if consciousness is endowed with an object, it is still in error, because it does not encounter the object‚Äôs functioning.

original: don byed pa dang bral bas dmigs pa med pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: don byed pa dang bral bas dmigs pa med pa nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur na /
translated: If it does not encounter the object‚Äôs functioning, how could it not be without an object?

original: ci ste don med pa ma yin /
analyzed: ci ste don med pa ma yin /
translated: But if it is not without an object,

original: gzhan yang de rmi lam la sogs pa na dmigs pa med pa can mthong ba'i phyir yul med pa nyid du rigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de rmi lam la sogs pa na dmigs pa med pa can mthong ba'i phyir yul med pa nyid du rigs pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is reasonable that there is no object, because we see that in dreams, etc., there is consciousness without an object.

original: 'on te rmi lam gyi shes pa la dmigs pa dang bcas par 'dod na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rmi lam gyi shes pa la dmigs pa dang bcas par 'dod na ni ma yin te /
translated: But if you assert that consciousness in a dream has an object, then it is not so,

original: de la ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not established.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa 'ga' zhig tu yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa 'ga' zhig tu yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established as anything that has an object.

original: sad pa'i shes pa la yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pa la yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt it exist in the cognition of the waking state?

original: de lta na yang sad pa'i gnas skabs rmi lam na med pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi shes pa dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang sad pa'i gnas skabs rmi lam na med pa'i phyir rmi lam gyi shes pa dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Even so, because the state of waking does not exist in the dream state, the cognition of the dream state is without an object.

original: de'i phyir rmi lam dang zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa la sogs @19a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir rmi lam dang zla ba gnyis su snang ba'i shes pa la sogs @19a * //
translated: Therefore, in the dream state, and in the cognition of the appearance of two moons, etc.,

original: pa na'o ; / gzhan du ste yul med par yang mdun du mthong ba'i phyir shes pa thams cad don dang ldan pa'o zhes pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa na'o ; / gzhan du ste yul med par yang mdun du mthong ba'i phyir shes pa thams cad don dang ldan pa'o zhes pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not logical to say that all cognitions have objects, because they are seen in front, even though there is no object.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa yang mig la sogs pa'i yul can ma yin nam de bas na rmi lam gyi shes pa don med pa can du rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa yang mig la sogs pa'i yul can ma yin nam de bas na rmi lam gyi shes pa don med pa can du rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the dream cognition also not the object of the eye, etc.? Therefore it is not logical that the dream cognition is without an object.

original: 'dir smras pa ;üîΩ'du byed lam yin /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ; 'du byed lam yin /
translated: Here we say:üîΩThe dream cognition is not the object of the eye, etc.,

original: sngon po la sogs snang phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs snang phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a mental cognition, and because blue, etc., appear.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here we say:

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa snang ba ni ming la sogs pa'i rnam pa de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa snang ba ni ming la sogs pa'i rnam pa de dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The appearance of blue and so on to dream consciousness is not the aspect of name and so on because it is free from that.

original: des na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba las rmi lam gyi shes pa skye'i ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par snang ba las rmi lam gyi shes pa skye'i ldan pa ma yin pa'i 'du byed las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore dream consciousness arises from the appearance of blue and so on, but it does not arise from nonassociated formative factors.

original: 'on te rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yul sngon po la sogs pa nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yul sngon po la sogs pa nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: But the object of dream consciousness is not blue and so on.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi dngos po yul dang dus gzhan ba can rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi dngos po yul dang dus gzhan ba can rmi lam gyi shes pa'i yul yin te /
translated: Rather, the object of dream consciousness is an external thing that exists in a different place and time.

original: 'di ltar rmi lam gyi shes pa la skye ba gzhan gyi dngos po yang snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rmi lam gyi shes pa la skye ba gzhan gyi dngos po yang snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus the thing of another birth appears to dream consciousness.

original: yang na 'di nyid kyi yul lam dus gzhan na yod pa'i yul dang dus gzhan pa can du snang bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na 'di nyid kyi yul lam dus gzhan na yod pa'i yul dang dus gzhan pa can du snang bar byed do //
translated: Or it makes the object of this very consciousness appear to exist in a different place and time.

original: des na rmi lam la sogs pa na yang phyin ci log tu snang gi / bdag nyid thams cad kyis yul med pa can gyi /
analyzed: des na rmi lam la sogs pa na yang phyin ci log tu snang gi / bdag nyid thams cad kyis yul med pa can gyi /
translated: Therefore, even in dreams and so on, the object appears erroneously, but it is not that the object does not exist in any way.

original: shes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not consciousness.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:üîΩBecause it is unobstructed, it is not blue, etc.

original: thogs med phyir na sngo sogs min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩsngon po la sogs pa rmi lam gyi shes pa'i gzung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thogs med phyir na sngo sogs min // zhes bya ba la / sngon po la sogs pa rmi lam gyi shes pa'i gzung bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that blue, etc., are the objects of consciousness in a dream,üîΩbecause the blue, etc., that appear in a dream are not like real blue, etc.üîΩThus, external things are obstructed,üîΩbut the blue, etc., of a dream are not obstructed, etc.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.

original: rmi lam na snang ba sngon po la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po thogs pa dang bcas pa ste /üîΩrmi lam gyi sngon po la ni thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmi lam na snang ba sngon po la sogs pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po thogs pa dang bcas pa ste / rmi lam gyi sngon po la ni thogs pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.üîΩIf external things existed in a dream, then just as a herd of elephants is seen, so too a herd of horses would be seen, because they are equally nonexistent.

analyzed: 'on te don dang phrad pa yod pas zlog pa snang ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the appearance of the object is not reversed because there is contact with the object,

original: don dang phrad pa phyin ci log tu snang ba nyid las kyang ma yin nam /
analyzed: don dang phrad pa phyin ci log tu snang ba nyid las kyang ma yin nam /
translated: then is it not the case that the appearance of the object is reversed because there is contact with the object?

original: 'on te don yod na ji ltar phyin ci log tu shes she na /
analyzed: 'on te don yod na ji ltar phyin ci log tu shes she na /

original: de lta na ni rmi lam na don 'dzin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de lta na ni rmi lam na don 'dzin pa ma yin nam /

original: ji ltar phrad pa ma yin /

original: rmi lam na don med pas phrad pa med ce na /
analyzed: rmi lam na don med pas phrad pa med ce na /

analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan du myong bas phyi rol gyi dngos po rmi lam du myong ngo zhe na /

analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan du yod pa la da lta med pas mi phrad do zhe na /

analyzed: de'i tshe sngar gyi rdul dang 'brel pa'i don byed pa ci ste mi mthong ba yin /

original: dngos po yod pa yang don byed pa de bas na /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa yang don byed pa de bas na /
translated: But if

original: don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir thams cad 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba ste dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir thams cad 'khrul pa'i shes pa'i gzung ba ste dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is devoid of a functioning thing, the object of a mistaken consciousness is not a thing.

original: gal te yang sngar mthong ba nyid kyi dngos po da ltar yod pas dran pa nyams pas snang ba yin na de'i tshe phyin ci log tu snang ba nyid de de'i skyon yang bshad zin to //

translated: If it is the case that the object seen previously is now remembered because it exists, then it is an appearance that is mistaken, and the fault of that has already been explained.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rmi lam la sogs par snang ba'i dngos po 'jig rten pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rmi lam la sogs par snang ba'i dngos po 'jig rten pa ma yin te /
translated: If it is the case that the object that appears in a dream, such as blue, is not a worldly thing,

original: rgyu gzhan las skyes pa de bas na rmi lam gyi shes pa ni dngos po'i yul can no zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan las skyes pa de bas na rmi lam gyi shes pa ni dngos po'i yul can no zhe na /
translated: because it arises from another cause, then the consciousness of a dream has an object that is a thing.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po gsum pa /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa /

translated: Here it is said:

original: yul rung can gyis mi shes pa //
analyzed: yul rung can gyis mi shes pa //
translated: One does not know what is suitable as an object,

original: rang gis shes @20a * //
analyzed: rang gis shes @20a * //
translated: because it is known by itself,

original: phyir de shes yin //
analyzed: phyir de shes yin //
translated: it is known by that.

original: des ni ming sogs brjod pa yin //
analyzed: des ni ming sogs brjod pa yin //
translated: That is the expression of name and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gal te rmi lam gyi sngon po la sogs pa 'jig rten pa ma yin par skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rmi lam gyi sngon po la sogs pa 'jig rten pa ma yin par skye'o zhe na /
translated: Suppose someone said that the blue, etc., of a dream arises as non-worldly.

original: de lta na ni srog chags thams cad kyis ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
analyzed: de lta na ni srog chags thams cad kyis ci'i phyir mi rtogs /
translated: In that case, why would all living beings not understand it?

original: 'on te de dag rmi lam du sngon po la sogs myong ba ni tshogs pa'i rkyen med pas dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te de dag rmi lam du sngon po la sogs myong ba ni tshogs pa'i rkyen med pas dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: But if you say that the experience of blue, etc., in a dream is without an objective referent because the conditions of the assembly are absent,

original: sngon po la sogs pa tshogs pa ni rmi lam du mthong ba'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa tshogs pa ni rmi lam du mthong ba'i rgyu yin no zhe na /
translated: and that the assembly of blue, etc., is the cause of the seeing in a dream,

original: 'di la smras pa /üîΩgal te gnyis kyi stobs kyis sngon po bden par rmi lam du mthong na ni de lta na gnyid log pa gzhan dag gis ci'i phyir mi mthong ba yin /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa / gal te gnyis kyi stobs kyis sngon po bden par rmi lam du mthong na ni de lta na gnyid log pa gzhan dag gis ci'i phyir mi mthong ba yin /
translated: we reply:üîΩIf blue is seen as true in a dream by the power of the two, then why is it not seen by other sleepers?

original: 'on te sngon mthong ba'i 'du byed kyi mthus rmi lam du snang ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon mthong ba'i 'du byed kyi mthus rmi lam du snang ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the appearance in a dream is due to the power of the formative forces previously seen,

original: de lta na ni sngon gyi 'du byed tha dad pa las gzhan du yang rmi lam na snang ba 'byung bas sngar mthong ba'i 'du byed kyis bskyed pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa de ni rmi lam gyi shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: de lta na ni sngon gyi 'du byed tha dad pa las gzhan du yang rmi lam na snang ba 'byung bas sngar mthong ba'i 'du byed kyis bskyed pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa de ni rmi lam gyi shes pa nyid de /
translated: In that case, since the appearance of blue and so on in a dream arises from the prior formative forces, which are different from the present formative forces, blue and so on are the consciousness of the dream because they are generated by the formative forces that were previously seen.

original: 'di ltar yul rung ba can na gnas par gnyid log pa las sad pa na mi shes pa'i sngon po la sogs pa rmi lam na shes pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa de shes pa nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar yul rung ba can na gnas par gnyid log pa las sad pa na mi shes pa'i sngon po la sogs pa rmi lam na shes pa'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa de shes pa nyid du rigs so //
translated: Thus, since one who is asleep in a suitable place for the object knows blue and so on in a dream that were not known when awake, it is logical that blue and so on are consciousness.

original: 'on te gzung ba nyid du rig pa'i phyir don gyi shes pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzung ba nyid du rig pa'i phyir don gyi shes pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that they are not the consciousness of an object because they are known as objects,

original: gzung ba'i tshul gyis rig pa ni ma yin te rang gi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung ba'i tshul gyis rig pa ni ma yin te rang gi ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they are not known in the manner of an object because they are apprehended as one‚Äôs own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis sngon po la sogs pa de myong ba yin gyi gzung bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis sngon po la sogs pa de myong ba yin gyi gzung bar ni ma yin no //
translated: Blue and so on are experienced by one‚Äôs own nature, but they are not apprehended.

original: des na rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'i sngon po ni shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir rmi lam la sogs pa'i sngon po ni shes pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, because it is self-awareness, the blue, etc., of dreams, etc., is consciousness itself.

original: des na ming la sogs pa yang shes pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des na ming la sogs pa yang shes pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that names, etc., are also the nature of consciousness.

original: ming la sogs pa yang gzhan gyis mi shes pas rang gis myong ba yin pa de bas na sgra'i stobs las skyes pa ni shes pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: ming la sogs pa yang gzhan gyis mi shes pas rang gis myong ba yin pa de bas na sgra'i stobs las skyes pa ni shes pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Since names, etc., are not cognized by another, they are self-experienced. Therefore, what arises from the power of sound is consciousness itself.

original: de la don yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la don yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no object in that.

original: da ni shes pa'i mdun du bya ba'i don la dgos pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni shes pa'i mdun du bya ba'i don la dgos pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that there is no need for an object that is present before consciousness, he says:

original: mig la sogs pa'i blo 'dod pa /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i blo 'dod pa /
translated: The desire for the cognition of eye, etc.,

original: de nyid don dam par cis shes //
analyzed: de nyid don dam par cis shes //
translated: How is that known to be ultimate?

original: don gyi nus pa mthong phyir na //
analyzed: don gyi nus pa mthong phyir na //
translated: Because the capacity of the object is seen,

original: don med can gzhan thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don med can gzhan thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Another without an object will be obtained.

original: gang 'di mig la sogs pa'i blo phyin ci ma log pa'i snang ba can dpes nye bar brjod pa de nyid don dang ldan bar tshad ma gang gis khong du chud pa yin te /üîΩrmi lam dang sar pa na mthong ba'i mdun na gnas pa'i yul snang ba la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gang 'di mig la sogs pa'i blo phyin ci ma log pa'i snang ba can dpes nye bar brjod pa de nyid don dang ldan bar tshad ma gang gis khong du chud pa yin te / rmi lam dang sar pa na mthong ba'i mdun na gnas pa'i yul snang ba la bye brag med pa'i phyir ro//
translated: How could one understand that the analogy of the eye consciousness and so on, which is the unmistaken appearance, is meaningful by any valid cognition?

original: @20b 'on te don gyi nus pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mthong ba ste /
analyzed: @20b 'on te don gyi nus pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag gis mthong ba ste /
translated: Because there is no difference between the appearance of the object that is in front of one in a dream and the appearance of the object that is in front of one when awake.

original: 'di ltar sad pa na mthong ba'i don snang ba gang yin pa de ni sngar gzhan gyis mthong ba dang rang gis kyang rjes su dpag pas shes pa dang / phyis kyang thob par 'gyur ba de bas na don gyi nus par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sad pa na mthong ba'i don snang ba gang yin pa de ni sngar gzhan gyis mthong ba dang rang gis kyang rjes su dpag pas shes pa dang / phyis kyang thob par 'gyur ba de bas na don gyi nus par rigs so zhe na /
translated: But the appearance of the object is due to the power of the object, because the object that is seen when one awakens is the object that was seen by others previously, that is known by oneself through inference, and that will be obtained later.

original: de ltar ni rmi lam gyi shes pa dang ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa gzhan dag don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ni rmi lam gyi shes pa dang ming dang rgyu mtshan gyi shes pa gzhan dag don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, consciousness in a dream and other consciousnesses that have a name and a reason would be meaningless.

original: de la phyi rol dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang rmi lam gyi shes pa la don med do zhes rtogs pa'i brdar btags pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la phyi rol dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang rmi lam gyi shes pa la don med do zhes rtogs pa'i brdar btags pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: because there is no external object that is concomitant with or that is excluded from the cognition.üîΩMoreover, the designation of the cognition of an object in a dream as nonexistent is not established in the world.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa la sad pa'i tshe 'jig rten la grub pa ma yin no zhes shes pa skye ba'i dran pa med pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa la sad pa'i tshe 'jig rten la grub pa ma yin no zhes shes pa skye ba'i dran pa med pa yin no zhe na /
translated: The cognition that the object of a dream does not exist is not a memory of the cognition of an object in a dream at the time of waking.

original: ji ltar rmi lam de 'jig rten pa la ma grub 'jig rten pas rtogs par gyur pa 'jig rten pa la ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam de 'jig rten pa la ma grub 'jig rten pas rtogs par gyur pa 'jig rten pa la ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: How is it that the object of a dream is not established for the world? The cognition of an object in a dream is not established for the world, but it is not the case that the cognition of an object in a dream is not established for the world.

original: log par snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par snang bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be a false appearance.

original: 'on te 'jig rten la med pa nyid 'jig rten pa'i tshul du shes so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'jig rten la med pa nyid 'jig rten pa'i tshul du shes so zhe na /
translated: If you say that the nonexistence of an object in a dream is known in the manner of the world,

original: 'o na 'jig rten pa la med pa'i rang bzhin thug ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na 'jig rten pa la med pa'i rang bzhin thug ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the nature of the nonexistence of an object in a dream would be endless.

original: de'i phyir ming la sogs pa smra ba po dang 'brel pa can du 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ming la sogs pa smra ba po dang 'brel pa can du 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that the name and so on are related to the speaker.

original: 'on te ming la sogs pa don dang 'brel pa sgras brjod pa de bas na don khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ming la sogs pa don dang 'brel pa sgras brjod pa de bas na don khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that names, etc. are related to the object, and are expressed by sound, and therefore the object is understood,

original: smras pa / 'brel med can na'ang 'jug pa med //
analyzed: smras pa / 'brel med can na'ang 'jug pa med //
translated: we reply: There is no engagement even in the case of the unrelated.

original: gal te don dang 'brel ldan na //
analyzed: gal te don dang 'brel ldan na //
translated: If there is a relation to the object,

original: 'das pa ma 'ongs brjod bya min //
analyzed: 'das pa ma 'ongs brjod bya min //
translated: the past and future are not the object of expression.

original: don dang lhan cig de 'gags phyir //
analyzed: don dang lhan cig de 'gags phyir //
translated: Because the name, etc. ceases together with the object.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gal te ming la sogs pa la 'brel pa can yin pa de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa brjod byar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ming la sogs pa la 'brel pa can yin pa de lta na yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa brjod byar mi 'gyur te /
translated: if the name, etc. is related to the object, even so, the past and future are not the object of expression,

original: ming la sogs pa don nyid dang lhan cig 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa don nyid dang lhan cig 'gags pa dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the name, etc. ceases together with the object itself, and because it is not yet arisen.

original: 'on te ming la sogs pa gang dang yang 'brel pa med pa yin pa de lta na yang don la sogs pa dang 'brel pa med pas shin tu gsal bar 'jug pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te ming la sogs pa gang dang yang 'brel pa med pa yin pa de lta na yang don la sogs pa dang 'brel pa med pas shin tu gsal bar 'jug pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: But if the name, etc. is not related to anything, even so, there is no engagement at all, because it is unrelated to the object, etc.

original: ming la sogs pa la don byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / don kyang mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming la sogs pa la don byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / don kyang mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the name, etc. does not perform the function of the object, and because the object is not known.

original: sgra yis spyi ni 'dzin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra yis spyi ni 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because a word apprehends a universal.

original: gal te thal bar mi 'dod na //
analyzed: gal te thal bar mi 'dod na //
translated: If you do not accept the absurd

original: de min spyi ni yan gar ba //
analyzed: de min spyi ni yan gar ba //
translated: consequence, then a universal is not

original: 'dzin med phyir ro 'dzin na yang //
analyzed: 'dzin med phyir ro 'dzin na yang //
translated: separate from an individual, because it is not apprehended.

original: de spyi min na gsal ba min //
analyzed: de spyi min na gsal ba min //
translated: If it is apprehended, then if it is not a universal, it is not an individual.

original: des na rtag tu dmigs 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtag tu dmigs 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would always be perceived.

original: rtag nyid phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtag nyid phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is permanent.

original: 'on te sgra'i stobs kyis spyi tsam 'dzin @21a * //
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i stobs kyis spyi tsam 'dzin @21a * //
translated: If a word has the power to apprehend a universal,

original: par 'gyur gyi sgra'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin pa de bas na spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: par 'gyur gyi sgra'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin pa de bas na spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: then the object of the word is not an individual characteristic. Therefore, because it apprehends a universal,

original: gang 'di thal bar brjod pa dbang po rnams don med pa nyid do zhes pa der mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'di thal bar brjod pa dbang po rnams don med pa nyid do zhes pa der mi 'gyur te /
translated: the absurd consequence that the senses are pointless does not follow.

original: 'di ltar gal te sgras rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa na de'i tshe skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi spyi tsam brjod bya yin pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te sgras rang gi mtshan nyid brjod pa na de'i tshe skyon 'dir 'gyur gyi spyi tsam brjod bya yin pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If a word expresses an individual characteristic, then this error would follow. But if the object of the word is a mere universal, then it does not.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: spyi yan gar ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te gsal ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi spyi sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi yan gar ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir te gsal ba dang bcas pa nyid kyi spyi sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a bare universal is not apprehended, because the word ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù appears in the cognition that arises from the word, and because it is associated with a particular.

original: 'on te spyi yan gar ba nyid sgra'i shes pa yul yin pa de bas na 'das pa la sogs pa'i spyi yan gar ba 'dzin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi yan gar ba nyid sgra'i shes pa yul yin pa de bas na 'das pa la sogs pa'i spyi yan gar ba 'dzin no zhe na /
translated: But if a bare universal is the object of a word, then a bare universal of the past, etc., is apprehended.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te spyi yan gar ba 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa med de spyi 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te spyi yan gar ba 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa med de spyi 'das pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a bare universal is apprehended, then the past, etc., are not established, because a universal is not the nature of the past, etc.

original: 'on te spyi 'das pa'i gsal ba 'brel pas 'das pa zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi 'das pa'i gsal ba 'brel pas 'das pa zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if the past is said to be related to a particular of the past,

original: de lta na ni gsal ba dang lhan cig kho nar 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na ni gsal ba dang lhan cig kho nar 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: then since it is apprehended only in association with a particular,

original: 'das pa gsal pa'i rang bzhin du med pas na ji ltar gsal ba zhig pa'i sgo nas spyi 'das pa nyid du shes /
analyzed: 'das pa gsal pa'i rang bzhin du med pas na ji ltar gsal ba zhig pa'i sgo nas spyi 'das pa nyid du shes /
translated: the past does not exist as the nature of a particular. So how is a universal of the past known in terms of the cessation of a particular?

original: yang na spyi yan gar ba 'dzin na gsal ba de dag gi spyir mi 'gyur zhing gsal ba'i gsal byar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na spyi yan gar ba 'dzin na gsal ba de dag gi spyir mi 'gyur zhing gsal ba'i gsal byar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you apprehend a universal alone, it is not the universal of those particulars, nor are those particulars the particulars that are clarified by it.

original: gsal ba la ma ltos par rang rgyud par gzung ba de dang 'brel pa can du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / rang shes pas rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas mar me la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba la ma ltos par rang rgyud par gzung ba de dang 'brel pa can du mi rigs pa'i phyir dang / rang shes pas rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pas mar me la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is illogical that it is related to that which is apprehended as an independent continuum without depending on the particulars, and because it is not the clarifier of the particulars, such as a butter lamp, since it is the cause of being understood by one‚Äôs own consciousness.

original: gal te gsal ba rtogs pa med par spyi shes na ni gsal bas gsal bya ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba rtogs pa med par spyi shes na ni gsal bas gsal bya ma yin no //
translated: If the universal is understood without understanding the particulars, the particulars are not clarified by the universal.

original: des na ste gsal bas gsal byar bya ba dang bral bas /
analyzed: des na ste gsal bas gsal byar bya ba dang bral bas /
translated: Therefore, since it is devoid of the activity of clarifying the particulars,

original: spyi rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: spyi rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: the universal would always be observed.

original: gsal bas stong pa'i sa phyogs su rigs mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal bas stong pa'i sa phyogs su rigs mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The universal would be seen in a place devoid of particulars.

original: gang gis thams cad du snang bar 'gyur pa'i spyi rtag tu mthong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis thams cad du snang bar 'gyur pa'i spyi rtag tu mthong ba yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúBy what is the universal always seen as appearing everywhere?‚Äù

original: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúBecause it is permanent.‚Äù

original: rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would always be perceived‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: gsal ba las //
analyzed: gsal ba las //
translated: From the Vada nyaya:

original: mngon sum nyid du gsal na ni ;
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du gsal na ni ;
translated: If it were clear in perception,

original: / rang la shes pa skyed pa'i mthu //
analyzed: / rang la shes pa skyed pa'i mthu //
translated: then it would have the power to produce a cognition of itself.

original: yod na gang de nus ldan nyid //
analyzed: yod na gang de nus ldan nyid //
translated: If it exists, then it would be powerful.

original: 'on te res 'ga' nus med na //
analyzed: 'on te res 'ga' nus med na //
translated: But if sometimes it is not powerful,

original: de ni kun du nus med yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni kun du nus med yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: then it is completely powerless.

original: 'on te gsal ba yod pa las spyi'i gsal ba 'byung ste mthong ba la ltos nas so //
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba yod pa las spyi'i gsal ba 'byung ste mthong ba la ltos nas so //
translated: If the universal exists, then the manifestation of the universal would occur from the manifestation, because it depends on the perception.

original: des na thams cad du de dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na thams cad du de dmigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not always perceived.

original: @21b spyi gang yin pa rang gi yul can skyed nus na ni de nus pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: @21b spyi gang yin pa rang gi yul can skyed nus na ni de nus pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If the universal, which is the object of the cognition, is able to produce it, then it is not powerless.

original: des na rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rtag tu dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would always be perceived.

original: 'on te res 'ga' spyi la nus pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te res 'ga' spyi la nus pa med do zhe na /
translated: But if sometimes the universal is not powerful,

original: 'o na ni thams cad du nus pa med pa'i phyir de mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni thams cad du nus pa med pa'i phyir de mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be perceived because it is completely powerless.

original: 'on te gsal ba dang bcas pa'i spyis rang gi shes pa skyed par nus kyi /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba dang bcas pa'i spyis rang gi shes pa skyed par nus kyi /
translated: But if the universal, which is associated with the manifestation, is able to produce its own cognition,

original: gsal ba la sogs pa'i grogs med na shes pa mi skyed de /
analyzed: gsal ba la sogs pa'i grogs med na shes pa mi skyed de /
translated: If there is no companion, such as clarity, consciousness does not arise.

original: nus pa yang gcig pus 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin gyi tshogs nas skyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nus pa yang gcig pus 'bras bu skyed pa ma yin gyi tshogs nas skyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Also, a potential alone does not generate an effect, but it is generated from a collection.

original: smras pa / de nus pa'am mi nus par //
analyzed: smras pa / de nus pa'am mi nus par //
translated: In response to that, Aryadeva says:

original: ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa gang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis gnas pa gang //
translated: What is the nature of that potentialüîΩwhether it is able to generate or not?

original: rtogs pa nyid phyir gso min na //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid phyir gso min na //
translated: If it is not restored because it is realized,

original: de zad bya phyir nus pa gang //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de zad bya phyir nus pa gang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: what is the potential for eliminating it?üîΩWhat is the nature of that universal, whether it is able to generate a consciousness or not?üîΩIf it is able to generate a consciousness, then what is the use of a potential?

original: spyi de ni shes pa gang zhig skyed pa'i nus pa'am nus pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid nus pa'am nus pa med pa de ni /
analyzed: spyi de ni shes pa gang zhig skyed pa'i nus pa'am nus pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid nus pa'am nus pa med pa de ni /
translated: If it is not able to generate a consciousness, then what is the use of a potential?üîΩSince a permanent, unchanging universal is not destroyed by any of the companions, such as clarity, what can destroy it?üîΩWhat can generate it?üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, what is the potential for eliminating it?üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then what is the potential for eliminating it?üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then what is the potential for eliminating it?üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i spyi rtag pa'i phyir gsal ba la sogs pa phan 'dogs par byed pa gang zhig gis 'jig par nus shing skyed par nus /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i spyi rtag pa'i phyir gsal ba la sogs pa phan 'dogs par byed pa gang zhig gis 'jig par nus shing skyed par nus /
translated: If it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.

original: 'on te gsal par byed pa gsal ba med par dbang pos mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'on te gsal par byed pa gsal ba med par dbang pos mi 'dzin te /
translated: If it is not restored because it is realized, then it is not restored because it is realized.üîΩIf it is

original: dbang pos gzung ba'i spyi gsal bas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa rna bas shes pa ma yin pas gsal ba la mi ltos kyi mig gis shes pa ni sgron ma la ltos pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang pos gzung ba'i spyi gsal bas gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa rna bas shes pa ma yin pas gsal ba la mi ltos kyi mig gis shes pa ni sgron ma la ltos pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Since the universal is apprehended by the sense faculties, it is manifest. Therefore, it does not depend on manifestation, just as a pot, etc., is not apprehended by the ear, but is apprehended by the eye, which does not depend on a lamp.

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here we say:

original: spyi'i shes pa de la yang ;
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa de la yang ;
translated: Even in that cognition of the universal,

original: / sngon po la sogs rnam pa'i cha //
analyzed: / sngon po la sogs rnam pa'i cha //
translated: the aspect of blue, etc.,

original: gang yin rjes su 'dzin par snang //
analyzed: gang yin rjes su 'dzin par snang //
translated: is seen to conform to the object.

original: de ni gang gis de ru sbrul //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩgal te bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du sgra las spyi 'ba' zhig shes na de'i tshe bum pa'i sgra las bum pa nyid shes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni gang gis de ru sbrul // zhes bya ba la / gal te bum pa la sogs pa bzhin du sgra las spyi 'ba' zhig shes na de'i tshe bum pa'i sgra las bum pa nyid shes pa'i phyir /
translated: How can that be a snake?

original: ji ltar bum pa dper rung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa dper rung ste /
translated: If only the universal is cognized from the word, just as a pot, etc., is cognized, then how can a pot be a suitable example?

original: rigs phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs phyogs su byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is included in the category.

original: phyogs nyid dper mi 'gyur te dpe'i skyon gyis dngos po thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs nyid dper mi 'gyur te dpe'i skyon gyis dngos po thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The category itself cannot be an example, because the fault of the example would entail the consequence of a thing.

original: de bas na gal te sgra las ngo bo nyid kyis spyi shes na da la dbang po'i shes pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de bas na gal te sgra las ngo bo nyid kyis spyi shes na da la dbang po'i shes pas ci zhig bya /
translated: Therefore, if a universal is known by virtue of its own nature from a sound, then what would the sense consciousness do?

original: 'on te dbang po'i shes pa med par ji ltar sgra las spyi shes par 'gyur te 'brel pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po'i shes pa med par ji ltar sgra las spyi shes par 'gyur te 'brel pa 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But if a universal is not known from a sound without a sense consciousness, how could a universal be known from a sound? Because there is no apprehension of a relation.

original: sgra las snang ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni rigs yin na /
analyzed: sgra las snang ba'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni rigs yin na /
translated: If you say that the aspect that appears from a sound is a type,

original: ci ste rigs kyi rang bzhin dbang po gnyis kyi gzung byar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste rigs kyi rang bzhin dbang po gnyis kyi gzung byar 'gyur te /
translated: why would a type be the object of apprehension of two sense faculties?

original: de la gal te sgra'i shes pa'i gzung ba rigs kyi ngo bo nyid yin na de nyid gsal bas gsal bar gyur pa'i dbang pos 'dzin par 'gyur te /üîΩde nyid kyi @22a * //
analyzed: de la gal te sgra'i shes pa'i gzung ba rigs kyi ngo bo nyid yin na de nyid gsal bas gsal bar gyur pa'i dbang pos 'dzin par 'gyur te / de nyid kyi @22a * //
translated: If the object of apprehension of an auditory consciousness is the nature of a type, then it would be apprehended by a sense faculty that is clear because of being clear.

original: rang bzhin gyis rtag tu rigs 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rtag tu rigs 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, it would always apprehend a type by its nature.üîΩBut if that which is known by direct perception is the nature of a type,

original: 'on te gang mngon sum gyis shes pa de nyid rigs kyi ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang mngon sum gyis shes pa de nyid rigs kyi ngo bo nyid do zhe na /
translated: then

original: de lta na ni rigs kyi ngo bo nyid mngon sum gyis gzung bar tha snyad 'dogs na ji ltar mi gsal bar shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rigs kyi ngo bo nyid mngon sum gyis gzung bar tha snyad 'dogs na ji ltar mi gsal bar shes pa yin te /
translated: If that is so, and if you designate the essence of the type as apprehended by direct perception, then how is it that consciousness is not clear?

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgra las skyes pa'i shes pas snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi sgra las skyes pa'i shes pas snang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it appears due to consciousness generated from the term that has the essence of clarity.

original: gzhan yang spyi'i shes pa de yang sngon po'i dbyibs kyi rnam pa'i cha mi gsal bar rjes su 'dzin pa ste mngon du byed par shes par byed pa de'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i spyi'i shes pa de ru gang gis skyed par byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi'i shes pa de yang sngon po'i dbyibs kyi rnam pa'i cha mi gsal bar rjes su 'dzin pa ste mngon du byed par shes par byed pa de'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i spyi'i shes pa de ru gang gis skyed par byed /
translated: Moreover, that consciousness of the universal is understood to apprehend the aspect of the shape of blue without clarity. That consciousness of the universal that possesses the aspect of that is generated by what?

original: spyis ni ma yin te sngon po'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyis ni ma yin te sngon po'i rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not by the universal, because it is devoid of the aspect of blue.

original: gsal ba'i rnam pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba'i rnam pa'o zhe na /
translated: It is the aspect of the clear.

original: gsal ba ma bzung bar de'i rnam pa'o zhes ji ltar shes /
analyzed: gsal ba ma bzung bar de'i rnam pa'o zhes ji ltar shes /
translated: If the clear is not apprehended, how is it known that it is the aspect of that?

original: gsal ba bskyed pas so zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba bskyed pas so zhe na /
translated: It is generated by the clear.

original: ma yin te rigs med par thal bar 'gyur te gsal ba med par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te rigs med par thal bar 'gyur te gsal ba med par mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is not so, because it follows that there is no type, because without the clear, it is not apprehended.

original: rjes su son pa'i rnam pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan las yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su son pa'i rnam pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gzhan las yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of the object that is reached later is not the aspect of something else, such as blue.

original: de ni gsal bas byas pa'i phyir rigs med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gsal bas byas pa'i phyir rigs med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were, then it would not be a universal, because it would be produced by a particular.üîΩIf you say that the sense faculties are not useless

original: mngon sum shes pa'i don can phyir //üîΩdbang po don med min zhe na //üîΩde nyid tshul gcig sgra sogs las //
analyzed: mngon sum shes pa'i don can phyir // dbang po don med min zhe na // de nyid tshul gcig sgra sogs las //
translated: because they are the objects of direct perception,üîΩthen how can the cognition that perceives sound, etc.

original: tha dad snang can blo gang las //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha dad snang can blo gang las // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: as having a single mode be different from the cognition that perceives color?

original: gal te spyi dang ldan pa'i gsal ba nyid sgra'i yul yin ba'am yan gar ba yin na de bas na sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i cha dang bral ba'i thal ba'i skyon 'di med do //
analyzed: gal te spyi dang ldan pa'i gsal ba nyid sgra'i yul yin ba'am yan gar ba yin na de bas na sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i cha dang bral ba'i thal ba'i skyon 'di med do //
translated: If the individual that possesses a universal were the object of the word, or if it were independent, then the absurd consequence that the cognition that arises from the word would be devoid of the aspect of blue, etc. would not follow.

original: 'o na gal te gsal ba nyid sgra'i brjod bya yin na de ltar na yang dbang po'i tshogs don med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te gsal ba nyid sgra'i brjod bya yin na de ltar na yang dbang po'i tshogs don med par 'gyur na /
translated: If the individual is the object of the word, then the collection of sense faculties would be useless.

original: dbang po rnams don med pa ma yin te mngon sum gyi shes pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnams don med pa ma yin te mngon sum gyi shes pa'i 'bras bu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculties are not useless because they are the cause of direct perception.

original: sgra'i shes pas mi gsal bar byas pa 'dzin la /
analyzed: sgra'i shes pas mi gsal bar byas pa 'dzin la /
translated: The auditory consciousness apprehends it as indistinct.

original: mig la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa de nyid mngon du 'dzin to zhe na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gzugs la sogs pa de nyid mngon du 'dzin to zhe na /
translated: The eye, etc. apprehend that very form, etc. as manifest.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: de nyid tha dad par snang ba can gyi blo tshul gcig pa can sgra la sogs pa las ci ltar shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid tha dad par snang ba can gyi blo tshul gcig pa can sgra la sogs pa las ci ltar shes par 'gyur te /
translated: How can it be known that the very same cognition, which has the appearance of difference, is the same in respect to sound, etc.?

original: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa tshul gcig pa can de nyid kyi rang bzhin shes pa nyid ni mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gzugs la sogs pa tshul gcig pa can de nyid kyi rang bzhin shes pa nyid ni mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the very nature of the external form, etc. which is the same in respect to that, is known by direct perception.

original: gal te sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la ngo bo nyid shes pa yod na dbang po rnams don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgra las byung ba'i shes pa la ngo bo nyid shes pa yod na dbang po rnams don med pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cognition that arises from sound has the knowledge of its own nature, then the sense faculties would be utterly useless.

original: 'on te mdun na yod pa @22b mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin pas ngo bo nyid shes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mdun na yod pa @22b mngon sum gyis mi 'dzin pas ngo bo nyid shes pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the knowledge of its own nature is not direct perception because it does not apprehend what is present,

original: de lta na ni sgra ni mdun na yod pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sgra ni mdun na yod pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then sound would not be direct perception because it does not apprehend what is present.

original: 'on te sgra ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgra ni bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir mngon sum nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that sound is direct perception because it is apprehended in its entirety,

original: 'o na ni sgra las kyang phyi rol nyid shes par 'gyur te de nyid du brda shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni sgra las kyang phyi rol nyid shes par 'gyur te de nyid du brda shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then sound would be external to consciousness, because it is known to be a conventional symbol.

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa bde blag tu shes par byed pa'i don gyis yin na ni bde blag tu shes pa yang sgra nyid las 'dod pas 'di lta bu bde blag gi don mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa bde blag tu shes par byed pa'i don gyis yin na ni bde blag tu shes pa yang sgra nyid las 'dod pas 'di lta bu bde blag gi don mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: But if you say that the meaning of ‚Äúeasily‚Äù is that it is easily known, then sound is also easily known, so this is a similar case of ‚Äúeasily.‚Äù

original: 'on te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag nyid la sgra sbyor zhing chod pa'i da ltar byung ba la yang sbyor gyis mthong bar gyur ba'i mchod pa nyid la ni sgra sbyor ba ma yin te der de don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag nyid la sgra sbyor zhing chod pa'i da ltar byung ba la yang sbyor gyis mthong bar gyur ba'i mchod pa nyid la ni sgra sbyor ba ma yin te der de don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But if you say that the term is applied to the past and future, and also to the present that is obstructed, but not to the present that is seen, because it is meaningless there,

original: 'das pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang chod pa ma mthong bar gyur pa ni bde blag tu byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dang chod pa ma mthong bar gyur pa ni bde blag tu byed pa ma yin te /
translated: then past form, etc., and the present that is obstructed are not easily known.

original: de bas na dbang po rnams 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na dbang po rnams 'bras bu dang bcas pa'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the sense faculties are said to be together with their effects.

original: 'o na ngo bo nyid shes pa ji ltar 'das phal sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ngo bo nyid shes pa ji ltar 'das phal sogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: But how can the cognition of the intrinsic nature be said to be associated with past, etc., form?

original: dmigs par gyur pa las gzhan pa'i 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par gyur pa las gzhan pa'i 'das pa la sogs pa'i gzugs shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cognition of form that is past, etc., apart from that which is present.

original: mngon sum gyis shes pa'i mchod pa ni ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir bde brag tu byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis shes pa'i mchod pa ni ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa nyid kyi phyir bde brag tu byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The cognition of the intrinsic nature is not a distinct cognition because it apprehends the intrinsic nature of the object.

original: 'di ltar chod pa'i glu sgra mngon du byas pas bde blag tu shes shing dga' ba skye ba yin no //üîΩ'on te chu'i rlabs kyi tshul du 'ongs pa nyid kyi mchod par sgra shes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar chod pa'i glu sgra mngon du byas pas bde blag tu shes shing dga' ba skye ba yin no // 'on te chu'i rlabs kyi tshul du 'ongs pa nyid kyi mchod par sgra shes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: For example, when one hears a distant sound, one first cognizes the sound itself, and then one cognizes the sound as pleasant, unpleasant, etc.üîΩBut if the cognition of sound is the cognition of the intrinsic nature, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.

original: yul thag ring po can shes pa'i phyir ji ltar sgra 'od bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul thag ring po can shes pa'i phyir ji ltar sgra 'od bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition of the sound.üîΩBut if the cognition of the intrinsic nature is the cognition of the sound, then the cognition of the intrinsic nature would be the cognition

original: gal te yul ring po can gyi sgra shes par gyur pa lus kyi dbang po dang phrad na ni gzugs la sogs pa yang phrad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yul ring po can gyi sgra shes par gyur pa lus kyi dbang po dang phrad na ni gzugs la sogs pa yang phrad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the cognition of a sound that has a distant object were to contact the body faculty, then form and so on would also come into contact with it.

original: de'i phyir sgra las sam rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol pa shes na ngo bo nyid kyang shes par 'gyur pa'i phyir dbang po rnams don med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra las sam rjes su dpag pa las phyi rol pa shes na ngo bo nyid kyang shes par 'gyur pa'i phyir dbang po rnams don med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Therefore, if one knows the external object through sound or inference, then one would also know the nature of the object. Therefore, are not the sense faculties meaningless?

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Thus:

original: spyi ni dngos po ma yin la //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: spyi ni dngos po ma yin la // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The universal is not a thing.

original: 'dis kyang spyi dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang spyi dngos po ma yin te /
translated: This says that the universal is not a thing.

original: gang gi phyir /üîΩgsal ba'i ngo bo gzhan rten can //
analyzed: gang gi phyir / gsal ba'i ngo bo gzhan rten can //
translated: Why?

original: ma grub phyir ro tha dad na //
analyzed: ma grub phyir ro tha dad na //
translated: Because the nature of the manifestation that is dependent on another is not established.üîΩIf they are different,

original: ltos pa zhes bya 'bras bur brjod //
analyzed: ltos pa zhes bya 'bras bur brjod //
translated: the so-called dependence is said to be the effect.

original: rang gi rgyu las grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu las grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is established from its own cause,

original: 'bras bu rag las med pa yang //
analyzed: 'bras bu rag las med pa yang //
translated: the effect is not dependent.

original: rtog pas 'brel par byed pa ste //
analyzed: rtog pas 'brel par byed pa ste //
translated: Imagination creates the connection.

original: nam yang 'bras min ji ltar 'brel //
analyzed: nam yang 'bras min ji ltar 'brel //
translated: How could it ever be connected to what is not an effect?

original: gzhan nyid @23a * //
analyzed: gzhan nyid @23a * //
translated: If it is different,

original: yin na de 'brel med /
analyzed: yin na de 'brel med /
translated: it is not connected.

original: de phyir rang bzhin med par grub //
analyzed: de phyir rang bzhin med par grub //
translated: Therefore it is established as essenceless.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: rigs gsal ba las tha dad dam tha mi dad par brtag grang na /
analyzed: rigs gsal ba las tha dad dam tha mi dad par brtag grang na /
translated: one should investigate whether the universal is different or non-different from the manifestation.

original: de la re zhig rigs dang ldan pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig rigs dang ldan pa gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not logical that the universal is of the nature of the manifestation,

original: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan la ma brten pa can rang rgyud par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid gzhan la ma brten pa can rang rgyud par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the manifestation, which is of the nature of something else, is established as independent.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba rnams phan tshun rag las pa med pa dang tha dad par 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba rnams phan tshun rag las pa med pa dang tha dad par 'dzin to //
translated: Thus, the manifestations are apprehended as mutually independent and different.

original: 'on te gsal ba las so so tha dad par spyi khas len no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba las so so tha dad par spyi khas len no zhe na /
translated: But if one accepts that the universal is different from the manifestation,

original: 'o na ni gsal bas spyi bskyed par bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gsal bas spyi bskyed par bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the universal would be generated by the manifestation,

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because otherwise there would be no connection.

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu nyid ni ltos pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu nyid ni ltos pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the result itself is what is expressed by the word ‚Äúdependence.‚Äù

original: gal te yang rigs gsal ba la ltos na ni de'i 'bras bu nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te yang rigs gsal ba la ltos na ni de'i 'bras bu nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if the universal depends on the manifestation, then it would certainly be the result of that.

original: 'on te rigs 'bras bur gyur pa ma yin gyi gsal ba spyi'i rten nyid du snang ba'i phyir de dang 'brel pa can te /
analyzed: 'on te rigs 'bras bur gyur pa ma yin gyi gsal ba spyi'i rten nyid du snang ba'i phyir de dang 'brel pa can te /
translated: Or, the reason is not the effect, but it appears as the basis of the manifestation in general, and thus it is related to that.

original: dper na rgya shug la sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na rgya shug la sogs pa bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like the relationship between the myrobalan fruit and so on and the pot and so on.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: 'bras bu ni ji srid du myu gu la sogs pa rtogs pas rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni ji srid du myu gu la sogs pa rtogs pas rang gi rgyu dang 'brel par byed pa ste /
translated: The effect is related to its cause as long as it is understood as the sprout and so on.

original: 'bras bu grub na rag las pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu grub na rag las pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the effect is established, it is not dependent.

original: ji ltar ji srid 'bras bu ma grub pa de srid rtog pa tsam nyid de /
analyzed: ji ltar ji srid 'bras bu ma grub pa de srid rtog pa tsam nyid de /
translated: As long as the effect is not established, it is mere imagination.

original: skye ba'i tshe yang rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung bas rag las pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba'i tshe yang rgyu dang lhan cig 'byung bas rag las pa med pa yin no //
translated: Even when it arises, it is not dependent because it occurs simultaneously with the cause.

original: rang gi rgyu zhig pa de'i tshe yang rtogs pa nyid kyis 'brel par byed do //üîΩgang yang gang cung zad 'bras bur ma gyur pa de ji ltar 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu zhig pa de'i tshe yang rtogs pa nyid kyis 'brel par byed do // gang yang gang cung zad 'bras bur ma gyur pa de ji ltar 'brel pa yin te /
translated: When its cause ceases, it is related by the mere understanding of it.

original: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, how could that which is not an effect in the least be related, because that is absurd.

original: de ste de bas na gzhan nyid yin pa'am spyi de yin na yang 'brel ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de ste de bas na gzhan nyid yin pa'am spyi de yin na yang 'brel ba med pa ste /
translated: If it is different from them, or if it is a universal, it is unrelated.

original: de'i phyir spyi rang bzhin med par grub pa ste spyi rang rgyud pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi rang bzhin med par grub pa ste spyi rang rgyud pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the universal is established as essenceless, because a universal that is an autonomous entity does not make sense.

original: 'o na gal te spyi rang bzhin med pa ma yin na 'o na ni med pa yang spyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te spyi rang bzhin med pa ma yin na 'o na ni med pa yang spyir 'gyur te /
translated: But if the universal is not essenceless, then nonexistence would be a universal,

original: de la yang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it too is essenceless.

original: smras pa / med pa rigs su 'gyur min te //
analyzed: smras pa / med pa rigs su 'gyur min te //
translated: We say: Nonexistence cannot be a universal,

original: de dag ltos pa med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ltos pa med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: because they are not related.

original: ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba med pa yang spyi nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba med pa yang spyi nyid ma yin te /
translated: The nonexistence called ‚Äúthe horn of a rabbit‚Äù is not a universal,

original: rang gi gsal ba la ltos nas so //
analyzed: rang gi gsal ba la ltos nas so //
translated: because it is related to its own manifestation.

original: 'o na yod pa'i spyi ru ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na yod pa'i spyi ru ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But why wouldn‚Äôt it be a universal of existence?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩyod pa dang med pa spyi ru 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / yod pa dang med pa spyi ru 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Here we say:üîΩExistence and nonexistence are not universals,

original: yod pa dang med pa dag ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence and nonexistence are not related.

original: spyi'i rnam pa can ni gas la @23b pa la ltos pa'i phyir spyi yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa can ni gas la @23b pa la ltos pa'i phyir spyi yin no //
translated: The universal is so called because it is dependent on the particular.

original: de'i phyir ngo bo med pa ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo med pa ni //
translated: Therefore, the non-entity

original: ngo bo nyid la brten nas rtags //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la brten nas rtags //
translated: is indicated in dependence on the entity.üîΩThe particular is the basis of the universal.

original: khyad par de la 'jug don can //üîΩrigs de sgra yis gsal bar bstan //
analyzed: khyad par de la 'jug don can // rigs de sgra yis gsal bar bstan //
translated: The universal is the object of entry into the particular.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The universal is indicated by the word.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir rigs dngos po med cing rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med pa'i phyir rigs dngos po med cing rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: This is because the universal is inexpressible as either identical with or different from the particular.

original: gal te rigs dngos po med pa yin na rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rigs dngos po med pa yin na rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the universal is a non-entity, the word is applied to the particular,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: because the particular is the object of expression.

original: de ni ma yin te /üîΩrigs dngos po med par gyur pa de nyid sgras bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te / rigs dngos po med par gyur pa de nyid sgras bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is not so,üîΩbecause the universal is indicated by the word as a non-entity.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid sgra'i brjod bya ma ma yin bar bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid sgra'i brjod bya ma ma yin bar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the particular is explained as not being the object of expression of the word.

original: 'on te rang bzhin med pa'i rigs sgras brjod na ni sgra'i sbyor ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin med pa'i rigs sgras brjod na ni sgra'i sbyor ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if the word is used to express the absence of intrinsic reality, then the use of the word is meaningless.

original: don byed pa'i dngos po rtogs par bya ba'i don du sgra 'god kyi gyi na ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa'i dngos po rtogs par bya ba'i don du sgra 'god kyi gyi na ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Words are used to understand things that function, not to understand non-things.

original: spyi ni don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra sbyor bar mi byed do zhe na /
analyzed: spyi ni don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra sbyor bar mi byed do zhe na /
translated: But the universal is not meaningless, so the word is used to express it.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: khyad par de la 'jug pa'i don can te thob par bya ba'i don du sgras rigs bstan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par de la 'jug pa'i don can te thob par bya ba'i don du sgras rigs bstan pa ma yin no //
translated: The word does not teach the universal in order to understand the particular, which is the object to be attained.

original: 'on te rigs pa bzhin med par shes pas ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'on te rigs pa bzhin med par shes pas ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid thob par 'gyur te //
translated: But if the cognition is not like the universal, how can it attain the particular?

original: chu med pa'i smig rgyu rtogs pas bden pa'i chu thob pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chu med pa'i smig rgyu rtogs pas bden pa'i chu thob pa med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the cognition of a mirage without water does not attain real water.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ngo bo rnams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la brten nas rigs der kun du rtogs pa'i phyir thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo rnams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la brten nas rigs der kun du rtogs pa'i phyir thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The universal is attained because it is completely understood in dependence on the transmission of the entities.

original: smig rgyu la chur shes pas ni phyi rol ba dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir chu dang phrad pa med do //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur shes pas ni phyi rol ba dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir chu dang phrad pa med do //
translated: But since the cognition of a mirage as water is not related to an external object, it does not encounter water.

original: ngo bo nyid rnams kyi stobs kyis rigs rtogs pa skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid rnams kyi stobs kyis rigs rtogs pa skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: Are the aspects of the intrinsic natures not produced by the power of the intrinsic natures?

original: rigs ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa can yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rigs ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa can yin mod kyi /
translated: The intrinsic natures do have the aspect of intrinsic natures.

original: gcig pa nyid du ji ltar zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du ji ltar zhen pa yin te /
translated: But how can they be conceived as identical?

original: phyi rol dang gcig pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir gang gis gcig tu mngon par zhen pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol dang gcig pa nyid du ma mthong ba'i phyir gang gis gcig tu mngon par zhen pa yin zhe na /
translated: Since they are not seen as identical to external objects, how can they be conceived as identical?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa // de yi ngo bo snang ba gang //
analyzed: smras pa // de yi ngo bo snang ba gang //
translated: The appearance of their intrinsic natures

original: don gyi de nyid du 'dzin pa //
analyzed: don gyi de nyid du 'dzin pa //
translated: Is the apprehension of the reality of objects.

original: de 'khrul thog med dus nas ni //
analyzed: de 'khrul thog med dus nas ni //
translated: That error, beginningless and endless,

original: brdzun pa mthong goms sprul pa nyid //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: brdzun pa mthong goms sprul pa nyid // ces bya ba la /
translated: Is the seeing of the false, the familiar, the emanated.

original: sgro 'dogs pa ni phyi rol mthong ba kho na las ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa ni phyi rol mthong ba kho na las ma yin gyi /
translated: The superimposition of identity is not only due to the perception of external objects.

original: 'khrul pa brgyud pa las kyang yod pa nyid de gtso bo la sogs pa'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa brgyud pa las kyang yod pa nyid de gtso bo la sogs pa'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It also exists due to the transmission of error, like the cognition of pradhƒÅna and so on.

original: des na rigs de'i ngo bor snang ba gang yin pa mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid de ni gsal ba mthong ba las ji ltar 'gyur te 'khrul pa nyid do //üîΩdon gyi de nyid du 'dzin @24a * //
analyzed: des na rigs de'i ngo bor snang ba gang yin pa mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid de ni gsal ba mthong ba las ji ltar 'gyur te 'khrul pa nyid do // don gyi de nyid du 'dzin @24a * //
translated: Therefore, how could the nature of that type which appears as an entity be the nature of the unclear, since it is seen as clear? It is just a mistake.

original: pa gang yin pa de yang 'khrul ba ste /
analyzed: pa gang yin pa de yang 'khrul ba ste /
translated: The apprehension of the reality of the object is also a mistake.

original: sa bon med par ji ltar 'khrul zhe na /
analyzed: sa bon med par ji ltar 'khrul zhe na /
translated: How can there be a mistake without a seed?

original: smras pa / de thog ma med pa'i dus can brdzun pa mthong ba de la goms pa des sprul pa nyid do //
analyzed: smras pa / de thog ma med pa'i dus can brdzun pa mthong ba de la goms pa des sprul pa nyid do //
translated: We say: That is a false vision that has been cultivated since beginningless time. It is just an emanation.

original: nges ni 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: nges ni 'di skad ston te /
translated: But this is what is being taught:

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas yod pa'i spyi mthong ba de nyid las spyir 'khrul ba yin gyi phyi rol dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas yod pa'i spyi mthong ba de nyid las spyir 'khrul ba yin gyi phyi rol dang 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The vision of the universal that has existed since beginningless time is just a mistake about the universal, and it is not related to external objects.

original: 'on te spyi ni ldog pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te spyi ni ldog pa ste /
translated: But if the universal is an exclusion,

original: de yang log pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid can yin na des na ji ltar spyi dngos por mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang log pa'i don gyi ngo bo nyid can yin na des na ji ltar spyi dngos por mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and that is the nature of a false object, then how could the universal not be a real thing?

original: smras pa / don rnams kyi ni spyi gang yin //
analyzed: smras pa / don rnams kyi ni spyi gang yin //
translated: We say: The universal of objects

original: gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can //
translated: Has the characteristic of being excluded from others.

original: sgra 'di dag gi mthar thug gang ;
analyzed: sgra 'di dag gi mthar thug gang ;
translated: What is the ultimate of these words?

original: / de yi ngo bo ci yang min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / de yi ngo bo ci yang min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Its nature is nothing at all.

original: phyi rol gyi don rnams kyi spyi gang yin pa rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid can no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don rnams kyi spyi gang yin pa rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid can no //
translated: The universal of external things is the nature of the exclusion of what is dissimilar.

original: spyi gang yin pa mthar thug pa ste dbyibs phyin pa can gang yin pa'i sgra de rnams ni spyi de'i ngo bo gsal ba las tha dad ci yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dngos po med par brjod do //
analyzed: spyi gang yin pa mthar thug pa ste dbyibs phyin pa can gang yin pa'i sgra de rnams ni spyi de'i ngo bo gsal ba las tha dad ci yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir de dngos po med par brjod do //
