translated: The words that are the ultimate, the culmination of the universal, the perfection of shape, have no nature that is different from the manifestation of that universal. Therefore, it is said to be a non-thing.

original: don dam par ni de rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni de rang gi mtshan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kho na ste /
translated: In the ultimate, it is the nature of its own characteristic.

original: dper na blo'i rnam pa phyi rol la ltos nas dngos po med par brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na blo'i rnam pa phyi rol la ltos nas dngos po med par brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the aspect of the mind being said to be a non-thing in dependence on the external.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po nyid do //
translated: It is a thing by the nature of consciousness.

original: yang na sgra'i go bar bya ba stong ba gzhan sel ba la ltos nas gzhung dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sgra'i go bar bya ba stong ba gzhan sel ba la ltos nas gzhung dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or else, the meaning of the words should be applied to the treatise in dependence on the exclusion of other, which is the empty object of understanding.

original: 'on te re zhig spyi'i shes pa yod la de la don gyi rnam pa snang ba gang yin pa'i spyi de yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'on te re zhig spyi'i shes pa yod la de la don gyi rnam pa snang ba gang yin pa'i spyi de yod pa nyid de /
translated: But if a universal consciousness exists, then the universal that is the appearance of the aspect of an object exists.

original: 'di ltar gal te shes pa'i rnam pa la don gyi ngo bo nyid med de 'di gzhan du snang ba'i phyir yin na ni shes pa las tha dad pa'i spyi med do zhes bya bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te shes pa'i rnam pa la don gyi ngo bo nyid med de 'di gzhan du snang ba'i phyir yin na ni shes pa las tha dad pa'i spyi med do zhes bya bar mi rung ste /
translated: If the aspect of consciousness does not have the nature of an object because it appears as something else, then it is not tenable to say that there is no universal that is different from consciousness.

original: de rnam pa med pa'i phyir dang rigs rnam pa dang bcas pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de rnam pa med pa'i phyir dang rigs rnam pa dang bcas pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it would be without aspect and because a universal would have aspects.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: ngo bo med can spyi blo la //üîΩspyi nyid du yang mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ngo bo med can spyi blo la // spyi nyid du yang mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: The universal that appears to the mindüîΩis seen as a universal.

original: don 'khrul pa la spyi yin par //
analyzed: don 'khrul pa la spyi yin par //
translated: If you assert that it is a universal due to the error of an object,

original: 'dod par 'gyur na de yang ni //üîΩngo bo can min bslad phyir dang // don dngos de nyid med phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod par 'gyur na de yang ni // ngo bo can min bslad phyir dang // don dngos de nyid med phyir ro //
translated: that is also not tenable.üîΩBecause it is not an entity, because it is polluted,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and because the actual object does not exist.

original: spyi'i blo la snang bar gyur pa ni gal te blo la rnam pa med par grub na spyi yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: spyi'i blo la snang bar gyur pa ni gal te blo la rnam pa med par grub na spyi yin par 'dod de /
translated: If the appearance that occurs in the mind of a universal is established as being without aspect, it is asserted to be a universal.

original: de'i tshe blo las de tha dad par nges par brjod par bya ba'i phyir spyi yin par 'gyur te de'i ngo bo nyid thun mong ba'i ngo bor mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe blo las de tha dad par nges par brjod par bya ba'i phyir spyi yin par 'gyur te de'i ngo bo nyid thun mong ba'i ngo bor mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, in order to express that the mind is definitely different from that, it would be a universal because it is seen as a common nature.

original: 'on kyang don de 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang don de 'khrul pa ste /
translated: However, that object is mistaken.

original: ji ltar blo'i ngo bo nyid spyi ru rtogs pa de @24b bzhin du 'khrul pa yin yang rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar blo'i ngo bo nyid spyi ru rtogs pa de @24b bzhin du 'khrul pa yin yang rtogs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the nature of the mind is realized as a universal, it is also mistaken, but it becomes realization.

original: de bas na spyi de ni shes pa yin te spyi'i blo la spyi'i rnam par ngo bo med pa yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na spyi de ni shes pa yin te spyi'i blo la spyi'i rnam par ngo bo med pa yang mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, that universal is consciousness because the universal mind is seen to have no nature in the form of a universal.

original: shes pa shes pa gzhan dang tha mi dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa shes pa gzhan dang tha mi dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness is not different from another consciousness.

original: des na der rigs snang ba ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na der rigs snang ba ni 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of a universal there is just a mistake.

original: 'o na rigs 'khrul pa cis shes she na /
analyzed: 'o na rigs 'khrul pa cis shes she na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúHow is the universal known to be a mistake?‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ngo bo med pa can de yang bslad pa'i phyir dang don gyi dngos po can de don gyi dngos po de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngo bo med pa can de yang bslad pa'i phyir dang don gyi dngos po can de don gyi dngos po de nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is adulterated and because it has the nature of an object, that object does not exist.

original: de bas na spyi ni phyi rol pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na spyi ni phyi rol pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal is not external.

original: 'on te spyi de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med kyang dngos por 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi de nyid dang gzhan du brjod du med kyang dngos por 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the universal is inexpressible as either identical with or different from the particulars, it is a real entity.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: ngo bo med pas brjod bya min //
analyzed: ngo bo med pas brjod bya min //
translated: it is inexpressible because it is essenceless.

original: rnam 'gas brjod phyir brjod bya ste //
analyzed: rnam 'gas brjod phyir brjod bya ste //
translated: It is an object of expression because it is expressed in some way.

original: dngos po 'dod na dngos po rnams //
analyzed: dngos po 'dod na dngos po rnams //
translated: If you assert that it is a real entity,

original: cis kyang brjod bya min pa min //
analyzed: cis kyang brjod bya min pa min //
translated: then it is not inexpressible in any way.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gang zhig de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ni ngo bo med pa ste /
analyzed: gang zhig de nyid dang gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de ni ngo bo med pa ste /
translated: that which is inexpressible as either identical with or different from something else is essenceless.

original: dngos po yin na gdon mi za bar tha dad pa'am tha dad pa med par yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes le'u dang por gtan la phab po //
analyzed: dngos po yin na gdon mi za bar tha dad pa'am tha dad pa med par yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes le'u dang por gtan la phab po //
translated: If it is a real entity, then it must exist as either different or non-different, as was determined in the first chapter.

original: de bas na spyi dngos po med pa'i phyir spyi de brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na spyi dngos po med pa'i phyir spyi de brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the universal is not a real entity, the universal is not an object of expression.

original: 'o na gal te spyi gzhan la gzhan yin brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir spyi gzhan rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha dad par brjod par bya ba yin pas spyi de dngos por 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te spyi gzhan la gzhan yin brjod par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir spyi gzhan rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis tha dad par brjod par bya ba yin pas spyi de dngos por 'dod ce na /
translated: But if you say that a universal is a thing because it is said to be different from other things, then a universal is said to be different in some way from other things, so you accept that a universal is a thing.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: dngos po rnams cis kyang ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams cis kyang ste /
translated: How can a universal be a thing?

original: rnam pa gang gis kyang brjod par mi bya bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis kyang brjod par mi bya bar mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable that things cannot be said to be anything at all.

original: gsal ba las ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba las ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not said to be the same as or different from the particulars, then it is not tenable that it is a thing.

original: 'o na gal te spyi dngos po ma yin na de'i tshe ji ltar yang brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na //
analyzed: 'o na gal te spyi dngos po ma yin na de'i tshe ji ltar yang brjod par bya bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na //
translated: But if a universal is not a thing, then how can it be said to be anything at all?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: nyer len tha dad pas tha dad //
analyzed: nyer len tha dad pas tha dad //
translated: It is different because of the difference in the appropriated.

original: nye bar btags phyir brjod bya min //
analyzed: nye bar btags phyir brjod bya min //
translated: It is not said to be anything because it is a mere designation.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: spyi ni spyi sgra gzhan las gzhan pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi ni spyi sgra gzhan las gzhan pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: a universal is not said to be different from other universal terms.

original: 'o na ji ltar rigs tha dad par shes she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rigs tha dad par shes she na /
translated: But how can it be known to be a different type?

original: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa rnams phan tshun tha dad pas des bskyed pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa la nye bar btags nas spyi tha dad par shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa nye bar len pa rnams phan tshun tha dad pas des bskyed pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa la nye bar btags nas spyi tha dad par shes pa yin gyi /
translated: Since the appropriated aggregates of form and so on are different from each other, they are imputed to be different aspects generated by them and are known to be different universals.

original: don dam pa nyid kyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa nyid kyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The aspects generated by the different appropriated aggregates such as form are designated as different universals, but they are not different in reality.

original: 'di ltar bong bu'i rva la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bong bu'i rva la sogs pa phan tshun tha dad par zhen pa ste /
translated: For example, the horns of a cow and so on are conceived as different from each other,

original: des na de dag tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de dag tha dad pa yin no //
translated: and therefore they are different.

original: 'on te de la ni de shes pa nyid tha dad pa'i rnam pa can te don tha dad pa ni ma yin no //üîΩspyi 'di la @25a * //
analyzed: 'on te de la ni de shes pa nyid tha dad pa'i rnam pa can te don tha dad pa ni ma yin no // spyi 'di la @25a * //
translated: But in the case of a universal, the cognition of it is different, but the object is not different.

original: yang blo tha dad pa'i rnam pa can yod pa ci'i phyir khas len par mi byed /üîΩgzhan yang gal te rigs sam /
analyzed: yang blo tha dad pa'i rnam pa can yod pa ci'i phyir khas len par mi byed / gzhan yang gal te rigs sam /
translated: Why do you not accept that this universal has the aspect of a different cognition?

original: gsal ba brjod byar gyur na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa brjod byar mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gsal ba brjod byar gyur na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa brjod byar mi 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if a universal or an individual is the object of expression, then the past and future would not be the object of expression.

original: de lta ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.üîΩWhy?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa'i //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ni ma 'ongs pa'i //
translated: The past and future

original: don la yang spyi'i rgyu can gyi //
analyzed: don la yang spyi'i rgyu can gyi //
translated: Have a universal as their cause.

original: sgra rnams 'jug par 'gyur pa na//üîΩyod pa med chos ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: sgra rnams 'jug par 'gyur pa na// yod pa med chos ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could a nonexistent phenomenonüîΩBe engaged with existent objects?üîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: How can the existent be the property of the non-existent?

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i don la spyi'i rgyu mtshan can bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i don la spyi'i rgyu mtshan can bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If the words ‚Äúpot‚Äù and so on are applied to the past and future objects, which are characterized by universals,

original: sgra de rnams kyis 'das pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid du ci shes par 'gyur pa de'i tshe med pa'i chos su rigs yod bar 'gyur pa ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra de rnams kyis 'das pa la sogs pa'i chos nyid du ci shes par 'gyur pa de'i tshe med pa'i chos su rigs yod bar 'gyur pa ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how can the words ‚Äúpast‚Äù and so on be understood as the reality of the past and so on? At that time, how can the existent be the property of the non-existent?

original: med pa'i chos yod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa'i chos yod par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible for the non-existent to be existent.

original: yod pa nyid kyi gsal ba gzhan gyi chos yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyi gsal ba gzhan gyi chos yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the existent is the property of another, the manifestation of the existent,

original: 'o na yod pa'i chos nyid du shes pa ji ltar 'das pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na yod pa'i chos nyid du shes pa ji ltar 'das pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then how can the existent be understood as the reality of the past?

original: 'das pa'i gsal ba'i chos nyid du shes par gyur pa'i spyi 'das par rigs kyi da ltar las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i gsal ba'i chos nyid du shes par gyur pa'i spyi 'das par rigs kyi da ltar las ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is reasonable that the universal, which is understood as the reality of the past manifestation, is past, not present.

original: de bas na 'das pa dang 'brel pa can gyi rigs 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gdon mi bla bar rigs med pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'das pa dang 'brel pa can gyi rigs 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir gdon mi bla bar rigs med pa'i chos yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the type of the past is related to the past, it is certainly a non-existent dharma.

original: gang med pa'i chos de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang med pa'i chos de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is a non-existent dharma does not exist.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog gam med pa nyid bzhin no //üîΩ'on te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid shes pa ste /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog gam med pa nyid bzhin no // 'on te 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid shes pa ste /
translated: For example, it is like a sky-flower or non-existence itself.

original: chos de yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chos de yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the past and future exist because the dharma exists,

original: gal te yod na ji ltar 'das pa nyid yin /
analyzed: gal te yod na ji ltar 'das pa nyid yin /
translated: if it exists, how can it be past?

original: 'dzin pa 'das pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa 'das pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is past because the grasping is past,

original: 'dzin pa yang shes pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dzin pa yang shes pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt grasping also just consciousness?

original: 'on te mngon sum ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is hidden because it is realized as not being direct perception,

original: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyang mngon sum du sgra las shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa nyid kyang mngon sum du sgra las shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt it known from the scriptures that it is not direct perception?

original: des na ci'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: des na ci'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Then why would it be hidden?

original: de bas na 'das pa ni yod pa ma yin na de'i chos rigs kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'das pa ni yod pa ma yin na de'i chos rigs kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, if the past does not exist, its dharma type also does not exist.

original: nye bar btags las de 'dod na //üîΩsnam bu sogs las med gang yin ;üîΩ/ da ltar ba yi bum pa yi //
analyzed: nye bar btags las de 'dod na // snam bu sogs las med gang yin ; / da ltar ba yi bum pa yi //
translated: If you accept that,üîΩthen it follows that the pot is notüîΩpresent in the cloth, etc.

original: med pa dang ni nye ba gang //
analyzed: med pa dang ni nye ba gang //
translated: And the nonexistence of the present pot

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'on te med pa'i chos nyid spyi la ma grub ste nye bar btags nas med pa'i chos de 'dod kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / 'on te med pa'i chos nyid spyi la ma grub ste nye bar btags nas med pa'i chos de 'dod kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: is not present in the pot.üîΩIf you say that the nonexistence of phenomena is not established in general, but that you accept the nonexistence of phenomena that is imputed in a specific way, and that it is not ultimately,

original: nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de dngos po nyid du med pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de la spyi med pas de'i chos nyid ces pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de dngos po nyid du med pa'i phyir 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa de la spyi med pas de'i chos nyid ces pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa'o zhe na /
translated: then the reason ‚Äúbecause it is the reality of that‚Äù is not established, because the imputed does not exist as a thing, and the past and future do not have a universal.

original: 'di la smras pa /üîΩ'das pa la sogs pa de la spyi'i nye bar 'dogs sam sgra yin nam gsal ba yin zhes brtag grang na /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa / 'das pa la sogs pa de la spyi'i nye bar 'dogs sam sgra yin nam gsal ba yin zhes brtag grang na /
translated: In response to this, we ask,üîΩis the imputation of the universal to the past and so on a word or a manifestation?

original: gal te rigs nye bar 'dogs na de ni mi rigs te da ltar ba'i bum pa'i spyi gang yin pa de 'das pa la nye bar 'dogs pa 'brel ba las yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rigs nye bar 'dogs na de ni mi rigs te da ltar ba'i bum pa'i spyi gang yin pa de 'das pa la nye bar 'dogs pa 'brel ba las yin nam /
translated: If you say that the universal is imputed, that is illogical. Is the universal of the present pot imputed to the past because of a relationship?

original: 'dra ba las 'dogs @25b grang na nye ba med par nye bar 'dogs na ni thams cad la thams cad nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba las 'dogs @25b grang na nye ba med par nye bar 'dogs na ni thams cad la thams cad nye bar 'dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is designated on the basis of similarity, then if it is designated as similar to what is not similar, then everything would be designated as similar to everything.

original: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i bum pa'i rigs la 'brel pa 'am 'dra ba med de 'das pa la sogs pa yang yod par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i bum pa'i rigs la 'brel pa 'am 'dra ba med de 'das pa la sogs pa yang yod par thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The past and present types of pot do not have a connection or similarity, because it would follow that the past and so on would exist.

original: 'o na te sgra 'dogs na de yang mi rung ste don med par sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na te sgra 'dogs na de yang mi rung ste don med par sgra mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is designated on the basis of sound, that is also not tenable because sound does not engage without an object.

original: 'jug na yang med pa la sgra 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'jug na yang med pa la sgra 'jug par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'thob bo //
translated: If it does engage, then it would follow that sound engages with the nonexistent.

original: de lta na ni spyi dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni spyi dngos po med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the universal would be a nonthing.

original: sgra dang 'das pa la sogs pa gang gis nye bar gdags par 'gyur ba'i nye ba yang brjod dgos so //
analyzed: sgra dang 'das pa la sogs pa gang gis nye bar gdags par 'gyur ba'i nye ba yang brjod dgos so //
translated: One must also state what is similar to the sound and the past and so on on the basis of which it is designated.

original: 'o na te gsal ba 'dogs na de yang mi rigs te 'di ltar da ltar byung ba'i bum pa yang 'das pa la nye ba gang yin pa dang snam bu la sogs pa la nye ba med pa gang yin pa'i rgyu gang zhig gis nye bar gdags pa'i
analyzed: 'o na te gsal ba 'dogs na de yang mi rigs te 'di ltar da ltar byung ba'i bum pa yang 'das pa la nye ba gang yin pa dang snam bu la sogs pa la nye ba med pa gang yin pa'i rgyu gang zhig gis nye bar gdags pa'i
translated: But if it is imputed to be manifest, that also is illogical. In this way, what is the cause by which the present vase is imputed to be near the past and not near cloth and so on?

original: gsal pa'am rigs sam /
analyzed: gsal pa'am rigs sam /
translated: Is it manifest or is it a type?

original: brjod pa 'das pa'i bum pa la 'jug gi snam bu la sogs pa la ma yin /
analyzed: brjod pa 'das pa'i bum pa la 'jug gi snam bu la sogs pa la ma yin /
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe past vase‚Äù engages but does not engage ‚Äúthe past cloth‚Äù and so on.

original: nye ba med par nye bar gdags par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: nye ba med par nye bar gdags par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to impute nearness to that which is not near.

original: 'on te da ltar byung ba'i bum pa la sogs pa la tha dad par 'jug pa'i rgyu spyi yong pas tha dad par 'jug pa'i rgyu can gang yin pa de ni dngos yin la 'das pa la sogs pa la sgra nye bar btags pa'o zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / rtag tu dngos dang btags pa ni //
analyzed: 'on te da ltar byung ba'i bum pa la sogs pa la tha dad par 'jug pa'i rgyu spyi yong pas tha dad par 'jug pa'i rgyu can gang yin pa de ni dngos yin la 'das pa la sogs pa la sgra nye bar btags pa'o zhe na / smras pa / rtag tu dngos dang btags pa ni //
translated: But if you say that the present vase and so on is a thing because it is the cause of engaging in difference, since it is the cause of engaging in difference through the universal, then the term is imputed to be near the past and so on.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩThings and imputations are always engaged by the mind

original: blo yi drang mi drang 'jug yin //
analyzed: blo yi drang mi drang 'jug yin //
translated: in a direct and indirect manner.

original: seng ge dang ni bram ze'i khye'u //
analyzed: seng ge dang ni bram ze'i khye'u //
translated: The lion and the young brahmin

original: de ltar 'jig rten pa la grags //
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pa la grags //
translated: are renowned in the world in that way.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: üîΩüîΩ

original: tha dad pa'i khyad par can ni dngos ma yin gyi 'on kyang blo nyid kyi drang por 'jug pa dang drang po ma yin par 'jug pa ni dngos dang btags pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i khyad par can ni dngos ma yin gyi 'on kyang blo nyid kyi drang por 'jug pa dang drang po ma yin par 'jug pa ni dngos dang btags pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The difference between real and nominal is not due to a difference in the thing itself, but rather to the fact that the cognition of the thing is either direct or indirect.

original: rim pa bzhin du seng ge dang bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: rim pa bzhin du seng ge dang bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: For example, the word ‚Äúlion‚Äù is applied to a real lion and to a brahman boy who is called ‚Äúlion‚Äù because he is courageous like a lion.

original: bram ze'i khye'u la ni drang po ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir de la seng ge nyid du btags pa ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u la ni drang po ma yin par rtogs pa'i phyir de la seng ge nyid du btags pa ste /
translated: But the word ‚Äúlion‚Äù is applied to the brahman boy only indirectly, because he is understood to be courageous like a lion.

original: gzhan du seng ge nyid la de bzhin du brjod pa'i phyir dngos yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du seng ge nyid la de bzhin du brjod pa'i phyir dngos yin no //
translated: In the case of the real lion, the word is applied directly, because it is said to be a lion just as it is.

original: bum pha la sogs pa la ni 'das pa dang da ltar ba ni 'khrul par shes pa'i yul med pa'i phyir nye bar gdags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pha la sogs pa la ni 'das pa dang da ltar ba ni 'khrul par shes pa'i yul med pa'i phyir nye bar gdags pa ma yin no //
translated: But the word ‚Äúpast‚Äù is not applied to a pot, etc., because it is not the object of a mistaken cognition.

original: 'on te 'brel ba med pa'i sgra ni btags pa yin la da ltar ba'i bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can ni dngos yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'brel ba med pa'i sgra ni btags pa yin la da ltar ba'i bum pa la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can ni dngos yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the word ‚Äúpast‚Äù is applied to a pot, etc., indirectly, because it is not directly related to them, and that it is applied to a present pot, etc., directly, because it is directly related to them,

original: smras pa / gang la grags pas don can la'ang//
analyzed: smras pa / gang la grags pas don can la'ang//
translated: Objection: The word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩReply: The word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi sgra 'god pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi sgra 'god pa //
translated: The word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.

original: de der dngos yin de mtshungs phyir //üîΩ'khrul rtog can gzhan btags pa yin //
analyzed: de der dngos yin de mtshungs phyir // 'khrul rtog can gzhan btags pa yin //
translated: The word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.

original: ji ltar yod pa 'ang med brjod pa'am //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa 'ang med brjod pa'am //
translated: The word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.

original: ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du ni //üîΩnus pa'am mi nus gtso sogs pa'i //
analyzed: ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du ni // nus pa'am mi nus gtso sogs pa'i //
translated: The word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.

original: sgra ni skye bos byas pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgra ni skye bos byas pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.üîΩThe word is applied to the object by convention.

original: yul gang la grags pas yul med pa can gyi sgra skye bos @26a * //
analyzed: yul gang la grags pas yul med pa can gyi sgra skye bos @26a * //

original: de bas dngos po gang zhig 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa can gyi shes pa'i yul yin pa de ni gtso bo yin la cig shos ni nye bar btags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas dngos po gang zhig 'khrul pa med par rtogs pa can gyi shes pa'i yul yin pa de ni gtso bo yin la cig shos ni nye bar btags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is the object of a cognition that has ascertained it without error is the primary, and the other is called the secondary.

original: 'on te 'das pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa yul med pa can yin yang /
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa la sogs pa'i yul can gyi shes pa yul med pa can yin yang /
translated: But even though the cognition that has a past object does not have an object,

original: da ltar byung ba la ni sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin ba de dngos po'i yul can te gcig 'khrul pa las thams cad de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang rab rib can gyi shes pa 'khrul zhes te gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la ni sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa gang yin ba de dngos po'i yul can te gcig 'khrul pa las thams cad de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang rab rib can gyi shes pa 'khrul zhes te gzugs la sogs pa'i shes pa
translated: the cognition that arises from sound in the present does have a real object. It is not the case that because one is mistaken, all are like that, and it is not the case that the cognition of a person with cataracts is mistaken, and all cognitions of form and so on

original: thams cad dang ba'i mig las skyes pa 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad dang ba'i mig las skyes pa 'khrul pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: arising from clear eyes are non mistaken.

original: smras pa / zhig la sgra las blo ci 'dra //
analyzed: smras pa / zhig la sgra las blo ci 'dra //
translated: We say: What is the cognition of sound like in the destroyed?

original: snang ba de 'dra ma zhig la'ang //
analyzed: snang ba de 'dra ma zhig la'ang //
translated: It is like the appearance in the undestroyed.

original: rna ba la sogs pa yi sems //üîΩdon yod can la de lta min //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa yi sems // don yod can la de lta min //
translated: The mind of the ear and so on

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is not like that in the case of the existent object.üîΩHere,

original: sgra rnams las sngon por snang ba dang mi gsal ba'i blo zhig pa'i dngos po la rig par 'gyur pa de kho na ltar te sngon po'i rnam pa mi gsal ba'i ma zhig pa'i dngos po la yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra rnams las sngon por snang ba dang mi gsal ba'i blo zhig pa'i dngos po la rig par 'gyur pa de kho na ltar te sngon po'i rnam pa mi gsal ba'i ma zhig pa'i dngos po la yang mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But the sound of the word ‚Äúblue‚Äù would be cognized as the thing that is the basis of the appearance of blue and the non-disintegrated entity that is the basis of the non-manifest cognition.

original: de ltar med pa'i don snang ba dang khyad par ma yin par snang ba ni bden pa dang yod pa'i yul gang yin pa can rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la yod pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar rab rib can gyis skra shad mthong ba thams cad du 'jug pa dang slu ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar med pa'i don snang ba dang khyad par ma yin par snang ba ni bden pa dang yod pa'i yul gang yin pa can rna ba la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams la yod pa ma yin te / 'di ltar rab rib can gyis skra shad mthong ba thams cad du 'jug pa dang slu ba yin gyi /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù and the meaning of ‚Äúnon-distinct‚Äù do not exist for the consciousnesses such as the auditory consciousness that have real and existent objects.üîΩThus, the consciousness of someone with eye disease that perceives floating hairs is not a valid cognition because it is mistaken and it is not confined to its object.üîΩBut the visual consciousness of someone with healthy eyes that perceives blue arises in regard to a particular object, it is not mistaken, and it is confined to its object.

original: mig dag pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yul so sor nges pa nyid la sngon po la sogs par snang ba can dang mi slu ba skye zhing sgra las na zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la rnam pa gcig pa can yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'dzin paüîΩma yin no //
analyzed: mig dag pa'i rnam par shes pa ni yul so sor nges pa nyid la sngon po la sogs par snang ba can dang mi slu ba skye zhing sgra las na zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la rnam pa gcig pa can yin pa'i phyir dngos po 'dzin paüîΩma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a valid cognition that apprehends a real thing.

original: spyi tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: spyi tsam 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it apprehends the universal.

original: sems gnyis mtshungs pa yin zhe na //
analyzed: sems gnyis mtshungs pa yin zhe na //
translated: If you say that the two cognitions are similar,

original: de ni yan @26b gar ba nyid du //üîΩ'dzin pa sngon du bzlog pa yin //
analyzed: de ni yan @26b gar ba nyid du // 'dzin pa sngon du bzlog pa yin //
translated: That is not so,

original: zhas bya ba la /
analyzed: zhas bya ba la /
translated: Because the apprehension of the universal was previously refuted.

original: 'on te sgra pas gsal ba dang gral ba spyi 'dzin pa ste de'i phyir zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa gnyis snang ba mtshungs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgra pas gsal ba dang gral ba spyi 'dzin pa ste de'i phyir zhig pa dang ma zhig pa la dmigs pa can gyi shes pa gnyis snang ba mtshungs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition of sound apprehends the individual and the universal, and therefore the two cognitions that observe the disintegrated and the nondisintegrated are similar,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gang gi phyir spyi de gsal ba dang bral bar 'dzin pa de ni sngon du de spyi min dang gsal ba min zhes bya bar bkag zin to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi de gsal ba dang bral bar 'dzin pa de ni sngon du de spyi min dang gsal ba min zhes bya bar bkag zin to //
translated: Because the apprehension of the universal as separate from the individual was previously refuted, saying, ‚ÄúIt is not the universal, it is not the individual.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni dngos po med pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni dngos po med pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: Therefore the cognition that arises from sound has a nonexistent object.

original: ji ste dngos po med pa la sgra las 'byung ba'i shes pa 'jug par cis shes /
analyzed: ji ste dngos po med pa la sgra las 'byung ba'i shes pa 'jug par cis shes /
translated: But how do you know that the cognition that arises from sound engages a nonexistent object?

original: 'on te rtogs pa nyid dngos po med pa la ni 'jug na ni zhig pa ma shes par snang ba tha dad pa'i med pa shes pa med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa nyid dngos po med pa la ni 'jug na ni zhig pa ma shes par snang ba tha dad pa'i med pa shes pa med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But if the cognition itself is of a non-entity, then, since the destruction is not cognized, the cognition of the non-existence of the different appearances is not non-existence itself.

original: ji lta ba zhig pa rtogs pa 'dir bzhin du ma zhig pa yang yin no //
analyzed: ji lta ba zhig pa rtogs pa 'dir bzhin du ma zhig pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as the destruction is cognized, so also the non-destruction is.

original: des na 'di ltar rtogs pas zhig par nges par byed /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar rtogs pas zhig par nges par byed /
translated: Thus, since it is cognized in this way, the destruction is ascertained.

original: 'on te the tshom yod de med par nges pa ni ma yin no zer na /
analyzed: 'on te the tshom yod de med par nges pa ni ma yin no zer na /
translated: But if there is doubt, there is no ascertainment of non-existence.

original: 'o na gal te sgra las dngos po rtogs na ji ltar the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gal te sgra las dngos po rtogs na ji ltar the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: If an entity is cognized from sound, how can there be doubt?

original: snang bar gyur na the tshom za bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang bar gyur na the tshom za bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not proper to doubt when there is an appearance.

original: snang bar gyur kyang 'dra ba las the tshom za'o zhe na /
analyzed: snang bar gyur kyang 'dra ba las the tshom za'o zhe na /
translated: Even if there is an appearance, doubt arises from similarity.

original: de yang ma yin te tha dad par mthong ba dag la 'dra bar brjod par rang gi tha dad par mi snang na ni gcig pa nyid de 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma yin te tha dad par mthong ba dag la 'dra bar brjod par rang gi tha dad par mi snang na ni gcig pa nyid de 'dra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: That is also not so, because for those who see difference, similarity is said to be non-different. If it does not appear as different, it is not the same.

original: 'on te dus tha dad pas tha dad do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te dus tha dad pas tha dad do zhe na /
translated: But if it is different due to temporal difference,

original: dus tha dad pas dngos po tha dad pa dang de nyid yin par ji ltar shes te yod pa'i yul can yin yang snga phyi'i shes pa dag dus tha dad pa nyid yin gyi dngos po tha mi dad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dus tha dad pas dngos po tha dad pa dang de nyid yin par ji ltar shes te yod pa'i yul can yin yang snga phyi'i shes pa dag dus tha dad pa nyid yin gyi dngos po tha mi dad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: How can you know that they are the same thing, since they are different in time?

original: de ltan 'o na ni 'das pa la sogs pa yang dus tha dad pa ma yin te dngos po tha dad pa ma yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: de ltan 'o na ni 'das pa la sogs pa yang dus tha dad pa ma yin te dngos po tha dad pa ma yin pa de bas na /
translated: If you say that even though they have different objects, the earlier and later cognitions are the same in being cognition, then past and future would not be different in time, since they are the same in being things.

original: gal de sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa dngos po'i yul can yin na 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gal de sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa dngos po'i yul can yin na 'das pa la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thad do //
translated: If the cognition that arises from sound has a thing as its object, then the classification of past, etc., is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni gdon mi za bar dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni gdon mi za bar dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition that arises from sound does not have a thing as its object.

original: 'on te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na khyad par med par rtogs par gyur pa spyi yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na khyad par med par rtogs par gyur pa spyi yin no //
translated: But if a universal is a particular that is apprehended without distinction,

original: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba dang rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa dngos po'i yul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra las byung ba dang rjes su dpag pa'i shes pa dngos po'i yul can yin zhe na /
translated: then the cognition that arises from sound and the inferential cognition have things as their objects.

original: smras pa / phan tshun khyad par can rnams dngos //
analyzed: smras pa / phan tshun khyad par can rnams dngos //
translated: Objection: How can those that are mutually distinct

original: khyad par med par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par med par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: Become undifferentiated?

original: ngo bo nyid gnyis yod na yang //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gnyis yod na yang //
translated: Even if there were two natures,

original: de dngos gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dngos gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could they be one entity?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: gang rjes su dpag pas khyad par med par gzung ba de gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
analyzed: gang rjes su dpag pas khyad par med par gzung ba de gal te shes pa'i rang bzhin yin na ni rjes su dpag pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin no //
translated: If what is grasped without distinction by inference is the nature of consciousness, then inference does not have an existent object.

original: 'on te dngos po nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na /üîΩde lta na yang khyad par can gyi ngo bo nyid phyi rol pa rnams phan tshun khyad par med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji ltar rung ste /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhe na / de lta na yang khyad par can gyi ngo bo nyid phyi rol pa rnams phan tshun khyad par med pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji ltar rung ste /
translated: But if it is the nature of an existent that is the object of inference,üîΩthen how could the nature of those that are distinct from each other be undifferentiated?

original: khyad par can dang khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin gang gcig pa nyid du 'gal @27a * //üîΩba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can dang khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin gang gcig pa nyid du 'gal @27a * //üîΩba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is contradictory for something that is distinct from something else to be undifferentiated from it.

original: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi ngo bo nyid la ba lang la sogs pa mngon sum nyid kyis mthong ba ste de bas na spyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can ni dngos po'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can gyi ngo bo nyid la ba lang la sogs pa mngon sum nyid kyis mthong ba ste de bas na spyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can ni dngos po'o zhe na /
translated: But if the universal is the nature of that which is present in what is similar and absent in what is dissimilar, then the cow and so on are seen by direct perception to have that nature. Therefore, an entity has the nature of a universal and an instance.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid gnyis su 'gyur na ni spyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po de ngo bo gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid gnyis su 'gyur na ni spyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can gyi dngos po de ngo bo gcig tu ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If the nature of an entity is twofold, in that it is present in what is similar and absent in what is dissimilar, then how could that entity be a single nature?

original: de ltar shes pa las gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa las gnyis kyi bdag nyid kyi dngos po yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that an entity is the nature of a duality because it is known in that way,

original: ming gi rang bzhin can gang zhig ba lang zhes ba lang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba nyid du shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ming gi rang bzhin can gang zhig ba lang zhes ba lang zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba nyid du shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: is not the nature of a name that which is known as ‚Äúpresent in what is similar and absent in what is dissimilar‚Äù?

original: 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this?

original: dbang po'i shes pa la ni rjes su 'gro bar mi snang ba nyid yin te khyad par can gyi ngo bo nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa la ni rjes su 'gro bar mi snang ba nyid yin te khyad par can gyi ngo bo nyid snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not appear to the sense consciousness as present in what is similar and absent in what is dissimilar, because the nature of the instance appears.

original: rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas mi gsal bar nyams su myong pa nyid yin gyi gsal ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang bcas pa'i shes pas mi gsal bar nyams su myong pa nyid yin gyi gsal ba'i rnam pa 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the cognition apprehends the aspect of clarity.

original: dran pa dang mngon sum las gzhan pa'i rig pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dran pa dang mngon sum las gzhan pa'i rig pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no awareness other than memory and perception,üîΩhow could a universal be a thing that has the nature of a particular?üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.

original: ji ltar spyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can dngos por 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar spyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can dngos por 'gyur /
translated: If it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,

original: de dag las gzhan gyur ba de //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan gyur ba de //
translated: then it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.

original: de dag ngo bo mtshungs na ni //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo mtshungs na ni //
translated: If it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,

original: de dag gi zhes 'brel pa med //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes 'brel pa med //
translated: because it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,

original: ldog pa la ni nyes pa med //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: ldog pa la ni nyes pa med // ces bya ba la /
translated: then it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,

original: 'on te khra bo dang nag po de dag las spyi tha dad pa nyid mtshungs par khra bo dang nag po la yod par 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khra bo dang nag po de dag las spyi tha dad pa nyid mtshungs par khra bo dang nag po la yod par 'dod do zhe na /
translated: because it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,üîΩthen it would not be related to them,üîΩbecause it would not be the same nature as those.üîΩIf it were different from those,

original: gal te de lta na de dag gi de spyi zhes bya bar 'brel bar mi 'gyur te don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta na de dag gi de spyi zhes bya bar 'brel bar mi 'gyur te don gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would not be related to them,

original: de bas na spyi ma yin te ka ba bum pa'i spyi ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na spyi ma yin te ka ba bum pa'i spyi ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: because

original: 'on te spyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i spyi ka ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi khyad par gyi bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir bum pa'i spyi ka ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the universal of pot is a pillar because it has the nature of a universal and a particular,

original: spyi'i bdag nyid kyis ba lang nyid yin na spyi kho nar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid kyis ba lang nyid yin na spyi kho nar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: then if it is cow-ness by virtue of having the nature of a universal, wouldn‚Äôt it be a universal alone?

original: de la khyad par dang 'bral bar ci ltar shes /
analyzed: de la khyad par dang 'bral bar ci ltar shes /
translated: How can it be known to be devoid of a particular?

original: 'on te khyad par dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin nyid spyi yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin nyid spyi yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the nature of something related to a particular is a universal,

original: de lta na yang khyad par thams cad snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na yang khyad par thams cad snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: then all particulars would appear,

original: spyi khyad par thams cad dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod yang mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te spyi'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa khyad par gsal ba dang 'brel pa can nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: spyi khyad par thams cad dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir 'dod yang mngon sum gyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro // 'on te spyi'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa khyad par gsal ba dang 'brel pa can nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: because the nature of a universal is related to all particulars, and because it is asserted that it is apprehended by direct perception.üîΩBut if you say that the nature of a universal is not related to a manifest particular,

original: ma yin te gsal ba dang 'brel pa nyid las tha dad par spyi'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te gsal ba dang 'brel pa nyid las tha dad par spyi'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then it is not so, because apart from being related to a manifest particular, there is no nature of a universal.

original: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can rigs kyi ngo bo nyid yin gyi de dang 'brel pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na /üîΩspyi'i rnam pa can nyid ces bya ba gsal ba dang 'brel ba nyid du brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can rigs kyi ngo bo nyid yin gyi de dang 'brel pa nyid ni ma yin no zhe na / spyi'i rnam pa can nyid ces bya ba gsal ba dang 'brel ba nyid du brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if you say that the universal is the nature of the class, but is not related to it,üîΩthen is not the universal said to be related to the manifestation?

original: gsal ba la ltos nas spyi'i rnam pa can nyid yin gyi ngo bo nyid la ltos nas ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gsal ba la ltos nas spyi'i rnam pa can nyid yin gyi ngo bo nyid la ltos nas ni ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the universal in relation to the manifestation, but not in relation to its own nature,

original: de rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pas thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pas thun mong ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: because it is not shared in relation to its own nature.

original: gsal ba la ltos nas spyi nyid @27b yin na yang de bzung bas gsal ba thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba la ltos nas spyi nyid @27b yin na yang de bzung bas gsal ba thams cad gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the universal is the universal in relation to the manifestation, then by apprehending that, all manifestations would be apprehended.

original: spyi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin nam khyed la yang skyon 'di ji ltar med de /
analyzed: spyi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid can ma yin nam khyed la yang skyon 'di ji ltar med de /
translated: But is not the universal defined as the exclusion of the other? How can you avoid this error?

original: 'di ltar ldog pa spyir 'dod pas kyang phan tshun khyad par can du gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar ldog pa spyir 'dod pas kyang phan tshun khyad par can du gyur pa'i ngo bo nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: In this way, even those who assert that the universal is the exclusion of the other, how could it be the nature of the mutual exclusion?

original: tha dad na yang de'i ldog pa'o zhes 'brel par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad na yang de'i ldog pa'o zhes 'brel par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If they are different, then the relation of the universal to the particulars cannot be expressed as ‚Äúthe reversal of that.‚Äù

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: ldog pa'o spyi la nyes pa med de phan tshun khyad par can du gyur pa rnams gzhan las ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'o spyi la nyes pa med de phan tshun khyad par can du gyur pa rnams gzhan las ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault in the reversal of the universal, because those that are mutually distinct are the reversal of the other.

original: 'di ltar ris mi mthun pa las gcig log pa de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang yin te spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ldog pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar ris mi mthun pa las gcig log pa de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang yin te spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ldog pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, just as one class is the reversal of the other, so too are the others. There is no contradiction, because the cognition that has the universal aspect is the cause of the reversal.

original: sna tshogs ma mthong ba can gyi mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid cis zlog par byed ;
analyzed: sna tshogs ma mthong ba can gyi mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid cis zlog par byed ;
translated: How can one who does not see the diversity of particulars reverse the cognition of the universal?

original: 'on te khyad par rnams la ce ltar spyi rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par rnams la ce ltar spyi rtogs pa yin /
translated: Or, how can one understand the universal in the particulars?

original: spyi rtogs pa nyid las spyi nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa nyid las spyi nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the universal is understood from the universal itself?

original: spyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa las tha dad pa'i spyi gzhan gyi rang bzhin mi snang ba'i phyir de la spyi ma yin pa rnams la spyi'i blor ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: spyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa las tha dad pa'i spyi gzhan gyi rang bzhin mi snang ba'i phyir de la spyi ma yin pa rnams la spyi'i blor ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Because a universal that is different from the cognition that has the universal aspect does not appear, how can there be a cognition of the universal in those that are not the universal?

original: 'dri ba 'di'i don ni spyi ma yin pa'i yul can gyi shes pa ji ltar spyi'i blor 'gyur zhing spyi blo'i yul ma yin par mi 'grub ste spyi'i blo myong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'dri ba 'di'i don ni spyi ma yin pa'i yul can gyi shes pa ji ltar spyi'i blor 'gyur zhing spyi blo'i yul ma yin par mi 'grub ste spyi'i blo myong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The meaning of this question is: How can a cognition that has a non-universal for its object be a universal cognition, and not be established as not being the object of a universal cognition, because of the experience of a universal cognition?

original: de yi phyir na mtshungs pa nyid //
analyzed: de yi phyir na mtshungs pa nyid //
translated: Therefore, it is the same.

original: spyi 'di dngos med mtshan nyid yin //
analyzed: spyi 'di dngos med mtshan nyid yin //
translated: This universal is the characteristic of a non-entity.

original: 'bras bu yin na de du mar //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin na de du mar //
translated: If it were an effect, it would be multiple.

original: 'gyur zhing 'jig rten 'di mi 'dod //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing 'jig rten 'di mi 'dod //
translated: And the world does not accept it.

original: 'jig pa dngos po tsam dang ni //
analyzed: 'jig pa dngos po tsam dang ni //
translated: Because destruction is related to mere entities,

original: rjes 'brel phyir rtag pa nyid min //
analyzed: rjes 'brel phyir rtag pa nyid min //
translated: and because it is related to what follows, it is not permanent.

original: rigs rnams 'brel ba med na yang //
analyzed: rigs rnams 'brel ba med na yang //
translated: Even though universals are unrelated,

original: ngo bo nyid med 'bras min phyir //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med 'bras min phyir //
translated: they are not effects because they have no nature.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is what is said.

original: spyi'i rnam ba can nyid ni 'khrul pa'i ngo bo las tha dad par bstan par mi nus pa de'i phyir 'di mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid de ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam ba can nyid ni 'khrul pa'i ngo bo las tha dad par bstan par mi nus pa de'i phyir 'di mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid de ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The state of having a universal aspect cannot be shown to be different from the nature of error. Therefore, this is the characteristic of a non-entity by the nature of sameness. That is its nature.

original: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can nyid gsal ba ji ltar yod pa bzhin yod de /
analyzed: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can nyid gsal ba ji ltar yod pa bzhin yod de /
translated: Or else, the universal exists in the same way that the manifest exists, that is, in a general way.

original: gang na gnyis yod pa de na gnyis kyi rnam pa dang / gang gsum yin pa bde na gsum gyi rnam pa nyid yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gang na gnyis yod pa de na gnyis kyi rnam pa dang / gang gsum yin pa bde na gsum gyi rnam pa nyid yod do zhe na /
translated: When there are two manifestations, there is the form of two; when there are three, there is the form of three.

original: de lta na 'o na ni gsal pa gzhan du skye ba na spyi 'phel par 'gyur ba can te gsal ba yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni gsal pa gzhan du skye ba na spyi 'phel par 'gyur ba can te gsal ba yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir 'bras bu nyid yin no //
translated: If that is so, then when the manifestation arises elsewhere, the universal would increase, because it would follow the existence and nonexistence of the manifestation and would be the effect of the manifestation.

original: 'on te gsal ba'i 'bras bu spyi yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba'i 'bras bu spyi yin no zhe na /
translated: But if the universal is the effect of the manifestation,

original: de lta na yang gsal ba bzhin spyi de du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang gsal ba bzhin spyi de du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, like the manifestation, the universal would be multiple.

original: 'on te ngo shes pa yin pa'i phyir rigs gcig pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ngo shes pa yin pa'i phyir rigs gcig pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is the same class because it is recognized,

original: de lta na yang rigs la sang tha dad pa'i mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir rigs thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang rigs la sang tha dad pa'i mtshungs pa'i rnam pa can yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir rigs thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, because the universal would exist in the form of a similar class that is different, the class would be infinite.

original: 'on te rigs las rigs gzhan mi rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rigs las rigs gzhan mi rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that a different class is not understood from the class,üîΩthen,

original: gsal ba la yang rigs rtogs pa med pa'i phyir brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba la yang rigs rtogs pa med pa'i phyir brtsad pa mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: Because the existence of a type is not understood from the manifestation, the objection is the same.

original: 'on te ngo shes pas gsal ba'i rigs khong @28a * //üîΩdu chud do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ngo shes pas gsal ba'i rigs khong @28a * // du chud do zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the type is understood from recognition of the manifestation,

original: rigs la yang rigs gzhan ngo shes pas rtogs su rung ba'i phyir rigs thug pa med par 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhan yang spyi de mi 'dod pa'i 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur te gsal ba zhig na 'jig pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir yang rigs 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur gyi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs la yang rigs gzhan ngo shes pas rtogs su rung ba'i phyir rigs thug pa med par 'gyur ro // gzhan yang spyi de mi 'dod pa'i 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur te gsal ba zhig na 'jig pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yin pa'i phyir yang rigs 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can du 'gyur gyi rtag pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: then the type would be endless, because another type would be recognized in the type.üîΩMoreover, that universal would be impermanent, because it is destroyed when the manifestation is destroyed, and because it is an entity.

original: 'jig pa ni yod pa tsam dang 'brel ba can yin pa'i phyir dngos por gyur na gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni yod pa tsam dang 'brel ba can yin pa'i phyir dngos por gyur na gdon mi za bar 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The type would be impermanent, not permanent, because destruction is related to mere existence. If it becomes an entity, it will certainly be destroyed.

original: 'on te rigs 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te rigs 'bras bu ma yin pa nyid du 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that the type is not the effect,

original: de ltan yang rigs gsal pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pas de dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te spyi ni gsal ba dang 'brel pa yin gyi rang rgyud pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltan yang rigs gsal pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pas de dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur te spyi ni gsal ba dang 'brel pa yin gyi rang rgyud pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But because it is not the effect of a clear instance of the type, it is not related to that, and therefore it is not the same nature. This is because the universal is related to the instance, but it is not a separate continuum.

original: gzhan yang rigs brda'i stobs kyis sgra'i shes pa la snang ba de lta na yang dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs brda'i stobs kyis sgra'i shes pa la snang ba de lta na yang dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, even though the appearance in the cognition of a word is by the power of the type and the convention, it is not a real thing.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / dngos po'i stobs las skyes pa yi //üîΩshes pa gang de brda dag la //üîΩltos pa ma yin spyi yi ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dngos po'i stobs las skyes pa yi // shes pa gang de brda dag la // ltos pa ma yin spyi yi ni //
translated: The cognition that arises from the power of a thingüîΩDoes not depend on a convention.

original: blo la de dag snang mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: blo la de dag snang mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The universal does not appearüîΩTo the cognition that apprehends it.

original: shes pa gang zhig dngos po'i stobs te nus pa las skyes pa'i shes pa de ni brda la ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes pa gang zhig dngos po'i stobs te nus pa las skyes pa'i shes pa de ni brda la ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: The cognition that arises from the power, that is, the capacity, of a thing does not depend on a convention.

original: dngos po nye ba'i stobs kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po nye ba'i stobs kho na las skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it arises only from the power of the thing being present.

original: dbang po'i shes pa brda dran pa la ltos nas gzugs la sogs pa la 'jug pa ma yin te brda ma bzung bar yang gzugs mthong ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa brda dran pa la ltos nas gzugs la sogs pa la 'jug pa ma yin te brda ma bzung bar yang gzugs mthong ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sensory consciousnesses do not engage forms and so on in dependence on remembering a sign because seeing a form arises even without apprehending a sign.

original: gal te yang mig gi shes pa brdal ltos pa nyid yin na dngos po dang 'brel bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang mig gi shes pa brdal ltos pa nyid yin na dngos po dang 'brel bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if the eye consciousness depended on a sign, it would not be related to the thing.

original: 'di ltar brda sbyor ba ni nye ba tsam las 'das nas byed la brda la ltas nas shes pa ni sgro btags pa'i spyod yul can nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar brda sbyor ba ni nye ba tsam las 'das nas byed la brda la ltas nas shes pa ni sgro btags pa'i spyod yul can nyid do //
translated: For the one who applies the sign does so after the thing has passed away, and the consciousness that depends on the sign has a superimposed object.

original: 'on te brda yang dngos po nye bar gyur pa la sbyor ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brda yang dngos po nye bar gyur pa la sbyor ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that the sign is applied when the thing is present?

original: gal te snga phyir sgro 'dogs pa med par brda sbyor ba med pa de lta na mi nus par 'gyur pas brda las dngos po rtogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te snga phyir sgro 'dogs pa med par brda sbyor ba med pa de lta na mi nus par 'gyur pas brda las dngos po rtogs par mi 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the sign is not applied without superimposition in the past and future, then it would be impossible, and one would not understand the thing from the sign.

original: 'on te sgra'i stobs nyid las brda med par yang tha snyad kyi dus su shes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i stobs nyid las brda med par yang tha snyad kyi dus su shes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the sign is understood at the time of the convention by the power of the word itself, without a sign?

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa /
translated: Fourth part

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: snga phyi gcig tu sre ba med na rtogs pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: snga phyi gcig tu sre ba med na rtogs pa ma mthong ste /
translated: If there is no conflation of earlier and later [moments], then the cognition is not seen.

original: gzhan du na brda ma bzung bar yang sgra'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na brda ma bzung bar yang sgra'i shes pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even without apprehending the sign, the cognition of the word would arise.

original: spyi'i blo ni brda 'dzin pa med par de dngos pa'i dngos las skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i blo ni brda 'dzin pa med par de dngos pa'i dngos las skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the universal does not arise from that entity without apprehending the sign.

original: 'on te spyi'i blo ni brda 'dzin pa med par gsal ba gzhan mthong ba las 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi'i blo ni brda 'dzin pa med par gsal ba gzhan mthong ba las 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: But if the cognition of the universal arises from seeing another instance without apprehending the sign,

original: spyi'i tha snyad bsgrung par bya ba de la yang gsal ba gzhan de nyid rtags ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi'i tha snyad bsgrung par bya ba de la yang gsal ba gzhan de nyid rtags ma yin nam /
translated: then in that case also, is not that other instance the reason for the universal designation?

original: brda 'dzin pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin gyi rtags can gyi @28b shes pa ni dngos po la ltos pa ma yin te des kyang snga phyi sre bar pa skyed kyi nye ba tsam 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: brda 'dzin pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin gyi rtags can gyi @28b shes pa ni dngos po la ltos pa ma yin te des kyang snga phyi sre bar pa skyed kyi nye ba tsam 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Apprehending the sign is merely an illustration, but the cognition of the possessor of the sign does not depend on the entity. It produces the conflation of earlier and later [moments], but does not apprehend mere proximity.

original: gzhan yang ha lan ta'i rigs dang bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa ni brda tsam dang 'brel pa yin gyi dngos po dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te gang gi ha lan ta la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dzin pa des de nyid kyis ha lan ta la sogsüîΩpa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang ha lan ta'i rigs dang bram ze'i rigs la sogs pa ni brda tsam dang 'brel pa yin gyi dngos po dang 'brel pa ni ma yin te gang gi ha lan ta la sogs pa'i tha snyad 'dzin pa des de nyid kyis ha lan ta la sogs pa shes pa yin no //
translated: For whoever grasps the term ‚ÄúHalƒÅhala‚Äù and so on, by that alone he knows HalƒÅhala and so on.

original: 'on te khra bo la sogs pa nye bar gyur na brda 'dzin pa med par yang ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba'i shes pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te khra bo la sogs pa nye bar gyur na brda 'dzin pa med par yang ba lang ba lang zhes bya ba'i shes pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But when a multicolored object and so on is present, isn‚Äôt it seen that the cognition ‚Äúcow, cow‚Äù arises even without grasping the term?

original: brda la ma ltos pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir spyi dngos po yin te sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: brda la ma ltos pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir spyi dngos po yin te sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: The universal is a thing because it is the object of a cognition that does not depend on a term, like the cognition of blue and so on.üîΩWe say:üîΩSome cognition that sees two things

original: smras pa / dngos gnyis mthong la blo 'ga' zhig / brda med na yang mi phyed pa'i ;
analyzed: smras pa / dngos gnyis mthong la blo 'ga' zhig / brda med na yang mi phyed pa'i ;
translated: is not differentiated even without a term.

original: / rjes su 'jug pa gang yin te //
analyzed: / rjes su 'jug pa gang yin te //
translated: That which is engaged

original: don nye ba yi rgyu can yin //
analyzed: don nye ba yi rgyu can yin //
translated: is caused by the presence of the object.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gal te ha len ta la sogs pa'i rigs bzhin ba lang nyid la sogs pa dngos po ma yin na de la ni nye ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: gal te ha len ta la sogs pa'i rigs bzhin ba lang nyid la sogs pa dngos po ma yin na de la ni nye ba ci yang med do //
translated: If the universal cow, etc. is not a real entity, like the hala, etc., then it has no proximity to anything.

original: 'on te rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blo sa bon med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blo sa bon med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if it is asked how a cognition having the same aspect can be without a seed,

original: ha lan ta la sogs pa yang spyi med par gcig gi rang bzhin du ji ltar shes /
analyzed: ha lan ta la sogs pa yang spyi med par gcig gi rang bzhin du ji ltar shes /
translated: how is it that the hala, etc. are known to be the nature of one thing without a universal?

original: 'on te de la yang ha lan ta nyid ces bya ba de dag gi spyir 'dod na ni de lta na brda ma bzung ba can rnam gyis kyang ji ltar mi shes pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te de la yang ha lan ta nyid ces bya ba de dag gi spyir 'dod na ni de lta na brda ma bzung ba can rnam gyis kyang ji ltar mi shes pa yin /
translated: But if it is accepted that the universal cow, etc. exists in them, then how is it that those who have not learned the convention do not know it?

original: de de dag la brda gsal bar byed pa med pas ma rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: de de dag la brda gsal bar byed pa med pas ma rtogs so zhe na /
translated: If it is said that they do not understand it because the convention is not clear to them,

original: de lta na yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam pa can phan tshun 'gal ba dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa de bzhin te brda med par mi shes pa'i phyir ci yang byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa'i rnam pa can phan tshun 'gal ba dang dngos po dang dngos po med pa de bzhin te brda med par mi shes pa'i phyir ci yang byed pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be the same for the permanent and impermanent aspects, which are mutually contradictory, and for things and non-things. Since they are not known without a convention, they would not be anything at all.

original: gal te ha lan ta la sogs pa'i blo brda tsam du yod kyi rigs ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ha lan ta la sogs pa'i blo brda tsam du yod kyi rigs ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cognition of similarity, etc. is not a type of cognition,

original: de lta na 'o na ni dpe de nyid kyis pa lang la sogs pa la yang blo nyid yod kyi rigs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni dpe de nyid kyis pa lang la sogs pa la yang blo nyid yod kyi rigs ni ma yin no //
translated: then the same would apply to the cognition of cow, etc.

original: mi phyed pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo gang yin pa brda med na yang dngos po gnyis mthong ba na yong par 'gyur pa'i blo de don rnams nye ba ste bya ba gcig nus pa de'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo gang yin pa brda med na yang dngos po gnyis mthong ba na yong par 'gyur pa'i blo de don rnams nye ba ste bya ba gcig nus pa de'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: The cognition that has the form of non-differentiation, even without a sign, is the cognition that arises when two things are seen. It is the cause of the proximity of the objects, which is the capacity for one action.

original: 'on te rigs med par gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i mtshan nyid can de nyid nye bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rigs med par gcig gi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i 'bras bu skyed nus pa'i mtshan nyid can de nyid nye bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can that be the cause of the proximity of the object, if it is not a type of cognition?

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: ji ltar rigs med par shes pa //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs med par shes pa //
translated: Just as the cognition without a type is accepted as the cause of the result,

original: 'bras can mig sogs nye bar 'dod //üîΩgang gis rnam par phye ba yis //
analyzed: 'bras can mig sogs nye bar 'dod // gang gis rnam par phye ba yis //
translated: the eye, etc. are accepted as the cause of the result, the cognition.üîΩBy what is the type made clear?

original: rigs ni rnam par gsal par byed //
analyzed: rigs ni rnam par gsal par byed //
translated: The type is made clear by what distinguishes it.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here is the commentary on that:

original: gcig gi rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa skyed pa na khra bo la sogs pa rnams la rigs pa lang nyid ma rtogs par yang nye bar yod do //
analyzed: gcig gi rnam pa can gyi rtogs pa skyed pa na khra bo la sogs pa rnams la rigs pa lang nyid ma rtogs par yang nye bar yod do //
translated: When a cognition having the aspect of one color is generated, it is not the case that the various colors are not present in the multicolored object.

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i rigs pa bskyed pa rnams la nye bar 'dod de /üîΩmig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par @29a * //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa rnams mig la sogs pa'i rigs pa bskyed pa rnams la nye bar 'dod de / mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed par @29a * //
translated: Just as when eyes and so on generate eye consciousness and so on, they are asserted to be the dominant conditions of eye consciousness and so on.

original: byed pa na'o //
analyzed: byed pa na'o //
translated: They are the dominant conditions of eye consciousness and so on when they generate eye consciousness and so on.

original: 'on te lhan cig byed pa'i grogs rnams tha dad kyang 'bras bu gcig bskyed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te lhan cig byed pa'i grogs rnams tha dad kyang 'bras bu gcig bskyed do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that even though the assisting factors are different, they generate a single effect,

original: dngos po gnyis mthong ba'i dus na yang blo gcig skyed pa na lhan cig byed pa'i grogs nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: dngos po gnyis mthong ba'i dus na yang blo gcig skyed pa na lhan cig byed pa'i grogs nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: then when two things are seen, is it not the case that a single cognition is generated and they become assisting factors?

original: 'o na khra bo la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams blo gcig gi yul du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khra bo la sogs pa tha dad pa rnams blo gcig gi yul du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how could the different colors in a multicolored object become the object of a single cognition?

original: spyi'i shes pa la khra po la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba ma yin gyi /
