analyzed: spyi'i shes pa la khra po la sogs pa gsal bar snang ba ma yin gyi /
translated: In a cognition of a composite, the various colors do not appear clearly.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol la brten nas gcig gi rnam pa can gyi blo dang des bskyed pa de nyid phyi rol gyi nus pa can yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol la brten nas gcig gi rnam pa can gyi blo dang des bskyed pa de nyid phyi rol gyi nus pa can yin no //
translated: However, in dependence on external objects, a cognition having the aspect of one thing is produced, and that very [cognition] has the capacity for an external object.

original: yang na rigs nyid gang gis tha dad pas nye ba la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rigs nyid gang gis tha dad pas nye ba la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Or, it is the very type by which, being different, it engages with what is near.

original: 'di ltar ba lang nyid khra bo la sogs pa la 'jug gi rta khra bo la sogs pa la ni ma yin pa'i phyir nges par dngos po nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ba lang nyid khra bo la sogs pa la 'jug gi rta khra bo la sogs pa la ni ma yin pa'i phyir nges par dngos po nyid du khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is like cowness, which engages with a multicolored cow and so on, but not with a multicolored horse and so on. Therefore, it must definitely be accepted as an entity.

original: 'on te brda las ma skyes pa'i shes pa nyid la rigs snang bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on te brda las ma skyes pa'i shes pa nyid la rigs snang bar 'gyur na /
translated: But if the type appears to a cognition that is not produced from a convention,

original: ji ltar rigs de med par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs de med par 'gyur /
translated: how could that type be nonexistent?

original: 'on te rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la rigs mi snang bar 'dod na ni rtog pa med pa'i shes pa rigs 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la rigs mi snang bar 'dod na ni rtog pa med pa'i shes pa rigs 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if you assert that the type does not appear to a nonconceptual cognition, then wouldn‚Äôt a nonconceptual cognition not apprehend the type?

original: mthong ba las dus phyis kyi shes pa rtogs pa dang bcas pas rigs mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba las dus phyis kyi shes pa rtogs pa dang bcas pas rigs mthong ba yin no //
translated: A subsequent cognition that is conceptual sees the type that was seen by the prior nonconceptual cognition.

original: myong par gyur pa med par mi rung ste /
analyzed: myong par gyur pa med par mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable for it to be otherwise.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that it would also lack its own characteristics.

original: de bas na tha dad pa med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i blo dngos po'i rgyu can kho na'o zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba'i gzhal bya snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa med pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i blo dngos po'i rgyu can kho na'o zhes zer ba de ni rigs pa ma yin te rjes su 'gro ba'i gzhal bya snang ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that the cognition that is not different from it is caused by a real thing, because the object of cognition that is the universal appears.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: smras pa / rnam pa 'gas kyang rnam shes la //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa 'gas kyang rnam shes la //
translated: Consciousness does not appear

original: de dngos snang ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: de dngos snang ba med phyir ro //
translated: in any way as a real universal.

original: gal te dbang rnams lta por 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te dbang rnams lta por 'gyur //
translated: If the sense faculties were the seer,

original: de yi lus ni snang 'gyur te //
analyzed: de yi lus ni snang 'gyur te //
translated: its body would appear.

original: dngos ldan phyir ro rigs min te /
analyzed: dngos ldan phyir ro rigs min te /
translated: It is illogical because it would possess a real thing,

original: yan gar mthong ba med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yan gar mthong ba med pa'i phyir //
translated: but there is no separate seeing.üîΩWhen the clear image is apprehended,

original: gsal 'dzin tshe na de sgra dang // ngo bo las gzhan snang ba med //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: gsal 'dzin tshe na de sgra dang // ngo bo las gzhan snang ba med // ces bya ba la /
translated: there is no appearance of anything other than the entity.

original: gal te spyi yod par gyur na rtog pa'i shes pa'am rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la snang bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te spyi yod par gyur na rtog pa'i shes pa'am rtog pa med pa'i shes pa la snang bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: Here, if a universal existed, it would appear to a conceptual cognition or a nonconceptual cognition.

original: ji srid du shes pa 'ga' zhig la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rigs de'i dngos po snang ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji srid du shes pa 'ga' zhig la rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rigs de'i dngos po snang ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: As long as a certain cognition does not appear in the aspect of a certain thing, that thing does not exist in the cognition.

original: rigs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the thing does not exist.

original: rigs kyi rang bzhin ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi rang bzhin ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: The nature of the thing is devoid of the aspect of color and shape.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa ni mdun na snang ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo la zhe na /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa ni mdun na snang ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo la zhe na /
translated: When a conceptual cognition apprehends the nature of a thing, it is in the aspect of blue, etc., that appears before it.

original: de ji ltar rnam pa gzhan du myong pas rigs rnam pa gzhan @29b po 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar rnam pa gzhan du myong pas rigs rnam pa gzhan @29b po 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: How can it be that the cognition experiences the thing in one aspect and apprehends the thing in another aspect?

original: de bas na snang ba med par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na snang ba med par grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the thing does not appear.

original: 'o na gal te rigs snang bar ma gyur pas med na dbang po yang mi snang ba'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na gal te rigs snang bar ma gyur pas med na dbang po yang mi snang ba'i phyir med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the thing does not exist because the thing does not appear, then the sense faculty also does not exist because it does not appear.

original: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa rgyu med pa can nyid du don las kyang skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa rgyu med pa can nyid du don las kyang skye bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the sense cognition would arise from the object without a cause.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te dbang po rnams lta ba por rnal 'byor pa kha cig la yod na ni dbang po de dag gi lus kyang snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dbang po rnams lta ba por rnal 'byor pa kha cig la yod na ni dbang po de dag gi lus kyang snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: If some yogis had a self that was the seer, then their bodies would also be seen,

original: dngos po dang ldan pa nyid kyis mngon sum du byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang ldan pa nyid kyis mngon sum du byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that they would perceive them, since they would possess entities.

original: bdag cag la sogs pas ni mig la sogs pa mi mthong ste /
analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pas ni mig la sogs pa mi mthong ste /
translated: But we and others do not see the eyes, etc.

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: of the self, because the self is beyond the senses.

original: 'o na de ltar rigs kyang ma yin nam zhe na ;
analyzed: 'o na de ltar rigs kyang ma yin nam zhe na ;
translated: But isn‚Äôt it reasonable that the self is not seen?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not reasonable.

original: bltar rung bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bltar rung bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is asserted that the self can be seen.

original: yang na rigs gcig pu ni snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na rigs gcig pu ni snang ba ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, a mere class is not seen,

original: gsal ba dang bral bar rigs de dag yan gar ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba dang bral bar rigs de dag yan gar ba mthong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a class devoid of manifestation is not seen separately.

original: 'on te rnal 'byor pa 'ba' zhig gis mig la sogs pa bzhin du rigs yan gar ba mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnal 'byor pa 'ba' zhig gis mig la sogs pa bzhin du rigs yan gar ba mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: But if the yogis see a class separately, like the eyes, etc.,

original: gal te rnal 'byor pas rigs yan gar ba mthong na de ni rigs su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rnal 'byor pas rigs yan gar ba mthong na de ni rigs su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then that class would not be a class.

original: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blo skye ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blo skye ba ma yin nam /
translated: But doesn‚Äôt a cognition that has a universal as its aspect arise?

original: de rigs kyi rgyu yin pas yan gar bar mi 'dzin te de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rigs kyi rgyu yin pas yan gar bar mi 'dzin te de med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the universal is the cause of the cognition, it is not apprehended as isolated from the particular, because it does not exist.

original: rtag tu rigs ni gsal ba la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rtag tu rigs ni gsal ba la brten pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The universal is always dependent on the particular.

original: gsal ba 'dzin pa'i tshe gsal ba dang sgra ste rjod byed dang ngo bo nyid de dag las gzhan pa'i spyi mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: gsal ba 'dzin pa'i tshe gsal ba dang sgra ste rjod byed dang ngo bo nyid de dag las gzhan pa'i spyi mi 'dzin te /
translated: When the particular is apprehended, the universal is not apprehended as different from the particular and the sound that expresses it.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin la zhen pa dang nang gi brjod pa'i bdag nyid ming gi rnam pa can du snang ba'i phyir ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin la zhen pa dang nang gi brjod pa'i bdag nyid ming gi rnam pa can du snang ba'i phyir ma yin nam /
translated: This is because the universal appears as the nature of the particular and as the form of the name that has the nature of internal expression.

original: rigs de las tha dad pa'i rten med pa can du snang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs de las tha dad pa'i rten med pa can du snang ba ma yin no //
translated: The universal does not appear as having a support that is different from that.

original: rigs de snang du mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rigs de snang du mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the universal is not suitable to appear.

original: mi snang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi snang ba ma yin nam /
translated: It is not that it does not appear.

original: de med par mi dmigs pas ji ltar shes par byed de brjod pa dang shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de med par mi dmigs pas ji ltar shes par byed de brjod pa dang shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Since it is not apprehended in the absence of the particular, how does it cause cognition? Because it is the cause of expression and cognition.

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here it is said:

original: de phyir de ni shes tsam gyi //
analyzed: de phyir de ni shes tsam gyi //
translated: Therefore, it is not able to produce a mere consciousness.

original: don byed par yang mi shes so //
analyzed: don byed par yang mi shes so //
translated: It is not able to produce an effect.

original: mi rung phyir de ngo bo med //
analyzed: mi rung phyir de ngo bo med //
translated: Because it is not suitable, it is essenceless.

original: de ni dngos med mtshan nyid yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni dngos med mtshan nyid yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is the definition of non-entityness.

original: mi snang ba de nyid kyi phyir spyi de ni shes pa tsam skyed par byed par mi nus so //
analyzed: mi snang ba de nyid kyi phyir spyi de ni shes pa tsam skyed par byed par mi nus so //
translated: Because it does not appear, that universal is not able to produce a mere consciousness.

original: mi snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyes pa la yang nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyes pa la yang nus pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: That which has the nature of not appearing is not able to produce a consciousness that has its aspect.

original: 'on te mig la sogs pa shes pa bzhin du shes pa tsam skyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mig la sogs pa shes pa bzhin du shes pa tsam skyed pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is the cause of producing a mere consciousness, like the consciousness of the eye and so on, then it is not so.

original: ma yin te rigs la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma mthong ba'i phyir ro//
analyzed: ma yin te rigs la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma mthong ba'i phyir ro//
translated: Because we do not see that it is concomitant with or incompatible with the type.

original: @30a * // shes pa tsam de la yang nus pa med pa'i phyir spyi de mi nus pa ni med pas ngo bo med pa ste gang gi phyir mi nus pa de ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid de ngo bo med pa nyid do //
analyzed: @30a * // shes pa tsam de la yang nus pa med pa'i phyir spyi de mi nus pa ni med pas ngo bo med pa ste gang gi phyir mi nus pa de ni dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid de ngo bo med pa nyid do //
translated: Because that mere consciousness is also not able to produce it, that universal is not able to produce it. Therefore it is essenceless. Because it is not able, it is non-entityness. That is the definition of non-entityness.

original: ji skad bshad las bzlog gang yin //üîΩde ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dod //
analyzed: ji skad bshad las bzlog gang yin // de ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dod //
translated: That which is the opposite of what has been explained

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: is asserted to be a specifically characterized phenomenon.

original: gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis mi snang ba de ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par nus pa ma yin pas de ni don dam par yod pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang ngo bo nyid kyis mi snang ba de ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed par nus pa ma yin pas de ni don dam par yod pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin no //
translated: That which does not appear by way of its own entity is not able to conform with existence and nonexistence. Therefore it is not a specifically characterized phenomenon that exists ultimately.

original: ji skad 'das ma thag par dngos po med par ston pa'i rnam pa dag bshad pa las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad 'das ma thag par dngos po med par ston pa'i rnam pa dag bshad pa las bzlog pa gang yin pa de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is the opposite of the aspects that were just explained, which indicate the absence of entity, is a specifically characterized phenomenon because it is known by way of its own entity.

original: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid ces brjod do //
translated: Because it has this specifically characterized entity, it is called a specifically characterized phenomenon.

original: 'o na rang gi ngo bo de nyid yin na de'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi ngo bo de nyid yin na de'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is its own entity, how could it be its characteristic?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: mtshan gzhi'i mtshan nyid dngos po ni brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan gzhi'i mtshan nyid dngos po ni brtags pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because the entity that is the basis of characteristics is imputed.

original: 'o na spyi dngos po med pa nyid du gyur na mi dmigs pa dang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ji ltar tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na spyi dngos po med pa nyid du gyur na mi dmigs pa dang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs ji ltar tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: Well, if the universal is just a non-entity, how can the reason of non-apprehension, the reason of effect, and the reason of nature be different?

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ni yul tha dad pas tha dad par rigs kyi mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni yul tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa ni yul tha dad pas tha dad par rigs kyi mi dmigs pa la sogs pa ni yul tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Direct perception and inference are different because their objects are different. But non-apprehension, etc., are not different because their objects are different.

original: spyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro tha dad pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: spyi dngos po med pa'i phyir ro tha dad pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: Because the universal is a non-entity, difference is based on entity and non-entity.

original: 'on te rtags tha dad par mthong bas so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtags tha dad par mthong bas so zhe na /
translated: But if you see the reason as different,

original: de lta na yang gtan tshigs rnam pa drug mthong ba'i phyir mdzes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang gtan tshigs rnam pa drug mthong ba'i phyir mdzes pa ma yin no //
translated: then, because you see six kinds of reasons, it is not elegant.üîΩThe effect, the contradictory,üîΩthe concomitant, the identical,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gal ba dang // ldan pa dang ni 'du ba dang // don gcig la ni 'du ba ste //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu 'gal ba dang // ldan pa dang ni 'du ba dang // don gcig la ni 'du ba ste //
translated: and the non-apprehension of the object of apprehension

original: gtan tshigs rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rnam pa drug tu 'dod //
translated: are asserted to be the six kinds of reasons.

original: de'i phyir drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, there are six.üîΩOr,

original: yang na // yod med gnyi ga la brten pa'i //
analyzed: yang na // yod med gnyi ga la brten pa'i //
translated: based on both existence and non-existence,

original: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The meaning of the term is the three aspects of Dharma.üîΩüîΩ

original: zhes bstan pa de la yod pa ste //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa de la yod pa ste //
translated: The meaning of the term is the three kinds of properties.

original: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul yin la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul yin la /
translated: The existent is the domain of the effect and nature reasonings.

original: med pa ni mi dmigs pa'i yul yin zhing gnyi ga'i rang bzhin can ni snang du mi rung ba'i mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni mi dmigs pa'i yul yin zhing gnyi ga'i rang bzhin can ni snang du mi rung ba'i mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no //
translated: The nonexistent is the domain of non-apprehension. The domain of the non-apprehension of the unobservable is the nature of both.

original: spyi dngos po med par gyur na dbye ba 'di dag mi rung ngo //
analyzed: spyi dngos po med par gyur na dbye ba 'di dag mi rung ngo //
translated: If the universal were a non-thing, these divisions would be untenable.

original: yang na gnyis ni dngos po grub pa yin la gcig ni dgag pa sgrub po zhes gang bstan pa de la /
analyzed: yang na gnyis ni dngos po grub pa yin la gcig ni dgag pa sgrub po zhes gang bstan pa de la /
translated: Again, it is taught that two are established things and one is an established negation.

original: dngos po nyid du mtshungs na ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med par dbye bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po nyid du mtshungs na ji ltar dngos po dang dngos po med par dbye bar bya zhe na /
translated: If they are the same in being things, how can they be divided into things and non-things?

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: yod med gnyi ga la brten phyir //
analyzed: yod med gnyi ga la brten phyir //
translated: Because it relies on both existence and nonexistence,

original: spyi de yang @30b rnam gsum yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyi de yang @30b rnam gsum yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the universal is also threefold.

original: spyi la ngo bo nyid kyi dbye ba med de dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi la ngo bo nyid kyi dbye ba med de dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here the universal does not have an intrinsic division because it is a non-thing.

original: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyig la brten pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dang gnyig la brten pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it relies on both existence and nonexistence,

original: spyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid can de rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: spyi shes pa'i ngo bo nyid can de rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: The general nature of consciousness is threefold.

original: de bas na de'i rgyu yang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa dag tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i rgyu yang 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa dag tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, its cause is also threefold: effect, nature, and non-apprehension.

original: 'di ltar yod par mngon par zhe na pa'i rtog pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis bskyed la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod par mngon par zhe na pa'i rtog pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyis bskyed la /
translated: Thus, the conception of existence is produced by the reason of nature.

original: med par zhen pa ni mi dmigs pas yin no //
analyzed: med par zhen pa ni mi dmigs pas yin no //
translated: The conception of non-existence is produced by non-apprehension.

original: gnyig 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyig 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis bskyed pa ste /
translated: The conception of both is produced by the reason of effect.

original: sgrub byed tha dad pa can ni yod pa dang med pa tha dad par byed pa 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: sgrub byed tha dad pa can ni yod pa dang med pa tha dad par byed pa 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: The reason of effect is a reason of different establishment, which makes the difference between existence and non-existence.

original: 'bras bu la ltos nas med pa yin la ngo bo nyid la ltos nas yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu la ltos nas med pa yin la ngo bo nyid la ltos nas yod pa ste /
translated: In dependence on the effect, it is non-existent; in dependence on its nature, it is existent.

original: gtan tshigs dang tha dad pa'i bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang tha dad pa'i bsgrub bya yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the probandum that is different from the reason.

original: yang na dngos po med pa yin yang yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa can yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa la brten nas rjes su dpag pa'i yul tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na dngos po med pa yin yang yod pa dang med pa dang gnyi ga'i nye bar len pa can yin pa'i phyir tha dad pa la brten nas rjes su dpag pa'i yul tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Or else, because it is the appropriator of existence, nonexistence, and both, it is the object of inference based on difference, because it is different.

original: yod pa nyid kyang gnyis te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul yin no //
analyzed: yod pa nyid kyang gnyis te tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi yul yin no //
translated: Existence is also twofold: different and not different, the object of the effect and nature reasonings.

original: med pa ni mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni mi dmigs pa'i yul yin no //
translated: Nonexistence is the object of nonapprehending.

original: gnyi ga la brten pa'i chos ni mi snang ba mi dmigs pa'i yul yin na //
analyzed: gnyi ga la brten pa'i chos ni mi snang ba mi dmigs pa'i yul yin na //
translated: The dharma based on both is the object of nonappearing nonapprehending.

original: de'i phyir gzhung dang ji ltar 'gal ba yin ;
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhung dang ji ltar 'gal ba yin ;
translated: Therefore, how is it that we contradict scripture?

original: gal te yod dang rjes 'brel phyir //
analyzed: gal te yod dang rjes 'brel phyir //
translated: Because it is related to existence,

original: yod shes dngos po'i rten can ni //
analyzed: yod shes dngos po'i rten can ni //
translated: The cognition of existence is not based on things,

original: min te lan btab zin phyir dang // 'das sogs gzhan du'ang mthong phyir ro //
analyzed: min te lan btab zin phyir dang // 'das sogs gzhan du'ang mthong phyir ro //
translated: Because we have already responded to this, and because we see it in other ways, such as in the past.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: With respect to the second, the treatise states:

original: 'o na gal te shes pa yod pa la brten pa yin na dngos po yod na 'byung ste yod pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir mngon sum bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te shes pa yod pa la brten pa yin na dngos po yod na 'byung ste yod pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir mngon sum bzhin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is based on the existence of consciousness, then it would occur when a thing exists, because it would be related to existence, like direct perception.

original: yod pa la brten pa'i shes pa yin zhes te yod pa yin 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa la brten pa'i shes pa yin zhes te yod pa yin 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: The response is: It is not the case that the consciousness based on existence is based on existence.

original: yod pa'i yul can nyid ni yod pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: yod pa'i yul can nyid ni yod pa'i ngo bo nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: The reason is that the subject of existence is the apprehension of the nature of existence.

original: rtog pa spyi'i yul can yod pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa spyi'i yul can yod pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: But conceptual thought, which has a universal as its object, does not apprehend existence.

original: dbang tshogs 'bras med thal phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang tshogs 'bras med thal phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that the collection of faculties would be without result.

original: zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This response has already been given.

original: 'on te yong pa yin na 'byung ba'i phyir yod pa'i yul can du brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yong pa yin na 'byung ba'i phyir yod pa'i yul can du brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if it is based on existence, then it would occur because it is based on existence.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: gzhan du yang ste yod pa ma gtogs par 'das pa la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang ste yod pa ma gtogs par 'das pa la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen elsewhere, that is, in the past and so on, apart from existence.

original: gal te spyi 'am gsal ba la shes pa 'jug na de'i tshe 'das pa la sogs pa'i @31a * //
analyzed: gal te spyi 'am gsal ba la shes pa 'jug na de'i tshe 'das pa la sogs pa'i @31a * //
translated: If consciousness engages a universal or an instance, then it would not be the consciousness of the past and so on.

original: yul can du sgra mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yul can du sgra mi 'gyur te /
translated: But it is not so, because the word ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is not changed.

original: yod pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba yin na 'das pa la sogs pa nyid la mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis snang ba yin na 'das pa la sogs pa nyid la mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it exists, it is by nature manifest, and it is not tenable that it is past, etc.

original: gal te de ltar med pa'am med pa rtogs pas mthong na ni de'i tshe spyi'i yod pa'i chos nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de ltar med pa'am med pa rtogs pas mthong na ni de'i tshe spyi'i yod pa'i chos nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one sees it as nonexistent or as existing through the understanding of nonexistence, then at that time the general nature of existence is destroyed.

original: de smras pa //
analyzed: de smras pa //
translated: He says:

original: dngos chos nyid nyams 'gyur zhe na ;üîΩ/ dngos por 'dzin pa sngon 'gro can //
analyzed: dngos chos nyid nyams 'gyur zhe na ; / dngos por 'dzin pa sngon 'gro can //
translated: If you say that the nature of the thing is destroyed,üîΩThe cognition of that has the apprehension of a thing as a prerequisite.

original: de shes yin phyir dgongs pa 'dis //
analyzed: de shes yin phyir dgongs pa 'dis //
translated: Therefore, this is the intention:

original: skyon 'di med ces bya ba ste //
analyzed: skyon 'di med ces bya ba ste //
translated: ‚ÄúThis fault does not exist.‚Äù

original: spyi'i shes pa de dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de la dmigs pa ci yang med de /
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa de dngos po mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba can yin pas de la dmigs pa ci yang med de /
translated: Since the cognition of the general has the perception of a thing as a prerequisite, it does not at all have that as its object,

original: spyi lkog tu gyur pas yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi lkog tu gyur pas yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the hidden universal is not an object.

original: 'di ltar spyi ni mngon sum ma yin te//
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi ni mngon sum ma yin te//
translated: Thus the universal is not a direct perception.

original: de yang ngo bo nyid kyis mi snang na ji ltar gzhal byar 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang ngo bo nyid kyis mi snang na ji ltar gzhal byar 'gyur //
translated: Moreover, if it is not manifest by nature, how can it be an object of knowledge?

original: de lta na ni spyi'i shes pa la yul ci yang med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni spyi'i shes pa la yul ci yang med pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the cognition of the universal would not be a valid cognition, because it has no object at all.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gzhal bya rang gi mtshan nyid gcig / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhal bya rang gi mtshan nyid gcig / ces bya ba la /
translated: The object of valid cognition is a single particular.

original: spyi zhes bya ba'i gzhal bya med de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba'i gzhal bya med de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no object of valid cognition called a universal, because it does not exist.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na dngos por gyur pa gzhal bya yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kho na dngos por gyur pa gzhal bya yin no //
translated: Only the particular, which is a real entity, is the object of valid cognition.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na //
translated: Why is that so?

original: de la don byed grub phyir dang // yod med nyid du dpyad phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la don byed grub phyir dang // yod med nyid du dpyad phyir ro // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is established as a functional entity, and because existence and nonexistence are investigated.

original: don bya ba byed nus pa'i dngos po'i yul yod pa dang med pa dag don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa ni don bya ba byed nus pa shes par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma rjes su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: don bya ba byed nus pa'i dngos po'i yul yod pa dang med pa dag don du gnyer ba'i rtog pa dang ldan pa ni don bya ba byed nus pa shes par bya ba'i phyir tshad ma rjes su tshol bar byed do //
translated: Those who seek a valid cognition in order to know the existent and nonexistent objects that are capable of functional performance, because they desire existence and nonexistence, seek a valid cognition in order to know the existent and nonexistent objects that are capable of functional performance.

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma gnyer ba dag don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma gnyer ba dag don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the pursuit of valid cognition would be pointless.

original: de bas na don byed pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na don byed pa'i dngos po ni yod pa ste /
translated: Therefore, a functional entity exists.

original: yod ba dpyad par nus pa ni don dang ldan pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: yod ba dpyad par nus pa ni don dang ldan pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: The existence of something is a valid object of analysis.

original: de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas don byed par grub pa'i phyir de nyid yod pa dang med par dpyad par bya'o ;
analyzed: de bas na rang gi mtshan nyid kho nas don byed par grub pa'i phyir de nyid yod pa dang med par dpyad par bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, since it is established that only intrinsic identity performs a function, it is that which is to be analyzed as existent or nonexistent.

original: / de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi gzhal bya ni rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu yin no //
analyzed: / de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gi gzhal bya ni rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of comprehension of direct perception and inference is only intrinsic identity.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul du byed na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid gcig pu mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul du byed na /
translated: If only intrinsic identity is taken as the object of direct perception and inference,

original: 'o na ni spyod yul gcig pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na ni spyod yul gcig pa'i phyir tshad ma gcig nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then because they have the same object, there would be only one valid cognition.

original: yul gcig kyang rkyen tha dad pas tshad ma tha dad par gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yul gcig kyang rkyen tha dad pas tshad ma tha dad par gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that although they have the same object, they are different valid cognitions because their conditions are different?

original: mig la sogs pa ni mngon sum gyi rkyen yin la tshul gsum ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin no zer na /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni mngon sum gyi rkyen yin la tshul gsum ni rjes su dpag pa'i rgyu yin no zer na /
translated: The eye and so on are the conditions of direct perception, and the three modes are the cause of inference.

original: de lta na ni gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni gzhal bya gnyis phyir zhes bya ba mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúBecause there are two objects of comprehension.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis kyang gang gi phyir mtshan nyid gnyis yin pa de'i phyir tshad @31b ma gnyis yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang gang gi phyir mtshan nyid gnyis yin pa de'i phyir tshad @31b ma gnyis yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] also says, ‚ÄúBecause there are two characteristics, there are two valid cognitions.‚Äù

original: rgyu rkyen gnyis las kyang tshad ma gnyis nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu rkyen gnyis las kyang tshad ma gnyis nyid de /
translated: There are also two valid cognitions because there are two causes and two conditions.

original: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis rnam pa du mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i shes pa ni rkyen gyi bye brag gis rnam pa du mar 'gyur te /
translated: The eye consciousness and so on are multiple in terms of the specific conditions.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of the eye consciousness is the eye and so on.üîΩThe cause of the nose consciousness is the nose and so on.

original: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni dril sogs pa'i phyir tshad ma mang por 'gyur ro //üîΩgzhal bya tha dad pa las tshad ma tha dad par gyur pa la yang sngon po la sogs pa du ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sna'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu ni dril sogs pa'i phyir tshad ma mang por 'gyur ro // gzhal bya tha dad pa las tshad ma tha dad par gyur pa la yang sngon po la sogs pa du ma'i yul can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there are many causes, there are many valid cognitions.üîΩAlso, because there are many objects of comprehension, there are many valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma mtha' yas par thal ba yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma mtha' yas par thal ba yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that because there are many objects such as blue, it follows that there are infinitely many valid cognitions?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: thams cad kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de yul du byed pa na tshad ma gcig kho na'o ;
analyzed: thams cad kyang rang gi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de yul du byed pa na tshad ma gcig kho na'o ;
translated: Because all of them are the intrinsic identity, when they are taken as objects, there is only one valid cognition.

original: /'o na ni rgyu rkyen tha dad kyang dbang po las skyes pa nyid yod pa'i phyir thams cad mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na ni rgyu rkyen tha dad kyang dbang po las skyes pa nyid yod pa'i phyir thams cad mngon sum du 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then since there is a difference in causes and conditions, and since there is arising from the sense faculty, is it not the case that everything is direct perception?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: dbang po las skyes pa nyid mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po las skyes pa nyid mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because arising from the sense faculty is not the definition of direct perception.

original: 'di ltar dbang po las skyes pa zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin gyi //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po las skyes pa zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang mngon sum gyi tshad ma ma yin gyi //
translated: Thus, arising from the sense faculty is not direct perception, even though one sees two moons.

original: yul dang bcas pa ni nges par tshad ma ste /
analyzed: yul dang bcas pa ni nges par tshad ma ste /
translated: But that which has an object is definitely a valid cognition,

original: gzhal bya la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bya la mi 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-erroneous with regard to the object of comprehension.

original: de bas na yul gnyis kho na la tshad ma gnyis yin te gzhan du na tshad ma mtha' yas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na yul gnyis kho na la tshad ma gnyis yin te gzhan du na tshad ma mtha' yas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, there are only two valid cognitions with regard to the two objects. Otherwise, there would be an infinite number of valid cognitions.

original: 'o na ji ltar gzhal bya gnyis nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzhal bya gnyis nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can there be two objects of comprehension?

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here, it is said:

original: de yi rang bzhin ngo bo dag //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin ngo bo dag //
translated: Because of the realization of its nature and essence,

original: rtogs phyir gzhal bya gnyis su bzhed //
analyzed: rtogs phyir gzhal bya gnyis su bzhed //
translated: the two objects of comprehension are accepted.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon du byed pas sngon po la sogs pa de mtha' yas pa nyid yin yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid mngon du byed pas sngon po la sogs pa de mtha' yas pa nyid yin yang rang gi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Since it is the manifestation of its own nature, even though blue, etc. are infinite, they are its particular inherent characteristic,

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mtshon cing shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mtshon cing shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are characterized and cognized by their own nature.

original: 'o na rtogs pa tha dad pas gzhal bya tha dad pa yin na don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na rtogs pa tha dad pas gzhal bya tha dad pa yin na don dam par rang gi mtshan nyid yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If the object of comprehension is different because of the difference in understanding, then the particular inherent characteristic would not exist ultimately,

original: mngon du 'dzin par byed pa med pa ni mi gsal bar rtogs pa yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du 'dzin par byed pa med pa ni mi gsal bar rtogs pa yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the non-manifestation of the apprehender is the non-clear understanding, and therefore it is not the particular inherent characteristic.

original: de bzhin du 'di ji ltar gzhal bya gcig nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di ji ltar gzhal bya gcig nyid de /
translated: In the same way, how is this one object of comprehension?

original: 'ga' zhig gis rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis rang gi ngo bo mngon du byed pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Because some manifest its own nature, it is the particular inherent characteristic.

original: gzhan ni mi gsal bar rtogs pas lkog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni mi gsal bar rtogs pas lkog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Others are not clear in their understanding, so they are hidden.

original: rtogs pa tha dad pas ni gzhal bya tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa tha dad pas ni gzhal bya tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of comprehension is not different because of the difference in understanding.

original: ltos nas gzhag pa'i tha dad pa brtags pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ltos nas gzhag pa'i tha dad pa brtags pa'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid yin no //
translated: because it is imputed to be different through being posited in dependence.

original: dngos po gcig gi yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid can yin na /üîΩmngon sum dang rjes @32a * //üîΩsu dpag pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gzhal bya gzhan yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po gcig gi yang rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid can yin na / mngon sum dang rjes @32a * // su dpag pa'i rang bzhin can gyi gzhal bya gzhan yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If even one thing has a specific and a general characteristic,üîΩthen there would be another object of comprehension that has the nature of direct perception and inference.

original: de la tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs yod pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: de la tshad ma gzhan gyi go skabs yod pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
translated: If there is no opportunity for another valid cognition, then why is it not the case that there is no opportunity for another object of comprehension?

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gal te gzhal bya don dam pa yin zhing de tha dad pas kyang tshad ma tha dad par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzhal bya don dam pa yin zhing de tha dad pas kyang tshad ma tha dad par 'gyur na /
translated: If the object of comprehension is ultimate and the valid cognitions are different because of the difference in objects of comprehension,

original: de'i tshe gzhal bya mtha' yas pa can gyi tshad ma rnams kyang mtha' yas par 'gyur ba zhig na spyi don dam pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhal bya mtha' yas pa can gyi tshad ma rnams kyang mtha' yas par 'gyur ba zhig na spyi don dam pa ma yin no //
translated: then at that time the valid cognitions would be infinite because of the infinite objects of comprehension, but the ultimate object is not infinite.

original: 'on te rtogs pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la ltos nas tha dad pa nyid du byed kyi /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la ltos nas tha dad pa nyid du byed kyi /
translated: If you say that the difference is made in terms of the difference or nondifference of the realizations,

original: don dam par gzhal bya med do zhe na /
analyzed: don dam par gzhal bya med do zhe na /
translated: then the ultimate object of comprehension does not exist.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: ngo bo nyid dmigs par gyur pa nyid yod pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dmigs par gyur pa nyid yod pa'o //
translated: The existence of the object of perception is itself existence.

original: dmigs pas shes par gyur pa yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: dmigs pas shes par gyur pa yod pa yin nam /
translated: Is the existence of the object of perception the existence of the perception?

original: dmigs par gyur pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs par gyur pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The existence of the object of perception is not existence.

original: bong bu'i rva la sogs pa mi dmigs par gyur pa med par nges pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bong bu'i rva la sogs pa mi dmigs par gyur pa med par nges pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the non-existence of the non-perception of the horn of an ass, etc. ascertained?

original: mthong na ni yod par tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir dmigs pa la yod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mthong na ni yod par tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir dmigs pa la yod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: When it is seen, it is called the object of perception, because it is conventionally existent.

original: de bas na don dam pa'i gzhal bya ni mngon sum pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don dam pa'i gzhal bya ni mngon sum pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object of ultimate cognition is itself perception.

original: 'o na gal te mngon sum pa nyid don dam par yod na 'ga' zhig gi yang mngon sum ma yin med par ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te mngon sum pa nyid don dam par yod na 'ga' zhig gi yang mngon sum ma yin med par ro zhe na /
translated: If perception itself exists ultimately, it is not the perception of anyone.

original: mngon sum nyid mngon sum yin par 'gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum nyid mngon sum yin par 'gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Perception is not itself perception,

original: mi gzhan la ltos nas kyang mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gzhan la ltos nas kyang mngon sum kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: but it is perception in dependence on another.

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa mi gzhan la ltos nas kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa mi gzhan la ltos nas kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid mi 'dor ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, in dependence on another person, blue, etc. is not abandoned as the nature of blue, etc.

original: 'o na ji ltar mi gzhan gyi lkog tu gyur pa 'ga' zhig gi mngon sum du gyur pa'i dngos por rtogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar mi gzhan gyi lkog tu gyur pa 'ga' zhig gi mngon sum du gyur pa'i dngos por rtogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: But how is it that what is hidden from one person is realized as an evident thing for another?

original: mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis lkog tu gyur pa yang rtogs par gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis lkog tu gyur pa yang rtogs par gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that what is hidden by the nature of direct perception is realized?

original: gal te yang 'ga' zhig gis mthong ngo zhes nges shing rang gis kyang nges na /
analyzed: gal te yang 'ga' zhig gis mthong ngo zhes nges shing rang gis kyang nges na /
translated: If someone says, ‚ÄúI see it,‚Äù and if one also ascertains it,

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then inference is pointless.

original: 'on te mngon sum pa nyid lkog tu gyur pa 'dod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te mngon sum pa nyid lkog tu gyur pa 'dod na ni /
translated: But if you assert that direct perception is hidden,

original: gang mngon sum de nyid lkog tu gyur par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang mngon sum de nyid lkog tu gyur par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could that direct perception itself be hidden?

original: de la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir lkog tu gyur pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is hidden because it is not observed,

original: mthong ba med pas mngon sum med pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: mthong ba med pas mngon sum med pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt it the case that direct perception itself does not exist because it is not seen?

original: ji ltar mi dmigs pas med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi dmigs pas med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could it be nonexistent because it is not observed?

original: 'o na dngos po la tshad ma ci zhig yod /
analyzed: 'o na dngos po la tshad ma ci zhig yod /
translated: Well then, what is the valid knowledge of things?

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa nyid lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po yod par grub pa'i tshad ma'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa nyid lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po yod par grub pa'i tshad ma'o zhe na /
translated: Or is inference itself the valid cognition that establishes the existence of a hidden thing?

original: rjes su dpag pa yang mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang mthong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is not inference also a seen entity?

original: de bas @32b na gsal ba'i rnam pa can nyid rjes su dpag par rigs so //
analyzed: de bas @32b na gsal ba'i rnam pa can nyid rjes su dpag par rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that inference has the aspect of a manifest thing.

original: 'on te phyis kyi shes pas sngar yod par shes par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'on te phyis kyi shes pas sngar yod par shes par byed ce na /
translated: But if the later cognition makes known what existed earlier,

original: gal te bltar rung ba med na ji ltar yod pa yin /
analyzed: gal te bltar rung ba med na ji ltar yod pa yin /
translated: if it is not suitable to be seen, how can it exist?

original: phyis mthong ba ni de nyid kyi tshe yod par rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyis mthong ba ni de nyid kyi tshe yod par rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not reasonable that what is seen later exists at that time?

original: 'on te sngar yod pa ma yin pa ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar yod pa ma yin pa ji ltar mthong bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if it did not exist earlier, how could it be seen?

original: sngar ni mthong bar gyur pas dngos po de zhen pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngar ni mthong bar gyur pas dngos po de zhen pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since it was seen earlier, is that thing not without attachment?

original: de'i rjes su dpag pas de nyid bsgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su dpag pas de nyid bsgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Its inference does not establish that.

original: yod par 'gyur ba ni tshad ma de las shes so zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: yod par 'gyur ba ni tshad ma de las shes so zhes bshad par bya'o //
translated: It should be explained that what exists is known from that valid cognition.

original: 'o na gal te mngon sum nyid kyi dngos po yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te mngon sum nyid kyi dngos po yin na /
translated: But if it is a thing that is directly perceived,

original: gzhal bya gzhan ji ltar yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzhal bya gzhan ji ltar yod pa yin zhe na /
translated: how can there be another object of apprehension?

original: de nyid gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is understood by the nature of another.

original: bltar rung ba'i ngo bo nyid thun mong ba'i tshul gyis khong du chud pa ni gzhal bya gzhan pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bltar rung ba'i ngo bo nyid thun mong ba'i tshul gyis khong du chud pa ni gzhal bya gzhan pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That which is understood by the common nature of what is suitable to be seen is called another object of apprehension.

original: de lta na ni ltos nas byas pa'i phyir spyi don dam par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni ltos nas byas pa'i phyir spyi don dam par yod par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, then because it is made in dependence, the universal would not exist ultimately.

original: de ni de bzhin te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin te /
translated: That is so.

original: spyi dngos po med pa'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: spyi dngos po med pa'o zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the universal is not a thing.

original: dngos po dang phrad par byed pa'i sgo nas tha snyad 'dogs pas du ma shes nas dngos po yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: dngos po dang phrad par byed pa'i sgo nas tha snyad 'dogs pas du ma shes nas dngos po yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: Because it is designated by way of contact with a thing, having understood the many, it is designated as a thing.

original: des na tha snyad 'dogs pa'i skye bo la ltos nas yul gnyis yin no //
analyzed: des na tha snyad 'dogs pa'i skye bo la ltos nas yul gnyis yin no //
translated: Therefore, in dependence on the person who designates, there are two objects.

original: gang yang gnyi ga'i ngo bo can gyi gzhal bya 'dzin pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod do zhes smra ba /
analyzed: gang yang gnyi ga'i ngo bo can gyi gzhal bya 'dzin pa'i tshad ma gzhan yod do zhes smra ba /
translated: But if someone says that there is another valid cognition that apprehends an object that has the nature of both,

original: de la smras ba /
analyzed: de la smras ba /
translated: then we would say this:

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid kyis tshad ma gcig 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid kyis tshad ma gcig 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: A single valid cognition does not engage the nature of both,

original: 'jug na ni tshad ma gnyis nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jug na ni tshad ma gnyis nyid yin no //
translated: because if it did, it would be two valid cognitions.

original: gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid can gyi gzhal bya khong du chud pa tha dad pa nyid las tshad ma tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi ngo bo nyid can gyi gzhal bya khong du chud pa tha dad pa nyid las tshad ma tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference of valid cognitions is due to the difference of the comprehensions of the objects of knowledge that have the nature of both.

original: yang na rtogs pa tha dad pas don dam pa ma yin pa nyid kyi gzhal bya tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: yang na rtogs pa tha dad pas don dam pa ma yin pa nyid kyi gzhal bya tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: Or, because of the difference of the realizations, the objects of knowledge are characterized by the difference of the non-ultimate.

original: gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid can gyi gzhal bya yod pa'i thal ba med de /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid can gyi gzhal bya yod pa'i thal ba med de /
translated: There is no entailment that the objects of knowledge that have the nature of both exist,

original: sngon po la sogs pa kho na dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa kho na dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only blue and so forth are the nature of things.

original: sgrub byed rtogs pa tha dad pas tshad ma dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub byed rtogs pa tha dad pas tshad ma dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The proof is that the valid cognitions are different because of the difference of the realizations.

original: de lta na ni don dam pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na ni don dam pa'i gzhal bya med pa'i phyir tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: In that case, because of the nonexistence of the ultimate objects of knowledge, would it not be the case that valid cognitions do not exist?

original: don dam pa'i gzhal bya med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i gzhal bya med pa ma yin no //
translated: The ultimate objects of knowledge do not not exist.

original: 'on kyang gzhal bya tha dad pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de thob par byed pa ni gang mngon sum du gyur pa de nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhal bya tha dad pa ni brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de thob par byed pa ni gang mngon sum du gyur pa de nyid rjes su dpag par bya ba'o //
translated: However, the different objects of knowledge are the imagined nature. That which is to be attained is that which is directly perceived, and that is to be inferred.

original: de bas na ngo bo nyid kyis dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi dpe'i rjes su 'gro bas don de nyid rtogs pa'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis @33a * //üîΩsu 'thad ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ngo bo nyid kyis dang gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi dpe'i rjes su 'gro bas don de nyid rtogs pa'i phyir gzhal bya gnyis @33a * // su 'thad ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because that object is understood through the inference that follows the example of the intrinsic nature and the nature of another, the two objects of knowledge are tenable.

original: 'o na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis don dam pa yul du byed pa'i phyir ji ltar tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa gnyis don dam pa yul du byed pa'i phyir ji ltar tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: If direct perception and inference are both engaged in the ultimate, how can they be different?

original: ngo bo nyid mngon du byed na mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mngon du byed na mngon sum nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the intrinsic nature is manifested, it becomes direct perception.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid la rjes su dpag pas ma reg na ji ltar de'i yul nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid la rjes su dpag pas ma reg na ji ltar de'i yul nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If the intrinsic nature is not touched by inference, how can it be its object?

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here it is said:

original: ji bzhin mngon zhen med pa yis //
analyzed: ji bzhin mngon zhen med pa yis //
translated: Without clinging to it as it is,

original: gnyis pa 'khrul pa dag tu bzhed //
analyzed: gnyis pa 'khrul pa dag tu bzhed //
translated: the second is accepted as mistaken.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: 'di'i don rtsa ba dang lo ma la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad pa de bzhin du mngon par zhen pa 'di la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i don rtsa ba dang lo ma la sogs pa'i dbye ba tha dad pa de bzhin du mngon par zhen pa 'di la med pa'i phyir /
translated: so there is no such manifest clinging in this.

original: ji bzhin pa'i mngon zhen med pa'o //
analyzed: ji bzhin pa'i mngon zhen med pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is no manifest clinging to the way things are.

original: des gnyis pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs pa 'khrul par brjod de /
analyzed: des gnyis pa gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs pa 'khrul par brjod de /
translated: By this, the second, the understanding through the nature of another is said to be mistaken.

original: sngar mthong pas bskyed pa'i bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba'i phyir dngos po la reg pa med kyang dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar mthong pas bskyed pa'i bag chags kyi stobs las byung ba'i phyir dngos po la reg pa med kyang dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from the power of the latent potentialities produced by previous seeing, it does not contact the thing, but it is the manifest clinging to the thing.

original: gzhan gyi tshul gyis rtogs na ni //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshul gyis rtogs na ni //
translated: If it understands through the nature of another,

original: 'khrul pa tshad ma nyid ma yin //
analyzed: 'khrul pa tshad ma nyid ma yin //
translated: the mistake is not a valid cognition.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is

original: gzhan gyi tshul gyis rtogs na ni de tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshul gyis rtogs na ni de tshad ma nyid du mi 'gyur te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it understands through the nature of another, it would not be a valid cognition, because it would be a mistake.

original: yang na gal te gzhan gyi tshul gyis rtogs na ni ji ltar dngos po de rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gal te gzhan gyi tshul gyis rtogs na ni ji ltar dngos po de rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if it understands through the nature of another, how could it understand that thing?

original: de la gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid rtogs na dngos po gzhan thob par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid rtogs na dngos po gzhan thob par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could the realization of the nature of another thing result in the attainment of another thing?

original: 'khrul pa nyid yin na tshad ma ni 'khrul pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid yin na tshad ma ni 'khrul pa ma yin no //
translated: If it were an error, then a valid cognition would be an error.

original: 'on te 'khrul pa nyid kyang mi bslu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te 'khrul pa nyid kyang mi bslu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin na /
translated: But if it is a valid cognition because it is non-deceptive even though it is an error,

original: mi bslu ba ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: mi bslu ba ji ltar yin te /
translated: how could it be non-deceptive?

original: gzhan rtogs na gzhan thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi bslu ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan rtogs na gzhan thob par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir mi bslu ba nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not non-deceptive because if one thing is realized, another thing is not attained.

original: 'dir smras pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa //
translated: Here we say:

original: bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
analyzed: bsam pa la ni slu med phyir //
translated: Because the intention is non-deceptive,

original: 'khrul pa yin yang tshad ma yin //
analyzed: 'khrul pa yin yang tshad ma yin //
translated: even though it is an error, it is a valid cognition.

original: rtogs pa'ang rnam pa gzhan du snang //
analyzed: rtogs pa'ang rnam pa gzhan du snang //
translated: The realization also appears in another aspect.

original: phyogs 'di'i lan yang btab zin to //
analyzed: phyogs 'di'i lan yang btab zin to //
translated: The response to this position has already been given.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here we say:

original: mngon sum yang ji bzhin pa'i don du mngon bar zhen par ji ltar shes te /
analyzed: mngon sum yang ji bzhin pa'i don du mngon bar zhen par ji ltar shes te /
translated: How do you know that direct perception is conceived to be a thing just as it is?

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don la mi bslu ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don la mi bslu ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is non-deceptive with regard to the intended object.

original: rtags las skyes pa'i 'khrul pa yang gal te bsam pa ste mngon par 'dod pa la slu ba med pa yod na de nyid tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtags las skyes pa'i 'khrul pa yang gal te bsam pa ste mngon par 'dod pa la slu ba med pa yod na de nyid tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: If the error that arises from a sign is not deceptive with regard to what is intended, that is, what is explicitly stated, then it is valid knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni bag chags kyi stobs las skyed pa mi gsal bar snang ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni bag chags kyi stobs las skyed pa mi gsal bar snang ba'o //
translated: Inference is a cognition that is generated from the power of latent potentialities. It is unclear and appears as if it were a direct perception.

original: gal te dngos por 'dzin pa ma yin pa de lta na yang tha snyad 'dogs pas dngos po 'dzin pa bzhin du rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: gal te dngos por 'dzin pa ma yin pa de lta na yang tha snyad 'dogs pas dngos po 'dzin pa bzhin du rtogs par byed de /
translated: Even though it does not apprehend a thing, it is as if it does apprehend a thing because it is designated as such.

original: de'i rjes su mthun pas kyang mi bslu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su mthun pas kyang mi bslu ba'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: It is valid knowledge because it is not deceptive with regard to what is similar to it.

original: 'on te tha snyad 'dogs pa rtags @33b las skyes pa'i shes pa la ji ltar dngos por sems she na /üîΩrjes su dpag pa dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on te tha snyad 'dogs pa rtags @33b las skyes pa'i shes pa la ji ltar dngos por sems she na / rjes su dpag pa dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: How can a cognition that is designated as a thing arise from a sign?üîΩInference is a cognition that apprehends a thing because it is a cognition that is designated as a thing.

original: rnam par rtog pa la dngos po med de dngos po nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la dngos po med de dngos po nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A conceptual cognition does not have a thing as its object because it does not have a definite thing as its object.

original: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis rang gi snang ba phyi rol du ston par byed pa'i phyir 'jug par byed pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: 'on kyang thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi stobs kyis rang gi snang ba phyi rol du ston par byed pa'i phyir 'jug par byed pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: However, because of the power of beginningless latent impressions, it causes one‚Äôs own appearances to be shown externally, and therefore it is called ‚Äúengaging.‚Äù

original: mthong ba la nges pas 'jug par rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba la nges pas 'jug par rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is suitable to engage by ascertaining what is seen.

original: gzhan du na mngon sum yang ji ltar 'jug par byed bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na mngon sum yang ji ltar 'jug par byed bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, how could direct perception also be an engaging cause?

original: de la yang thob bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid mi snang ste /
analyzed: de la yang thob bar bya ba'i ngo bo nyid mi snang ste /
translated: Because the nature of what is to be attained does not appear in that.

original: nye ba tsam zhig mngon sum pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba tsam zhig mngon sum pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the mere proximity appears to direct perception.

original: gzhan yang mngon sum nyid 'jug byed ma yin par rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon sum nyid 'jug byed ma yin par rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is reasonable that direct perception itself is not an engaging cause.

original: nye ba tsam gyi dngos po mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye ba tsam gyi dngos po mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it makes manifest the mere proximity of an entity.

original: mngon du byas ba tsam gyi rang bzhin la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon du byas ba tsam gyi rang bzhin la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the nature of mere manifestation is engaged,

original: 'jug pa mi 'chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa mi 'chad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that engagement would be uninterrupted.

original: 'o na mngon sum nyid da ltar byung ba kho na la gcig tu zhen nas ma 'ongs pa'i don la 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mngon sum nyid da ltar byung ba kho na la gcig tu zhen nas ma 'ongs pa'i don la 'jug go zhe na /
translated: Well, if direct perception is ascertained as only present, it engages the future object.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang thob par bya ba'i don la zhen nas rnam par rtog pa gzhan nyid 'jug par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang thob par bya ba'i don la zhen nas rnam par rtog pa gzhan nyid 'jug par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: And is not inference also engaged in order to conceive of an object to be obtained?

original: ci'i phyir khas mi len /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khas mi len /
translated: Why do you not accept this?

original: 'on te rang gi ngo bo nyid la don med pa la mngon bar zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi ngo bo nyid la don med pa la mngon bar zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that inference is not engaged because of the nonexistence of an object in its own nature,

original: rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa dang dngos po med pa la reg pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'jug par byed pa ma yin pa dang dngos po med pa la reg pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: then it is not a valid cognition because it is not in contact with a non-existent thing.

original: mngon sum ni dngos po la reg pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum ni dngos po la reg pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But direct perception is a valid cognition because it is in contact with an existent thing.

original: gang gi mngon sum don la reg pa'i cha de nyid kyis tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi mngon sum don la reg pa'i cha de nyid kyis tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: We reply, that part of direct perception which is in contact with an object is not a valid cognition,

original: 'jug par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir phrad par 'gyur ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir phrad par 'gyur ba'i dngos po 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not engaged, and because direct perception does not grasp an object with which it is in contact.

original: 'on te rtogs pa skyed pa'i mngon sum tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs pa skyed pa'i mngon sum tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that direct perception is a valid cognition because it produces understanding,üîΩwe reply,

original: ji ste gang gis de'i sgo nas mngon sum 'jug par byed par 'gyur ba'i rtog pa la 'jug par byed pa yod dam mngon sum rang nyid 'jug par byed pa yin na ni rnam par rtog pa skyed pas 'jug par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ste gang gis de'i sgo nas mngon sum 'jug par byed par 'gyur ba'i rtog pa la 'jug par byed pa yod dam mngon sum rang nyid 'jug par byed pa yin na ni rnam par rtog pa skyed pas 'jug par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is a conceptual cognition that engages the object by way of that, then it is not a conceptual cognition that engages by generating a representation.

original: de lta na 'o na rnam par rtog pa nyid 'jug par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na rnam par rtog pa nyid 'jug par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is direct perception itself that engages, then it is not a conceptual cognition that engages by generating a representation.üîΩIf it is a conceptual cognition that engages,

original: rnam par rtog pa la dngos po 'dzin pa med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la dngos po 'dzin pa med pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt it the case that a conceptual cognition does not apprehend an entity?

original: ji ltar dngos po la 'jug par byed pa yin /üîΩ'on te rnam par rtog pa dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin yang phyi rol du mngon par zhen nas 'jug go zhe na /üîΩrjes su dpag pa dngos po med pa 'dzin pa yin pa de lta na yang phyi rol du mngon par zhe na @34a * //
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po la 'jug par byed pa yin / 'on te rnam par rtog pa dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin yang phyi rol du mngon par zhen nas 'jug go zhe na / rjes su dpag pa dngos po med pa 'dzin pa yin pa de lta na yang phyi rol du mngon par zhe na @34a * //
translated: How can it engage an entity?üîΩIf you say that even though a conceptual cognition does not apprehend an entity, it engages by adhering to an external object,

original: nas 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: nas 'jug par byed pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: then even though inference apprehends a nonexistent entity, it would not engage by adhering to an external object.

original: de bas na tshad ma nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na tshad ma nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it would not be a valid cognition.

original: 'on te mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rtogs ba 'jug par byed par rigs te /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rtogs ba 'jug par byed par rigs te /
translated: Or, is it proper to say that the subsequent cognition that conforms with the perception engages the object?

original: mngon sum gyis dngos po bzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis dngos po bzung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the object is apprehended by direct perception.

original: rnam par rtog pas thob par bya ba la mngon sum mi 'jug pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas thob par bya ba la mngon sum mi 'jug pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that direct perception does not engage the object to be obtained by conceptual cognition?

original: de bas na de ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na de ji ltar 'dzin par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could it apprehend it?

original: 'on te thob par bya ba'i rgyun la mngon sum 'jug pa'i phyir thob par bya ba la yang 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te thob par bya ba'i rgyun la mngon sum 'jug pa'i phyir thob par bya ba la yang 'jug go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that direct perception engages the continuum of the object to be obtained, then it also engages the object to be obtained.

original: skad cig dang po la mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: skad cig dang po la mngon sum 'jug pa ma yin nam /
translated: But does direct perception not engage the first moment of the object?

original: gzhan la 'jug par gyur pa ni thob par bya ba la 'jug par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la 'jug par gyur pa ni thob par bya ba la 'jug par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: And that which engages the other moments is not able to engage the object to be obtained.

original: de lta na ni rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi ngo bo la 'jug pas don la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rjes su dpag pa yang rang gi ngo bo la 'jug pas don la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since inference engages its own nature, it would also engage the object.

original: 'o na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa don la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni btags pa tsam kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la 'jug pa'i rjes su dpag pa don la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni btags pa tsam kho nar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that inference that engages its own nature engages the object, then that would be mere imputation.

original: de lta na ni mngon sum yang skad cig ma dang po la 'jug pas thob par bya ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni brtags pa par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni mngon sum yang skad cig ma dang po la 'jug pas thob par bya ba la 'jug go zhes bya ba ni brtags pa par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would be a mere hypothesis to say that perception engages its object of attainment by engaging the first moment.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang phyi rol la zhe na yas 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa yang phyi rol la zhe na yas 'jug par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, inference is a valid cognition because it engages the external object by inferring it.

original: gang yang gang dang gang rtogs pa de dang de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid de dper na mngon sum bzhin no //
analyzed: gang yang gang dang gang rtogs pa de dang de ni rang gi ngo bo nyid de dper na mngon sum bzhin no //
translated: And whatever is understood is its own nature, like perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang rtogs pa'o //
translated: Inference is also understood.

original: de bas na rang gi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes brjod pa de la smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na rang gi ngo bo nyid yin no zhes brjod pa de la smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be its own nature.

original: rtogs pa yin yang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gzhan du mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa yin yang gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gzhan du mthong ba yin te /
translated: We reply: Even though it is understood, it is seen as different by another nature.

original: dper na nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nor bu'i 'od la nor bur shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the knowledge of a jewel is like the light of a jewel.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i yul can zhes pa'i phyogs 'di la yang /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni dngos po'i yul can zhes pa'i phyogs 'di la yang /
translated: And in this position that inference has a real object,

original: dbang tshogs 'bras min thal phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang tshogs 'bras min thal phyir ro //
translated: it follows that the collection of sense faculties is not the result.

original: zhes bya bas lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas lan btab pa yin no //
translated: This is the reply.

original: de bas na spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni dngos po med pa'i yul can no //
analyzed: de bas na spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa ni dngos po med pa'i yul can no //
translated: Therefore, the cognition that has a universal aspect has a non-entity for its object.

original: mngon sum gyi dang po sngon du mthong ba dang chos mthun pa nyid las don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dang po sngon du mthong ba dang chos mthun pa nyid las don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de ni rjes su dpag pa yin te /
translated: Inference is that cognition which arises from the similarity of what was previously seen, and which has an object that is capable of effective action.

original: mngon sum ni nye ba tsam snang ba can yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mngon sum ni nye ba tsam snang ba can yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Because perception has only the appearance of what is near.

original: sngar mthong ba 'dzin par byed pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba 'dzin par byed pa ni ma yin te //
translated: It does not apprehend what was previously seen,

original: ji srid du don byed pa nyid du mi shes pa de srid du 'jug par byed pas ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji srid du don byed pa nyid du mi shes pa de srid du 'jug par byed pas ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: because it is engaged as long as it does not know the capacity for effective action. How could it be otherwise?

original: de'i phyir don byed pa nyid du rigs pa ni sngar gyi chos mthun pa 'dzin pa'i mi gsal bas byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don byed pa nyid du rigs pa ni sngar gyi chos mthun pa 'dzin pa'i mi gsal bas byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the capacity for effective action is the cause of the apprehension of the similarity of the previous entity.

original: mngon sum ni @34b nye ba tsam gyis dngos po dang gsal ba 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni @34b nye ba tsam gyis dngos po dang gsal ba 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Perception apprehends the entity and the clarity through mere proximity.

original: de bas na mngon sum gyi don la 'jug pa yang rjes su dpag pa kho na las yin pa de'i phyir tshad ma gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum gyi don la 'jug pa yang rjes su dpag pa kho na las yin pa de'i phyir tshad ma gnyis yin no //
translated: Therefore, even the engagement with the object of perception is only through inference. For this reason, there are two means of valid knowledge.

original: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs pa yang tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyis rtogs pa yang tshad ma yin te /
translated: The realization of the nature of another is also a means of valid knowledge,

original: slu ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan to //
translated: because it is non-deceptive.

original: slu ba med pas tshad ma yin yang 'khrul pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩnor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag las //
analyzed: slu ba med pas tshad ma yin yang 'khrul pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir // nor bu sgron ma'i 'od dag las //
translated: In order to demonstrate that, although it is a means of valid knowledge because it is non-deceptive, it is still mistaken,üîΩit is said:üîΩFrom the light of a jewel or a lamp,

original: nor bu blo yis mngon rgyug pa //
analyzed: nor bu blo yis mngon rgyug pa //
translated: the mind runs to the jewel or the lamp.
